loans.name: Paulus

texts.en:
Paulus lives in Kaloleni area near Mariakani Kenya. He is 59 years old and he is married with nine children. He owns a retail shop in the local market. He started the business nine years ago from the proceeds of his farm. 

He learned of Milango through friends and he decided to join so that he could access capital for his business. The major challenges in the business include price changes and high fuel and transportation costs. He hopes that his business will grow in the next five years and he will become a wholesaler.

He seeks a loan to buy maize, beans and greegrams for his business. He will use the income that he will raise to buy a deep freezer for the business.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and greegrams.

loans.name: Cheene

texts.en:
Cheene is a married woman and a mother of three young children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in fishing business with her husband for over three years. This is the source of their income. 
Cheene is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Cheene hopes of making their fishing business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets

loans.name: Nickson

texts.en:
Nickson is a 30-year-old businessman in Mwingi. He is married to Rosyline, and they are blessed with one child, aged three. He runs a business of selling assorted goods. He currently lacks enough funds needed to purchase enough goods to serve his ever-growing customer base. 

Nickson is requesting his first loan from KADET LTD. With a loan through KADET LTD, Nickson will be able to purchase more wrist watches, radios, cups, jugs and thermos flasks for resale at a profit. The additional income created will allow him to expand his business to include a boutique and purchase a photocopier machine. 

In the future, Nickson would like to have children and start investing in his child’s education, and finance his spouse to pursue a degree in nursing.

loans.use: to purchase more wrist watches, radios, cups, jugs and thermos flasks.

loans.name: Cherry Ann

texts.en:
Cherry Ann is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a welding shop in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF, to buy additional materials like welding rod, iron, etc for her welding business.

Cherry Ann has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from farming rice.

Cherry Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like welding rods, iron, etc.

loans.name: Abibe

texts.en: Abibe comes from the Roma community. She is a 41-year-old, married mother of three children between the ages of 12 and 22 years old. For more than five years now, she and her husband have been running a second-hand business selling used clothes and shoes. Usually they purchase these items from different foreign countries and then sell them in the big market outlet for all of Kosovo. They are both very satisfied with this business and are planning in the future to have their own boutique from which to sell clothing and shoes. At this time, they would like to have a loan in order to purchase more items to sell and increase their income and client base, which Abibe hopes will help her to be able to give her children a better education in the future. She really appreciates this support!

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Naftal

texts.en: Naftal lives in Kongowea area and he is 24 years old. He is a single businessman and he has been in the newspaper vending business for the last two years. The business is growing and now he wants to add to the stock of newspaper that he supplies. He started the business from the savings that he made from previous employment. He learned about Milango through friends who asked him to join them so that he could save and be able to access funding for the business when he wanted to expand his operations. He now seeks a loan to buy more newspapers and increase his customer base. He faces the challenge of finding customers and the rains that cause sales to go down. He will use the income that he raises to put back in to the business.

loans.use: to buy more newspapers

loans.name: Mirsad

texts.en:
Mirsad is a 23-year-old married father of a 1 year old child, and expecting his second soon. He is from Ashkali community, and for a long time, he has been running a second-hand business, selling and fixing used shoes. He buys these shoes from other countries and then sells them in the big market outlet to locals in Kosovo.

Misrad is satisfied providing for his family in this way, and says that the business is profitable and he enjoys it. He is now asking for a loan in order to purchase more used shoes to sell, allowing him to continue his business and generate a larger income. His goal is to open a shop and hopes in the future, to be able to offer his children a better education. He and his family really appreciate the support.

loans.use: To purchase more used shoes for selling

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is 40 years old, married to Isaac and they are blessed with four children between 7 and 19 years old. They support both of the children. She runs a food processing kiosk in Kapsabet town. She has been in this business for the last six years. From this business she gets a monthly income of KSHS 30,800. 

She has borrowed a loan of KSHS 60,000 to purchase baking powder, yeast, wheat flour, sugar, salt, eggs, preservatives, food color and cooking oil among other ingredients that she may need for her baking business. 

With the anticipated profits she will be able to put more savings aside as well as repay back her loan. Her dream is to give the best to her family by meeting the financial needs and giving the best education to her children, expanding her business and opening branches in other nearby towns.

loans.use: To purchase baking ingredients .

loans.name: Musli

texts.en: Musli is 26 years, married, and a father of two children aged 3 and 5 years old. His wife is a stay-at-home-mother and cares for the home and children while he works as a construction worker. This wonderful and loving family lives in unacceptable conditions in the Ashakli community, in a very old home that has not been repaired or renovated for quite some time due to lack of funds.  For the first time, Musli is requesting a loan in order to renovate and repair his home, so that he can provider better conditions for his family to live in.  He hopes that in the future he will be able to give his family a better qualify of life and his children a better education. He really appreciates the help.

loans.use: To renovate his home

loans.name: Jamuhuri

texts.en:
Jamhuri lives in the Kongowea area, north of Mombasa, Kenya. He is 31 years old and he sells charcoal in the local market. He has been in the business for one year now, and the business is growing. He is a married man with three children to take care of. Two of his children are in school. 

He knew of Milango through friends, and now he seeks a loan to buy 17 bags of charcoal for sale in the business. The challenges that he faces in the business are high competition and high costs for transportation. He hopes that his business grows and that he will be able to reach a larger number of customers in the next five years. 

He will use the income that he will raise to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy 17 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin, a married father of three from Embu, has a business as a mixed crop farmer. He is married to Mary, who helps him in farming. Martin also does masonry, a business which supplements his income. He earns a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family. 

This marks his first loan term with KADET. With the loan he has applied for from KADET LTD, he will be able to purchase pigs for rearing. The additional income created will allow him to improve the standard of living for his family. 

In the future, Martin would like expand his farming land and be able to provide for his family fully. He hopes to save money to educate his children to the university level.

loans.use: to purchase pigs for rearing.

loans.name: Muniri

texts.en: Muniri is 26 years old married and blessed with one child. She runs a chemist business in the Likoni area, where she also resides. She started this business three years ago. She learnt about Milango through friends, and she joined, so that she could access credit to fund her business. She hopes that the business will grow in the next five years to become a leading pharmacy in the area. She now asks for a loan to buy medicine for sale in her business. The challenges that she faces in the business include seasonality and competition from other traders. The income that she will raise, will improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy medicine

loans.name: Muslem

texts.en:
Muslem is a hardworking grocer from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and has two children. Muslem is the sole provider for the family.

In his grocery store, Muslem provides various products for his neighborhood, like dairy products, canned foods, snacks, drinks and detergents. He established his business in 2012 and through practice, he gained his experience. Muslem is well known in the neighborhood with an excellent reputation.

Muslem is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD in order to renovate his grocery store. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits in order to provide a better income for his family and to educate his children.

loans.use: to renovate his grocery store.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: Esperanza madre soltera con cinco hijos los cuales dos aun están bajo su responsabilidad, originaria del municipio de Chinandega zona ubicada en el occidente del país, ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable, con muchos deseos de superación personal, en sus ratos libres le gusta disfrutar con sus hijos los deliciosos platillos como: vigoron con charrasca, indio viejo, nacatamales entre otros mas ,ella lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico en su familia y en la pobreza en la que Vivian no pudo terminar sus estudios los cuales solo aprendió a leer y escribir, debido a que se vio en la necesidad de trabajar para ayudar en los gastos de su familia, pero gracias a su desempeño y deseos de superación ella logra salir adelante junto con sus hijos, logrando poner su negocio de ventas de frijoles, leña, piñatas entre otros mas. Uno de los cambios que ella desea realizar en su hogar es poder reparar el pequeño taller que tiene donde elabora las preciosas piñatas que realiza, al igual que en un futuro desea construir un cuarto en su casa de habitación. El objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en capital de trabajo como: compra de frijoles, leña, ajo, almidón, papel periódico, papel crepe entre otros, Esperanza agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.-
texts.en:
Esperanza is a single mother with five children, of whom she is still responsible for two. She is a native of Chinandega municipality, an area located in the west of the country. She is known as a hardworking, responsible woman who greatly desires to improve herself. In her spare times she likes to enjoy delicious dishes with her children such as “vigoron con charrasca,” “indio viejo” and “nacatamales,” among others.

Unfortunately due to her family’s lack of resources and their poverty, she was not able to finish her studies. She only learned to read and write because she had to go to work to help her parents with expenses. However, thanks to her hard work and desire to improve she was able to get ahead with her children. She opened a business selling beans, firewood and piñatas, among other products. 

One of the changes Esperanza wants to make in her home is to refurbish the shop where she makes her beautiful piñatas. In the future, she also wants to add a room to her house. She will use this loan as working capital to purchase beans, fire wood, garlic, starch, newspaper and crepe paper, among other items. She is very grateful for the support that Kiva lenders are providing to people with scarce resources.

loans.use: to purchase beans, firewood, garlic, starch, newpapers, crepe paper and white glue.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes, a 39-year-old married mother of two from Thika, earns a living for her family by selling clothes. Her spouse, Thomas, is also a businessman. Due to limited income to fund her business, she has been unable to expand her business. That is why she decided to request a third loan from KADET LTD to enable her to purchase more bales of clothes; thus expand her customer base, which in return will increase her sales and increase her profits, too. 

With the additional income she will earn from this improvement, she will save for her children’s education and repay her loan. 

In the future, Agnes would like to continue to invest in her children’s education and see them become responsible people in the community. She also dreams of owning a permanent residential house.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothes.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married, 35-year-old mother of two in Thika. Agnes has been running a grocery shop for the past thirteen years, with a monthly income of KES 20,000 which she uses to support her family. Agnes is applying for her seventh loan from KADET LTD after she was introduced by an existing KADET client. 

She will use the loan to purchase potatoes, kale, tomatoes, onions and cabbages in bulk for her grocery store. She will plough back the proceeds into the business and pay school fees for her children. She also plans to repay her loan promptly. 

She hopes to educate her children to college level and secure their future.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, kale, tomatoes, onions and cabbages in bulk.

loans.name: Kamel

texts.en:
Kamel is from Iraq. He is 38 years old, married and lives with his parents. Kamel takes care of the family income all by himself.

Kamel owns a carpentry. He specializes in making doors, windows and furniture. Kamel has much experience in this field. He has been in this field for more than 10 years and established his own business in 2010. Now Kamel has a hired employee and being well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Kamel is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to buy a wood-cutting machine and to increase his lumber inventory. Kamel is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits in order to enhance the current financial conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy a wood-cutting machine and to increase his lumber inventory.

loans.name: Zorica

texts.en:
Zorica lives in one of the minority communities of Kosovo. She is 49 years old, married, and a mother of a 16-year-old daughter. Her husband works in administration, and she is a teacher in a high school. 

For more than ten years now, Zorica and her husband have been beekeepers, making honey and caring for the ten hives that they currently have. She is very satisfied with this business, as she generates much money from selling honey because her customer demand is great. This is due to her honey being original and natural. 

Business has been so good that Zorica is requesting a loan to purchase ten more beehives in order to keep up with her customer demands. This loan will help her to increase her income even more and provide a better future for her family. She really appreciates this help.

loans.use: to purchase ten more beehives in order to keep up with her customer demands.

loans.name: Maksim

texts.en:
Maksim is a first-year student at the American University of Central Asia, department of Psychology. Here is his story:

“Considering myself as a quite serious and ambitious person, knowing how education is important in the modern society, I made a certain research of all universities in Kyrgyzstan. On balance with all pros and cons, I decided for myself that I want to study at the American University of Central Asia. There are a couple of reasons which hit me upon the idea to study there, such as: quality of education, strong teaching staff, uncommon system to study compared with other local universities, an opportunity to get two diplomas, a possibility to create your own studying schedule and choose subjects in accordance with your interest and preferences. 

To achieve my dream, I created an action plan. As a first step, I entered AUCA preparatory courses. Just in a half-year, I improved my TOEFL results from 430 to 519. My maths score/knowledge also became much better. This experience gave me an opportunity to see how the process of studies flows in AUCA. 

Another reason which attracts more students is financial aid. I would like to apply for Kiva loan, too, as it will help me to cover my tuition fees at AUCA.”

loans.use: to pay for his higher education.

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en:
Ketevan is a 23-year-old young woman. She lives in the Rustavi district with her brother and parents. Her brother works in security at a local pharmacy. Her father works at a furniture workshop and gets a small monthly income. 

Ketevan decided to start her own business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $2,000 for opening a pet shop. She already has rented a commercial space and with the received credit, she will purchase all the equipment and stock for the shop. 

Ketevan thinks that the business will be very profitable, as there is no similar kind of business around, and she is so motivated to offer great service to her clients.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and stock to open a pet shop.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is very thankful for the financial assistance extended to him as he was able to buy the needed spare parts for his jeepney. The loan also helped in the education of his children. His income from the business assisted their everyday expenses at home. He and his wife are working hard to provide for their everyday expenses.

He would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for him to buy spare parts for the maintenance of their jeepney unit and also to buy some equipment in their repair shop. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain the daily needs and educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Titus dreams of being more successful in business and hopes to have a good life. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week, and this is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of the Jeepney unit.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia runs a sari-sari or variety store in Bien Unido, Bohol. Claudia has been in the business for more than 9 years now.

Claudia is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candy, soda, soap and toiletries, sugar, coffee and more. With this, she will be able to improve her stock thus allowing her to sell more products to her customers. In the future, Claudia hopes to make her business a success and a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more stock like canned goods, candy, soda, soap and toiletries, sugar and coffee to resell

loans.name: Orxan

texts.en:
Orxan is 31 years of age, married and he has 2 kids. He is a very well known barber. He established his business in 2001, and through practice, he mastered this field. He is his family’s sole breadwinner. He is responsible for the living expenses of three members of his family. For this reason, he works hard and puts substantial effort into continuing to improve his business. 

In April 2012, he opened his current shop and is working hard to develop it. Because his income is low compared to his high expenses, Orxan can’t save enough cash to improve and develop his business. For this reason, he is acquiring a loan of AZN 1,300 from Kiva's partner Aqroinvest to increase his business capital with special gels, beauty supplies and the necessary tools for developing his business.

loans.use: to increase his business capital with special gels and beauty supplies

loans.name: Huseyin

texts.en:
Huseyin is 23 years of age and single. He lives with his parents in his own town and he has owned a clothes shop since 2010. He has three years of experience working in selling clothes. 

Today, he is applying for a loan of 1,200 AZN  from Kiva partner Aqroinvest  to purchase a new winter clothes collection and be able to increase his profits by a large percentage. He is very positive about his  future and wishes to expand his  operation by opening a shoe shop next to his  existing store.

loans.use: to purchase a new winter clothes collection

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her from her previous loan. She was able to buy the needed materials for her tailoring business. Her income from her business is helpful for her everyday expenses. At her age, she still works hard so that she won't be a burden to her children.

She would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Anita hopes that her business will continue and she dreams to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their lives and businesses every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, and other materials needed in her business

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia is a married woman from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She has been engaged in the tricycle transport business along with her husband for more than five years now. This is the source of their income. 

Eulalia is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for their tricycle such as a wheel tire, chains, and nuts and bolts. With this, they will be able to maintain the good working condition of the tricycle. In the future, Eulalia hopes of making their business a success.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle such as the wheel tire, chains, and nuts and bolts

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is a married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is a mother of three, grown up children . Florencia has been in the fishing business for more than 30 years now. 

Florencia is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. Florencia dreams of expanding their fishing business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets

loans.name: Seline

texts.en:
Seline, a 38-year-old married mother of four from Thika, earns a living for her family by operating a tailoring shop. She has been in this business for the past eight years and earns a monthly income of KES 7,800, which she uses to support her family. This marks her second loan from KADET LTD and she is grateful for the support she has been receiving, which has made it possible to grow her business. 

She intends to use the loan to purchase more cloth materials to make clothes for her customers. The additional income created will allow her to improve the standard of living for her family and invest in her children’s education. 

She hopes to save money to educate her children to the college level and purchase a plot to build a permanent residential house.

loans.use: to purchase more materials to make clothing

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is a married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is engaged in a fishing business together with her husband. This is their source of income. Lilia is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. Lilia hopes of making their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en:
Rodah lives in the highland area of Eldoret. She is an established farmer, who has done farming for 16 years. She does dairy, poultry and crop farming. She does it as a source of income. Feeding animals during the dry seasons is a major challenge to her, while she enjoys milking her dairy cows the most.

She chose Juhudi Kilimo to finance her because she saw how her neighbor's livelihood had been improved through Juhudi. When asked what she learned from the microfinance training, she said that "if you take a loan one should not divert the funds to suit your needs." 

This loan will enable her to purchase a dairy cow; milk production will increase and thus lead to an increase in her income. This will improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Urukundo Cb B Group

texts.en: Eugenie is 36 years old. She is married to a farmer. She is a group leader of the group Urukundo in Kinyarwanda, which means Love in English. The group members sell different items in their businesses and they have come together in the group to work hard in for better improve their businesses. Eugenie sells foodstuffs and has been running the business for the past ten years. With this loan, she would like to buy more foodstuffs, such as beans and bananas for sale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs for sale, such as beans and bananas for sale.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
This is Gina, 45, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jacinto, a mason and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Gina operates a food stall. In the Philippines.The whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. 

Gina dreams that her business will flourish and hopes to have a beautiful life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Zivka

texts.en: Zivka lives in a minority community in Kosovo. She is single and lives only with her sister. In the past, she used to work in an electrical company but is now receiving a pension just like her sister is. The pensions are their main source of income, which is usually enough to meet their daily needs. However, as they live in an old house, they would like to be able to purchase material in order to fortify the facade of the inside and outside of the house before the winter comes. For this reason, for the first time, she request a loan in order to buy material for facade the house. This will allow them to have better insulation and prevent leaks or drafts during the cold and wet winter season, which is quickly approaching. Zivka is hoping to be able to save money in the future and is grateful to all of the lenders.

loans.use: to buy materials for the facade of the house

loans.name: Maylinda

texts.en:
Maylinda is a married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is a mother of three children. Maylinda is engaged in a food vending business. She sells snack foods like tempura. This is the source of her income.
Maylinda is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients for tempura. With this she will be able to sell more, thus augmenting her sales and income. Maylinda has hopes of expanding her business in the future. She also wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for tempura

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new engine for fishing boat

loans.name: Ronanisa

texts.en:
Ronanisa is a seaweed farmer from Bien Unido. She is a married woman and has three children.
Ronanisa is asking for a loan to buy seaweed seedlings, rope and straw. With this she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her harvest and yield.  In the future, Ronanisa wants to expand her farm so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family and for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings, rope and straw

loans.name: Ngwa Christina

texts.en:
She is married and a mother of five children. They live in a two room apartment in Bamenda, in the North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life, including sickness, the death of her twin children, death of her parents, thieves that broke into her house, and financial difficulties have been problems in her life.

With this new loan requested she will buy her food stuff for sales, chickens and feed for the fowl, fire wood, sweets, oil, and seedlings for her farm. She holds a positive view of this business succeeding because she has been doing it for long and has regular customers who buy from her and also because the demand for food stuff is high. With this business activity, the community will benefit from her moderate prices, and she provides food for a rapidly increasing population, and the manure from the chickens will be used on farms to increase harvest.

With the profit from this loan, she will cater for her family needs, ensure her children have education, provide food for the family and will also expand her business. She prefers loans form GHAPE because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and also the members are trained on marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed, social needs of members are catered for at GHAPE

loans.use: To buy groundnuts, seedlings, firewood, sweets, and oil,

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a seaweed farmer from Bien Unido. She is a married woman and has two children.
Rosalie  is asking for a loan to buy seaweed seedlings, rope and straw.  With this she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her harvest and yield.  In the future, Rosalie wants to expand her farm so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family and for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings, rope and straw

loans.name: Al-Boshra Group

texts.en: Jamila is 50 years old and married with two children. She lives in Aden, Yemen, and is a member of a group called Al-BOSHRA, which is made up of three women who live in the same city. Jamila is a very active woman, and sells different items like yeast and rechargeable phone cards. She works every day, and is able to make a fair monthly profit. She used her first loan to start selling clothes, and will use this loan for 70,000 Yemen Rials (YER) from AMB to buy phones and rechargeable phone cards to sell. She and other members of this group thank Kiva lenders for funding this loan.

loans.use: to buy phones and rechargeable phone cards to sell.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en: Teofila is a seaweed farmer from Bien Unido. She is married and has three grown children. She is asking for a loan to buy seaweed seedlings, rope and straw. With this loan, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm and thus augment her harvest and yield. In the future, Toefila wants to expand her farm so that it will generate more revenue to meet the needs of her family for food and other items.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings, rope and straw

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a married woman and a mother of four children from Trinidad, Bohol. Leonila is engaged in fish vending for more than 13 years now. 

Leonila is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell. With this, she will be able to improve her sales, thus augmenting her profit and income. Leonila hopes to make her business a success and sustainable. Moreover, she wants to save money to pay for the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Rachael is married and the mother of five children who lives with her family in a four-room apartment in Bamenda, in the North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced some challenges in life, one of which is inadequate finance to set up a business of her own, meet her family's needs and educate her children. She has also had to cope with the sickness and death of her brother. Rachael will use this loan to buy dresses such as gowns, blouses and skirts. She believes her business will succeed because she has been in this line of work for a long time and has regular customers who buy from her and who always need dresses. Her business benefits her community because she sells for moderate prices, and meets the needs of a rapidly increasing population made up of people who need to clothe and protect their bodies. She will use the money she earns from this loan to meet her family's needs, ensure her children get an education, pay hospital bills for her family, buy food and also expand her business She prefers loans form GHAPE because of low interest rates, convenient repayment terms and the training on marketing she receives before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts and gowns.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
This is Yolanda. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child, in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy supplies such as seed and fertilizer needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs and her child's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Yolanda hopes to be more successful in business and dreams that her family will always be in good condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for supplies such as seed and fertilizer needed in her business.

loans.name: Patience's Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of four members, all women. The leader of this group is Patience, who makes a living selling rice and cooking oil from her home in the city of Accra-Teshie. This is her sixth loan with the organization and Patience is going to use it to buy ten bags of rice and two big gallons of 'frytol' cooking oil, so that she can offer her customers a variety of rice products. Her reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving her business. 

Patience is a very hard-working person and she is grateful for the opportunity provided because this loan will allow her to grow her business.

Together with the other members, they are requesting for a total amount of GHS 3,700 to improve their businesses.

loans.use: to buy ten bags of rice and two big gallons of 'frytol' cooking oil, so that she can offer her customers a variety of rice products.

loans.name: Mt Ulunguru Group

texts.en:
Mgeni, who is in her early 50s, is married with two children who are grown up.  She has a grandkid staying with her and still at school.  She has been running a retail food shop for five years now. Mgeni's business is located near a school and she uses that opportunity to sell sweets and some small bites that students mostly like.  She works from 6.30 am to 10.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be her 10th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which she managed to pay back successfully, she bought more dry food items missing from her food shop. She also managed to buy a few sweets and bites, which she normally sells to students. Mgeni used her profit to build a house, buy a car, home sofa set, TV, fridge and a nice dining table. She paid school fees for her grandkid. She will use this loan to buy more rice, cooking oil, juice, and other items that are in high demand for resale. Mgeni dreams of improving her business so that she can earn a high profit to develop her idle farm and start farming.

She will share this loan with her loan group, Mt Ulunguru, which consists of eight members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more rice, cooking oil, juice, and other items to resell.

loans.name: Kadior Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe faisant du banc villageois créer le 23 Mars 2013. Ce groupe est constitué suite à une bonne entente et une bonne progression des membres. Madame Fatou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, mère de quatre enfants et âgée de 52 ans. Son activité principale est la vente de légume qu'elle pratique depuis plusieurs années. Avec ce prêt sollicité Madame prévoit d'acheter 12 sacs de légumes. Les profits tirés de cette activité serviront à participer à la prise en charge des frais de scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
This group is part of the banc villageois created on March 23, 2013. It was formed as a result of the friendships and excellent progress made by its members. 

Their representative is Fatou, raising her hand on the right in the photo. She is 52 years old, married, and has four children. Her main business is selling vegetables, which she has done for several years.

With the requested loan, she plans on purchasing 12 bags of vegetables. The income from this business will help her contribute to paying her children’s schooling fees.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 40-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling milk for the past seven years. She has one cow which she uses for milk, selling to the people of her locality. Bushra has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

For the improvement of her business she has applied for a loan of PKR 20,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. Bushra is hopeful that this loan will be productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in the fishing business for more than four years now. This is the source of their income. 

Virginia is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell. In the future, Virginia wants to expand their fishing business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets

loans.name: Tajo

texts.en: Tajo is 25 years old, active, married and has for the last five years run a hand-embroidery business. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. She wants to grow her business to help meet these challenges, and has requested a loan for Rs 20,000 to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet increasing customer demand. This will also allow her to fill orders on time. She expects to boost her earnings and wants to spend her money on the betterment of family members.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en: Ms. Salma is 35 years old, active and the mother of three children, and she has earned a living for many years by making clothing. She works for many people in her community and uses the income she earns to support her family. However, due to a lack of funds she is unable to satisfy the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she has requested a loan for Rs 20000 from the Kashf Foundation to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of lace, zippers and buttons. This will allow her to increase her income. This is her first loan and she is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy thread, lace, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Gie Felitbe Liguade Group

texts.fr:
Le GIE FELITBE LIGUADE  est un groupement composé de 4 femmes qui se sont réunie s par voisinage Madame Houlimata qui est leur présidente   est une femme très active et très brave  âgée de  54 ans. Elle exerce le commerce depuis  22 ans .Elle est marié et mère de cinq enfants dont  l’ainé est âgé de 35 ans et le cadet  de 02 ans. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer vers les coups se 20h. 
Son activité consiste à vendre des fruits comme orange, pomme, banane et d’autres fruits de la période.
Avec le prêt elle va acheter des fruits et de l’arachide qu’elle transforme en cacahuètes. Elle est pris en charge par ses enfants ce qui lui permet de réinvestir  son bénéfice dans l’activité. Elle souhaite ouvrir un grand magasin de vente de produits divers.
texts.en:
GIE FELITBE LIGUADE is a group made up of 4 women who all live in the same neighborhood. Houlimata, their president, is an active and fearless 54-year-old woman. She has been in business for 22 years. She is married and has 5 children, ranging in age from 2 years old to 35 years old. 

She begins her days at 8 a.m., and finishes around 8 p.m. Her main business is selling fruit, like oranges, apples, bananas, and other fruits that are in season. 

With the loan, she will buy fruits and peanut plants in order to prepare and sell the peanuts. Her children are taking care of her financially, so she is able to reinvest all of her profits into her business. She hopes to open up a large store to sell a variety of products.

loans.use: to buy and sell a variety of products, like fruits and peanuts.

loans.name: Gie Farba Group

texts.fr:
Le GIE FARBA est un groupement composé de 5 femmes  qui se sont connus par voisinage et habitent dans le meme quartier. Leur président Mariam est une brave femme qui évolue dans la vente des prêts à porter et des tissus. c'est elle qui a levé la main sur la photo. 
Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Agée de 44ans, elle a choisi ce métier par amour, ainsi elle a besoin de ce montant pour augmenter son stock de marchandise en achetant et revendre des prêts à porter. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Mariam commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 13h. A l’avenir elle souhaite ouvrir une grande boutique de prêt à porter et avoir le monopole du marché de sa commune.
texts.en:
GIE FARBA is a group made up of 5 women who met because they all live in the same neighborhood. Mariam, their president, is an honest woman who sells ready-to-wear clothing and fabrics. She is raising her hand in the photo. 

Mariam is 44 years old and married with children. She chose this business out of love, and needs money to expand her stock of merchandize buy buying and selling ready-to-wear items. She helps her husband manage their daily expenses and pay for their children’s schooling. Her days begin at 8 a.m. and end at 1 p.m. 

In the future, she hopes to open a large ready-to-wear clothing store and corner the market in her town.

loans.use: to buy fabric and ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: Williams Alexander

texts.es:
Williams de 27 años, realizo sus estudios hasta bachillerato (nivel medio), su estado civil actual es soltero, vive solo en su casa de habitación, desde pequeño vivió son su abuela materna pues sus padres tuvieron problemas y decidieron separarse, su madre se fue a vivir a Belice y su padre nunca se hizo responsable de él . Con mucho sacrificio, su abuela le apoyo para culminar sus estudios de nivel medio. Luego de haberse graduado, comenzó a laborar en una ferretería  ubicada en la misma municipalidad, durante el tiempo en el que estudiaba en sus ratos disponibles realizaba trabajos agrícolas, para ayudar a su abuela con los gastos del  hogar.

Desde hace 6 años, Wiliams ingreso a trabajar en un proyecto de Planificación Familiar, donde realizan capacitaciones a los miembros de la comunidad, sobre hacer conciencia de lo importante que es planificar y  que no exista la sobrepoblación, ya que trae como consecuencia más pobreza y así también sobre otros temas más, que son de mucha importancia. Él se desplaza todos los días, desde muy temprano por los casas de su comunidad para hacer su labor.

Williams solicita el crédito, para la adquisición de un vehículo, con el que pretende realizar viajes, de esta manera  pretende  disponer de otra fuente de ingresos adicionales a los actuales. Gracias a sus esfuerzos, logro comprar una  motocicleta, con la cual se  traslada a su trabajo.

Su sueño más deseado  es, construir una vivienda  y formar una familia y  tener éxito con la adquisición de su vehículo, ya que esto le generaría más ingresos.
texts.en:
Williams is 27 years old. He went to high school (intermediate level). His marital status is single. He lives alone in his house. When he was little he lived with his maternal grandmother because his parents had problems and they decided to separate. His mother went to live in Belize and his father never took responsibility for him. With much sacrifice, his grandmother supported him so he could finish the intermediate level of his schooling). After graduating, he started to work in a hardware store located in his town. When he was in school during his free time he would do farm work to help his grandmother with the household expenses. 

Since he was 6 years old, Wiliams started to work in a Family Planning project where they hold trainings for members of the community about how important it is to plan and for there not to be over population, because this brings more poverty as a consequence. They also had other topics that were very important. He goes very early every day to the houses in his community to do his work.

Williams is asking for the loan to acquire a vehicle to travel with. This way, he will have another source of income in addition to what he has now. Thanks to his efforts, he was able to buy a motorcycle which he uses to get to work. 

His biggest dream is to build a house and start a family and be successful with acquiring this vehicle, because this will generate more income.

loans.use: to acquire a vehicle with which he intends to travel.

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en:
Khursheed is a 38-year-old married woman. Her husband is a driver, and his income is not enough to meet their household expenditures. So, Khursheed started a general store five years ago to support her family.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts for years. 

Khursheed is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good-quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy packs of sugar, oil and grains to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of sugar, oil and grains.

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.es:
Gumercinda de 45 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y un claro ejemplo a seguir; actualmente trabaja junto con su esposo suyo, en la siembra de granos básicos y hortalizas. Ella vive con sus 4 hijos de edades 18, 16, 10, y 7 años. Una de ellas tiene familia a parte y el otro hijo emigro asía los Estados unidos. 
Gumercinda trabaja la agricultura junto con su esposo, desde hace ya, mucho tiempo, cultivando la tierra con granos básicos y hortalizas, como frijol, ejotero, y frijol común para la venta en frijol fresco. Dicha actividad, la aprendió de su esposo que toda la vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una novilla de repasto, así poder engordarla y posteriormente darle venta. Con esto mejorara,  sus ingresos para que pueda darle una mejor alimentación a sus hijos.
Gumercinda tiene planeado, seguir trabajando duro para darles una mejor vida a sus  hijos.
texts.en:
Gumercinda is 45 years old. She is a hard working woman and gives a clear example to follow. Right now, she is working with her husband growing basic grains and vegetables. She lives with her 4 children, aged 18, 16, 10, and 7. One of them has her own family and another son immigrated to the United States.  
 
Gumercinda has worked in farming with her husband for a long, long time, growing basic grains and vegetables such as beans, green beans and common beans to sell. She learned this activity from her husband who has farmed his whole life.

The loan she is asking for is to buy a heifer to fatten up and then sell. With this, she will improve her income to feed her children better. Gumercinda plans on continuing to work and give her children a better life.

loans.use: to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José Santos tiene 31 años de edad, vive junto a su familia el distrito de Callayuc, donde su población se dedica al cultivo de caña, yuca, maíz y comercio de ganado vacuno, a dos horas de la ciudad d Cutervo, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.
Junto a su familia se dedican al comercio de yuca, cerveza, animales menores, llevándolos a una comunidad aledaña a su comunidad, José Santos ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de cerveza en esa zona los fines de semana es de gran atracción, generándole asi mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
José Santos is 31 years old. He lives with his family in the Callayuc district. The people there grow sugar cane, yucca, corn and raise cattle. It is two hours from the city of Cutervo, which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the northern sierra of Peru.

He and his family work selling yucca, beer, and  small animals, taking them to a community near to theirs. José Santos has asked for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to buy beer. A lot of people come to that area on weekends and this generates more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy beer.

loans.name: Ngang Catherine

texts.en:
Ngang Catherine is single and a mother of three children. They live in a three bedroom apartment house in Bamenda, Northwest Region, Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life, including the deaths of her mother and sister, sickness and the worst, being sent packing out of their family compound. Another challenge has been inadequate finances to start up a business of her own and to provide for her children's needs. 

With this new loan requested, she will buy second hand dresses, groundnuts, yams and cassava seedlings for her farm. She is optimistic this business will succeed, because she has been doing it for a long time and has ready markets for the sale of her products. Also, she knows the type of dresses to buy and the right time to buy. In addition, she has regular customers that buy from her. The community will benefit from her regular supply of products.

With the profit from this loan, she will cater to her family's needs, ensure her children's education, build her house and register herself for various competitive examinations. She prefers loans from GHAPE because of the low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and the fact that the members are trained on marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed. In addition, the social needs of members are catered to at GHAPE.

loans.use: To buy a bag of groundnuts, second-hand dresses and cassava seedlings.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, de 38 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive desde hace 18 años junto a Olmes, su esposo. Ambos tienen 3 hijos a los que cuida en su casa propia. Todas las mañanas se dedica al cuidado de sus vacas, pues desde muy temprano las saca a los campos naturales para que se alimenten de pastos sanos y nutritivos. Gracias a sus cuidados, vende la leche que produce sus vacas a los comerciantes, para que realicen productos lácteos. Cuenta que al día vende de 22 a 25 litros de leche fresca. Pero como gusta de cuidar animales, además de brindarle buenos ingresos, también tiene ovejas, cerdos, cuyes y conejos, los cuales comercializa en carne a la feria que se desarrolla en Jauja, pero si tiene suerte los mismos compradores visitan su casa. Pues ella es muy conocida, ya que siembra productos agrícolas como papa, alverja y maíz, los cuales vende en su misma chacra y en épocas de cosecha, ya que es una mujer muy trabajadora. Este es el segundo crédito con KIVA, se siente feliz, pues tiene el capital necesario para mejorar su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida.
Elizabeth, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de 2 terrenos pequeños de alfalfa para el alimento de sus animales.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 38 years old, is a hardworking woman. She has lived with her husband, Olmes, since she was 18 years old. The two of them have three children who they take care of in their own home. Every morning, she takes care of the cows. Very early in the morning she takes them out to the wild fields for them to feed on healthy and nutritious pasture. Thanks to her care, she sells the milk that her cows produce to shop-keepers for them to make dairy products. She says that every day she sells from 22 to 25 liters of fresh milk. 

However, since she likes to care for animals, as well as providing her a good income, she also has sheep, pigs, guinea pigs, and rabbits which she sells as meat in the market that goes on in Jauja, but if she has luck, those same buyers visit her home. She is very well-known since she sows agricultural products like potatoes, peas, and corn, which she sells at her own farm and during harvest time, since she is a hardworking woman.

This is her second loan with Kiva. She is happy since she has the capital necessary to improve her business and therefore her quality of life. Elizabeth will invest the 1500 Nuevos Soles in the purchase of two small plots of land of alfalfa to feed her animals.

loans.use: to buy two small plots of land of alfalfa.

loans.name: Bahshttan

texts.en:
Bahshttan is a 43-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling milk with her husband for the past six years. She has three buffaloes which she uses for selling milk to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra profit. 

Bahshttan has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her sixth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. Bahshttan is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Ruqia

texts.en:
Ruqia is a 41-year-old married woman. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been in this business for many years and has become famous for providing high quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. She has requested this loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is in her sixth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Adeela

texts.en:
Adeela has successfully built her business of sewing clothes with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She has three years of experience and has attained a list of regular customers.

Previously, she took a loan to purchase raw materials. Now she has applied for her second loan of PKR 20,000. With this loan, she will be able to purchase more spools of thread along with packs of zippers, buttons and elastic material. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of the revenue on providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread along with packs of zippers, buttons and elastic material.

loans.name: Soughran

texts.en:
Soughran is a 53-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling milk with her husband for many years. Over the time, Soughran has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently, she is in her 7th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 35,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. Soughran is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Zulaykhan

texts.en:
Zulaykhan is a 53-year-old married woman and runs a business manufacturing carpets. She offers various handmade carpets and has become famous for providing good quality products in her circle. She is happily doing it for the sake of her family.
 
She is mother of three children: one daughter and two sons. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands including food, health, clothing and education. She is also doing sewing as her part time job. In this way she is able to handle her family needs and requirements effectively. 
 
It’s her 5th year with Kashf Foundation and she is satisfied with the support of it. She has applied for a loan of Rs. 40,000 to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibres to increase her sales. She hopes to increase her profits and hence be able to better support her family.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibres for her carpet manufacturing business.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 29-year-old married lady. She has six children, among them four are school going. 

She has been running a general store for the past five years. Her husband works as a salesman and earns insufficient income to support the needs of the family members alone. She is motivated to provide her children with good quality food, health and education. To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently.  She wishes to utilize part of her revenue to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 27-year-old married woman and a mother of three. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing it for the past six years. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of Rs 35,000 to buy stock of threads in different colors along with the packs of zippers and buttons to meet up with the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Pervaiza

texts.en:
Pervaiza is a 56-year-old married woman. She has been providing stitching services to the people of her community. Her husband is pension holder. She is a self-made woman and wants to live her life with integrity. She easily manages her household activities along with stitching. This business is quite profitable for her. She has been successfully running her business with the support of Kashf Foundation and  availing loans for the last four years.

Her repayment behavior has been remarkable over the years. Now, she is applying for her fifth loan of PKR 20,000. She intends to use this loan to purchase spools of thread, zippers and buttons in various colors. In this way she would be able to meet the demands of her customers on time. She wishes to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase spools of thread, zippers and buttons in various colors.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is 29 years old, and is a married, vigorous lady. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of Rs 25,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenue, so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She wishes to provide a better standard of living to her three children.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is a 47-year-old married woman, and a mother of six children. 

She has been running a business selling ladies' clothes for a period of about six years. She buys clothes of different fabrics and in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Shakeela is requesting a 25,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of clothes in different designs and sizes to attract more customers and expand her inventory. Shakeela expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothes in different designs and sizes.

loans.name: Mohsen

texts.en:
Mohsen is a 23-year-old single man from Lebanon. He works on a freelance basis as a painter. He works on multiple projects and also serves individuals at their homes. Mohsen is very gifted and always completes his job in a professional way. 

At present, Mohsen is asking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l to renew his business tools which will help him be able to accomplish his work faster and easier. In the future, he looks forward to owning a painting shop.

loans.use: to renew his business tools.

loans.name: Saeeda

texts.en:
Saeeda is a 46-year-old lady and enjoys doing her work of hand embroidery. She started doing work with her daughters. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her territory and she makes enough to contribute in the family income. Her husband is not in a good physical shape to support her family. She is the mother of three and is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life including food, clothes and education. 

In order to meet her growing demand of embroidery, she needs to buy more frames, needles and threads in different colors. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 from Kashf foundation. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy more frames, needles and threads in different colors.

loans.name: Sanam

texts.en:
Sanam is a 29-year-old married woman and a mother of five. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing this for the past four years. 

Sanam knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her to continue the operations of her business, Sanam requested a loan of Rs. 30000/- to buy threads in different colors along with packs of zippers and buttons to meet with the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenue to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Qasang

texts.en:
Qasang is 48 years of age, a divorced woman with 2 children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Agdas region, and has requested a loan for 1,000 AZN through Aqroinvest to buy additional livestock to raise. She has been in this line of work for 4 years and also earns additional income by raising ducks. 

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college. Qasang hopes that Kiva will help her.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to raise.

loans.name: Nkwlokoh Helen

texts.en:
Nkwlokoh Helen is a single mother of one child. They both live in a one bedroom apartment house in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life: a few to mention are the dead of her loved ones, sickness, inadequate finance to start up a business of her own and cater for her child's needs, and marital problems.

With this new loan, she will buy cocoyams (tropical root vegetables), rubber shoes and clothes. She holds a positive view of this business succeeding because she has been doing it for long time, has a ready market for her products, a good market site, and a good mastering of the business. The community will benefit from her regular supply of her products, have plenty to eat, and her dresses which are sold at moderate prices will provide the community with clothing and shoes for protection.

With the profit from this loan, Nkwlokoh Helen will cater for her family's needs, ensure her child’s education, and pay her bills and rents. Part of the profit will go to increase her capital. She prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and also the members are trained on marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed, also social needs of members are catered for at GHAPE.

loans.use: to buy cocoyams, clothes and shoes for her general store.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 43-year-old married woman living with her husband and three children, all of whom attend school. She works at her home, where she has prepared a small corner to receive customers and provide them with hairdressing and beauty services. 

In order to improve her business and be able to acquire new tools such as dryers and brushes etc, Hala is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l. She states that certainly the loan will ease her operations and will let her provide her customers with a higher quality of services. In the future, Hala wishes to borrow a new loan to be able to open a proper beauty salon.

loans.use: acquire new tools such as dryers, brushes etc.

loans.name: Ibolya

texts.ru:
Иболя занимается торговлей одежды бывшей в употреблени (секондхенд). С помощью предыдущего кредита она смогла увеличить доход  на две тысячи гривен. Иболя хороший клиент. Она берет большие кредиты на маленький срок и всегда возвращает без опозданий. 

Иболя всегда закупает много товара,  и когда у нее остается одежда, она вывозит ее в цыганский лагерь и раздает бесплатно.

Иболя просит предоставить ей кредит на сумму 30,000 гривен на закупку нижнего белья, одежды, курток и ковриков. Увеличив ассортимент, она сможет получить дополнительную прибыль.  Иболя планирует увеличить доход и закончить начатый ремонт в доме.
texts.en:
Ibolya sells secondhand clothes for a living.  With the help of her last loan, she was able to increase her income by an additional 2,000 hryvnia.  She is a model borrower; she takes large loans with a short payback term and always pays them off on time.  As far as her business practices go, she typically stocks up on a lot of clothes, and, if she has any which aren't selling too well, takes them over to a local Gypsy settlement and gives them out for free.  

This time around, she is seeking a loan of 30,000 hryvnia to stock up on clothes, undergarments, jackets and carpets.  By having a greater variety of such goods for sale, she will be able to make more money; with this money, she hopes to finish the ongoing renovation of her home.

loans.use: offer a greater variety of clothes for sale

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is married with five children. She has received some schooling till the end of junior high school level. Currently, Ruth sells vegetables such as garden eggs in Aubransa (near  Elmina). She has been involved in this industry for about four years now. Her husband is a farmer. Ruth’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses.  

Ruth will use the loan to increase her existing vegetables capacity. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Ruth plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing vegetables  capacity.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 32 years old and lives in the town of Lyantonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has five children, with four of them currently in school. For the past five years, Josephine has been working hard to manage her poultry business, which sells chicken. 

To help expand her business, Josephine has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hens and feed, and will help Josephine to generate greater profits and increase her profit margin. Josephine hopes that in the future she will be able to have an expanded poultry house. 

Josephine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Josephine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more hens and feed.

loans.name: Rafail

texts.en:
Rafail is 39 years old, and is married with two children. After several attempts to find a job, he decided to start his own business. He is farmer and has grown seasonal fruit and vegetables for the last four years. He also breeds cattle.

He chose this business because it is profitable and fresh crops are in high demand. Rafail sells his crops in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 100 AZN. His father actively helps him to grow the crops.

As his products are in high demand, Rafail wants to expand his business and grow more fruit and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose he applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers. This is Rafail's first loan.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret  is 26 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past four years, she has been working hard to manage her secretarial shop, which offers typing and printing services. 

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more computers and photocopiers, and will help her to generate greater profits and expand her profit margin. She hopes that in the future she will be able to have a big secretarial shop. 

Margret is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Margret who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more computers and photocopiers

loans.name: Azada

texts.en: Azada is a 49-year-old single woman and she lives with her old parents. She earns her living in the farming business. She has been doing this for 20 years. She is requesting a loan of 1,200 AZN. This loan is intended to buy farm supplies such as hybrid seeds, farmers variety and fertilizer. Azada  dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life, and an adequate income out of her business. She only hopes that Kiva will help her.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as hybrid seeds, farmers variety and fertilizer

loans.name: Ghulam  Kubra

texts.en: Ghulam Kubra is a 48-year-old vigorous lady. She has six children. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of lace, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of lace, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Nuestra Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nuestra Esperanza está conformado por diez integrantes, madres solteras con ocho hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarias del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Estas personas se caracterizan por trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar  y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar desde temprana edad. Para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora del banco es Yadira y tiene por actividad económica  la venta de fritanga en su casa de habitación. Una fritanga es la venta de comida casera como tacos, carne asada, enchiladas, manuelitas, gallo pinto, tajadas, maduros. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra y venta de productos comestibles como carne, arroz, frijoles, plátanos, harinas, repollos, crema aceite, para elaborar su comida para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  El banco comunal Nuestra Esperanza agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Nuestra Esperanza (Our Hope) community bank consists of ten members, single mothers with eight children under their responsibility. 
They are from el Sauce, which is located in the north of the country. These people are characterized as hard working, responsible, and with the desire for self improvement. Unfortunately due to a lack of economic resources, they were not able to go to school because they needed to work at an early age, to help with household expenses .

Thanks to her efforts and desire to get ahead, Yadira became the bank coordinator. She runs a fritanga from her home. A fritanga is when one sells homemade food like tacos, carne asada, enchiladas, manuelitas (filled crepes), rice and beans, green plantains and sweet plantains. She devotes 10 hours a day to her business, serving her products. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital in the purchase and sale of food products such as meat, rice, beans, bananas, flour, cabbage and cream oil to make food so that in the near future she can have more income. 

The community bank Nuestra Esperanza is grateful for the assistance that Kiva donors offer people with less resources and poorer countries such as Nicaragua so they can work with dignity.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business in the purchase and sale of food products such as tacos, carne asada, enchiladas, manuelitas, rice and beans, green platains and sweet plantains.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 50-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and seven children, all of whom are attending school. 

As mentioned, Fatmeh has a big family, so she works very hard, as with her husband who works in two jobs, to be able to pay their heavy life expenses. She has been involved in the tailoring business for 15 years. She has a gifted performance and always satisfies her customer’s demands. 

With her loan requested from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l, Fatmeh will expand her operations by purchasing new tailoring machines and tools. Fatmeh is a positive person who always seeks the best for her family.

loans.use: purchase new tailoring machines and tools.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia, age 29, is a married woman. She has been doing business sewing clothes for a period of about six years. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of household. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Now she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase more reels of thread along with packs of buttons and laces.  In this way she will be able to meet  increasing demand. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.
