Nazia hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads along with the packs of buttons and laces.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a married woman who is living with her husband and three children. For about 6 years she has been in the work of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins, and stones for its embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. 

Robina dreams for her children's bright future and desires to build her own house as she is living in a rented house with her family.

loans.use: To buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins, and stones.

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Meet Eliud. He is a farmer from Eldoret, which is a very green and fertile area for agriculture production. He has been farming for nine years, focusing on dairy, poultry and crop farming, where he also derives his income from. In farming, he loves venturing into new projects and expanding his farm, while his greatest challenge is getting funds for the farm projects.

Eliud chose Juhudi Kilimo because they invest in small scale farmers like him. During the training received, he learnt how to keep proper records for his farm. This loan will help him buy animal feed for his livestock which will make his animals produce more, and thus increase his income base and hence improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed.

loans.name: Najwa Group

texts.en: This group is called Najwa and it is made up of four women who are natives of Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 140,000 YER. One of the members of this group is Najwa, who is 23 years old. She has a business selling incense, perfume and ladies' clothes. She started her business by making incense at home until she was able to sell it to her customers around her area. She realized that her business was profitable and she set out to invest more in it. Now she is applying for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy perfume, incense and clothes for her business. She hopes to have a clothing shop to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy perfume, incense and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa tiene 47 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos menores en el distrito de Oyotún , donde su población se dedica al comercio de animales menores y cultivos de arroz, algodón , yucas entre otros, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Felipa con la ayuda de su familia se dedican a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, su negocio está ubicado en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ella ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados que le va ha permitir engordar a los mismos y así ofrecerlos a un mejor precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Felipa is 47 years old. She lives with her husband and their three young children in the district of Oyotún, where the people work in selling small animals and growing rice, cotton, and yuccas, among others. This district is two hours from the city of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

Felipa, with the help of her family, raises and sells barnyard animals. Her business is located behind her home. She has applied for a loan of 1500 PEN to buy balanced feed that will allow her to fatten the animals and thus offer them at a better price in the market.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals

loans.name: Isam

texts.en:
Isam is from Iraq. He is 42 years old, married and a father of three children. Isam works hard to provide his family income and tuition fees for his three children.

Isam runs a general store. He provides the basic electrical needs for a house like lamps, bulbs and wires. He has been running this business since 2007 and has gained much experience and fame all around the city.

Isam is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to install a rolling shutter and to increase his inventory. Isam aims to grow his business and increase his profits, so he will be able to continue educating his children and promise them a bright future.

loans.use: to install a rolling shutter and to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es:
Freddy, de 36 años es un hombre trabajador. Vive en compañía de su esposa e hijos a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace algunos años. Desde muy pequeño nació en estas tierras, desde entonces aprendió todo lo necesario para poder emprender por el mismo el camino como agricultor. Sus principales cultivos constan de maíz, papá, alverja y habas; los cuales cuida con mucho esmero, pues es su principal ingreso económico. Además es conocido entre los comerciantes como; el que tiene mejor calidad de alimentos; por ello no puede descuidarse. Ahora desea mejorar sus ingresos sembrando más cantidad, para ello está pensando alquilar terrenos o sembrar en sociedad, pues de esa manera podrá lograr su objetivo. Este es el primer crédito con KIVA, se siente feliz, pues tiene el capital necesario para mejorar su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida.
Freddy, invertirá los S/.800 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para sus sembríos.
texts.en: Freddy, who is 36 years old, is a hard-working man. He lives with his wife and children, whom he cares for in the house that he bought a few years ago. He was born in this area, and starting when he was very young, he learned everything necessary in order to set off for himself on the path to becoming a farmer. His principal crops consist of corn, potatoes, peas, and beans, which he cares for with great effort, since they are his principal economic income. Furthermore, he is known among the dealers as the one who has the best quality of foods; for that reason, he cannot be neglectful. Now he wants to improve his income by planting a greater quantity; to do this he is thinking of renting land or planting in a partnership, since in this way he will be able to achieve his goal. This is his first loan with Kiva. He feels happy, since he will have the capital necessary to improve his business and as a result, his quality of life. Freddy will invest the 800 PEN in the purchase of organic compost for his plantings.

loans.use: to buy organic compost

loans.name: Angel Guzmaro

texts.es:
Angel Guzmaro tiene 30 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos, en 3el distrito de Zaña, su población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno lechero, desde hace más de 5 años y ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para comprar alimentos balanceados que le den una mejor producción de leche y así tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Angel Guzmaro is 30 years old. He lives with his wife and their two children in the 3rd district of Zaña, where the people work in farming and raising livestock. This district is two hours from the city of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

He has worked in raising dairy cattle for more than five years, and he has applied for a loan of 2500 PEN to buy balanced feed that will give them better milk production, and thus he will have greater income for his family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for his cattle

loans.name: Kubahoneza Acb Group

texts.en: Berthe is 46 years old. She is a widow and takes care of four children. She is the group leader of the group called Kabahoneza, which means "Live well" in English. She has spent four years in the business of selling clothes. As a group leader, she dreams of transforming her group members' lives with the loans they have requested to be reinvested in the business so that in the future, they can have a better living. Berthe has requested this loan to buy more clothes to sell. With the profits from this business, she plans to provide food for her family members. Berthe is in the group photo. She has raised her hand  to better identify her as a group leader.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jafargulu

texts.en:
Jafargulu is a 49-year-old married man with five children; some of them are at school.  Jafargulu has been a farmer for 21 years, raising, buying, and selling livestock and milk products. 

He has health problems; he will use funds from this loan for surgery & for medical expenses.

loans.use: to pay for surgery and medical expenses.

loans.name: Oscar Darío

texts.es: Oscar es un campesino de 29 años de edad, que se dedica a realizar labores pecuarias, trabaja como empleado en una finca de la región donde vive, allí ordeña las vacas y cuida los pastizales; esta actividad la aprendió desde que era un niño, gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre, quien toda la vida se dedicó a las labores del campo. Adicionalmente y, para complementar sus ingresos, alterna su empleo con el cuidado de su propio ganado lechero, pues posee tres vacas ubicadas en un pequeño potrero que tiene en la casa de su familia, las cuales producen aproximadamente 50 litros de líquido al día que vende entre los vecinos y amigos del sector. Su empuje, espíritu emprendedor y su entusiasmo lo motivan para seguir buscando alternativas que le ayuden a salir adelante; es por ello que solicita el crédito, con el que desea comprar dos vacas productoras de leche, con las que podrá aumentar su producción y así mejorar los ingresos por venta; esto le permite seguir luchando para cumplir  sus sueños de progresar, adquirir su finca propia con un potrero amplio para continuar con su actividad de manera totalmente independiente y no tener que pagar más arriendo, además desea tener muchas vacas para que su negocio sea productivo y rentable y le permita ayudar con la economía de su familia; mejorando las condiciones y el nivel de vida.
texts.en: Oscar is a 29-year-old farmer who works in livestock raising. He works as an employee at a farm in the region where he lives. There he milks the cows and cares for the pasturage. He learned this work when he was a boy, thanks to the teachings of his father, who did farm work all his life. In addition, and to supplement his income, he alternates his job with caring for his own dairy cattle, since he has three cows located on the little pasture of his family home. They produce approximately 50 liters of liquid a day, which he sells to neighbors and friends in the area. His effort, his entrepreneurial spirit, and his enthusiasm motivate him to continue seeking alternatives that will help him to advance. It is for this reason that he is applying for the loan, with which he wants to buy two dairy cows. With them, he will be able to increase his production and thus improve his revenue from sales. This will allow him to continue working to accomplish his dreams of progressing, acquiring his own farm with ample pastures to continue his business in a totally independent manner without having to pay more rent. In addition, he wants to have many cows so that his business is productive and profitable, and this will allow him to help with the family economy, improving the conditions and standards of living.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cattle

loans.name: Ibtissam

texts.en:
Ibtissam is a 34-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She lives with her husband and two children who are attending school. 

In 2006, and with the aim of supplementing the family’s income, she decided to start her own business from her home. She is specialized in installing special programs into computers. She is professional and has a good business reputation. 

Today, she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas. s.a.l. to purchase computers, spare parts, CDs, and other items to proceed with her business properly. As for her future plan, Ibtissam may open a computer shop in the upcoming year and she notes that definitely a new Kiva loan will help her to realize that.

loans.use: to purchase computers, spare parts, CDs, and other items

loans.name: John Peter

texts.en:
John Peter is 38 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is Married and has 5 children, three of them are currently in school. For the past 10 years, John Peter has been working hard to manage his butchery store, which sells fresh meat. 

To help expand his business, John Peter has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cattle for meat, which will help John Peter generate greater profits and expand his business. John Peter hopes that in the future, he will be able to own another branch. 

John Peter is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like John Peter who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for meat.

loans.name: Khouloud

texts.en: Khouloud is a 24-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband, who works in the construction field, and three children attending school. She works independently selling scarf and traditional cloth named “Aabaya”. Khouloud has her own customers, and lately she received a bigger demand on her products. But since she is unable to purchase a wide variety of clothes at this time, she decided to apply for a youth loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l., to do so and meet her customers' needs. In the future, Khouloud plans to open her own clothing store where she will better display her items.

loans.use: to purchase a wide variety of clothes.

loans.name: Remegio

texts.en:
Remegio is 34 years old and lives in the town of Tororo in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Remegio has been working hard to manage his produce business, which sells food produce. 

To help expand his business, Remegio has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more cassava flour for sale, and will help Remegio to generate greater profits and expand the business. Remegio hopes that in the future he will be able to own a bigger produce business with outlets. 

Remegio is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Remegio who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava flour for sale

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa tiene 52 años de edad, vive en el caserío de Culpon, que pertenece al distrito de Nueva Arica, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, su negocio esta ubicado en la parte posterior a su domicilio y ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de animales pequeños para posteriormente engordarlos y ofrecerlos a un mejor precio, generándolo a si mayores ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Teresa is 52 years old. She lives in the hamlet of Culpon, which belongs to the Nueva Arica district, two hours from the city of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

She raises and sells small animals. Her business is located behind her home, and she has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2500 PEN for the purchase of small animals to then fatten and offer at a better price, generating greater income to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animals (ducks, guinea pigs, and chickens) to fatten.

loans.name: Om-Hamdon Group

texts.en: This group is called Om-Hamdon. It is made up of four women. They have applied for a loan of 150,000 YER. Fatima is a 36-year-old mother of children living in Hodaidh, Yemen. She is helping her family's business, which is selling clothes and perfumes. She learned the trade and has been in this line of work for many years. She is applying for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB. She will use her portion of the loan to buy clothes and perfumes for her business. She hopes to open a clothing store so she can earn more income.

loans.use: to buy clothes and perfumes for her business.

loans.name: Zahir

texts.en:
Zahir is 43 years old, married, and has two children, ages 3 and 14. He retired on health, and his wife works as a teacher at a local school in the village. 
Zahir has been raising cattle for about 12 years. He tries to earn money in order to provide income for the family. He selected this work because he enjoys raising cattle. Today, Zahir is requesting a loan to pay for medical expenses and medicines so he can recover his health and continue his work. After treatment, he wants to take a loan to purchase a few more calves for breeding. He needs your financial support.

loans.use: to cover medical expenses.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 28-year-old Lebanese single man. He owns a store where he puts up on sale a traditional Lebanese tobacco called “Hubble-Bubble”. He has owned his business since 2005. All is going well so far, but Mahmoud is suffering from insufficient income. He plans to improve it, and consequently improve his standards of living by requesting a youth loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l. He states that he will use the loan to particularly purchase products, such as Hubble-Bubble tools and tobacco. In the future, Mahmoud plans to set aside a corner where he will start to serve fast food.

loans.use: to purchase products, such as Hubble-Bubble tools and tobacco.

loans.name: Ramzi

texts.en:
Ramzi is 34 years old, married, and has two children. He works hard to provide for his family's needs all by himself. 

He is a grocer and owns a small grocery store where he provides his neighborhood with dairy products, canned foods, snacks, drinks, and detergents. He has been in this field ever since 2005. He established his own independent business and now he has a hired employee already. Ramzi is well-known in the area, thanks to his good products and affordable prices. The purpose of the loan is to purchase goods for his grocery store. 

He wants to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to educate his children and promise them a bright future.

loans.use: To purchase goods for his grocery store.

loans.name: Gladys Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of two members and the leader is Gladys, who makes a living selling shoes and slippers from the wholesale market in the city of Accra-Teshie. This is her sixth loan with the organization, and Gladys is going to use it to buy a range of wholesale shoes and slippers to restock her business, so that she can offer her customers a variety of products. Her reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving her business. 

Gladys is a very hard-working person, and she is grateful for the opportunity provided, because this loan will allow her to grow her business. She, together with her colleague, needs GHS 2,100 to improve her businesses.

loans.use: To buy a range of wholesale shoes and slippers to restock her business

loans.name: Sailesh

texts.en: Shailesh is 41 years old and lives with his mother. He is a rice farmer by family tradition. He started farming on his own in 2010. He started with an area of one hectare with the support of Seva MFI, and he has now expanded the total area to ten hectares. He has always repaid his Seva MFI loans fully and on time. Shailesh wants to save for a tractor to improve his production. He applied for a loan of 9,000 SRD to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Bikram

texts.en:
Bikram is 53 years old and has a family with three children. One of them is studying at the university college. 

Bikram is a welder by profession. In his free time he cultivates rice together with his sons. Bikram wants his two sons to become independent and dedicated rice farmers. With support from Seva MFI, he has expanded his rice areas and repaid his loans fully. 

He is requesting a new loan of 10,000 SRD from Seva MFI to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Rawindra

texts.en:
Rawindra is 67 years old and despite his advanced age he is still active in rice cultivation. His youngest son recently left home and got married. Now he lives alone with his wife. Apart from rice he also grows vegetables and keeps ducks and chickens. 

With the profit of his rice production Rawindra says he could improve his tractor. For the new season of rice cultivation he needs a loan of SRD 9,000 to purchase pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Avaz

texts.en:
Avaz is a young farmer. He lives with his wife. The family covers their basic needs through breeding of sheep. This is the only source of income for them. He sells the agricultural products in the local market.

Avaz doesn't have his own land. A loan of AZN 1,600 will be a big support as it will enable him rent a land to graze the herd. Avaz is very thankful to lenders for helping them maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to rent a land to graze the herd.

loans.name: Eter

texts.en:
Eter, age 56, is from the Samtredia district, where she lives with her husband and mother-in-law who is in her eighties. The only income source for the family is the retirement pension of Eter’s mother-in-law which is nearly 90 USD per month and hardly enough to cover food expenses. 

Eter would like to start up a clothing sale business in her community in order to earn an additional income. She has applied for this loan in order to purchase a supply of clothing at wholesale prices to start her business. Since there are not many clothing stores in her district, Eter is confident that her endeavor will meet a high demand. She will go to Turkey (a neighboring country) where prices are lower than in Georgia and buy merchandise. She intends to develop positive relationships with her customers and expects to attain a good profit from her new business. 

This start-up loan offers Eter a good chance to earn a more stable income and improve her family's living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to purchase stock of apparel for resale among her community members

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more baskets of fish.

loans.name: Menoodj

texts.en:
Menoodj is 42 years old and has a family with three school-age children. Menoodj previously worked together with his father in their rice fields. After the death of his father, he independently started planting rice on an area of 3 hectares. With the support of Seva MFI, he expanded this to 13 hectares.

Menoodj bought a tractor with the support of his family in the Netherlands. He uses the tractor for his own rice fields, but works with it for other farmers as well. This gives him extra income. Currently, he is building his own house, and facing shortages in his finances for the new season of rice cultivation. He approached Seva MFI for a loan of SRD 11,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina, de 56 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo Epifanio y sus 2 hijos a los que quiere mucho. Ella es una mujer independiente, pues cuida de sus hijos, sola. Su principal esfuerzo se ven recompensado por el  cultivo de productos de primera necesidad como, maíz y papa. Los cuales siembra con mucha dedicación ya que ella constantemente limpia la maleza que crece entre los surcos. Por otro lado le molesta las plagas que llegan a sus cultivos producto del frío del lugar. Cuenta además que gracias a la buena intervención de sus sembríos puede contrarrestar los problemas causados por estas peligrosas bacterias. Gracias a ello obtiene buenas ganancias en la cosecha de sus sembríos. Ahora desea mejorar la calidad de sus alimentos para poder recibir un precio más justo a sus sembríos. Este es el primer crédito con KIVA, se siente feliz, pues tiene el capital necesario para mejorar su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida.
Catalina, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Catalina is 56 years old. She lives with her husband Epifanio and their 2 children, whom she loves very much. She is an independent woman, as she cares for her children alone. 

Her main effort has been rewarded by cultivating basic needs products like corn and potatoes. She sows them with a lot of dedication, as she constantly clears the weeds that grow between the furrows. 

On the other hand, she has trouble with the blight that comes to her crops as a result of the cold climate. She says additionally that, owing to good intervention with her crops, she can counteract the problems caused by these dangerous bacteria. Thanks to this, she gets good earnings from the harvest of her crops. 

Now, she wishes to improve the quality of her nutrients in order to receive a fairer price for her crops. This is her first loan with Kiva; she feels glad, because she has the necessary capital to improve her business and therefore her quality of life. 

Catalina will invest the S/.1000 soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer for her crops.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Medaly

texts.es: Medaly, de 31 años es madre soltera de 2 hijos. Ella y sus hijos viven en una casa propia. Ella es una mujer luchadora. Hace poco que se separó del padre de sus hijos y empezó a trabajar de manera independiente. Hace 2 años que empezó con el negocio de panes y bizcochos de una marca nacional. La que adquiere al por mayor en la ciudad de Lima y los vende en su distrito de casa en casa. “Lo que más vendo son panes en molde y bizcochos dulces como alfajores y piononos”, comenta. Además menciona que sus productos son deliciosos, por eso siempre los vende. De sus ventas gana un porcentaje y recibe un sueldo como vendedora.  Le gusta su trabajo porque está en contacto constante con los clientes, y por la libertad de distribuir su tiempo como a ella le parezca. De esta manera no descuida a sus hijos y los atiende para que ellos vayan limpios y seguros a la escuela. Su deseo es abrir un pequeño restaurante, es una de sus metas más próximas, para ello deberá trabajar duro. Éste sería su segundo crédito con KIVA, por eso se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Medaly, Invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de panes de trigo y harina, además bizcochos dulces para continuar con su negocio.
texts.en: Medaly, who is 31 years old, is the single mother of two children. She and her children live in their own house. She is a hard-working woman. A little while ago, she separated from the father of her children and began to work independently. Two years ago she began a business with a national brand of breads and cakes, which she acquires wholesale in the city of Lima and sells house to house in her district. "What I sell most are sliced bread and sweet cakes such as alfajores (two pastries with a sweet filling between them) and piononos (a rolled, filled cake)," she comments. In addition, she mentions that her products are delicious; for this reason, she always sells them. From her sales she earns a percentage and receives a salary as a salesperson. She likes her work because she is in constant contact with the customers and because of the freedom to arrange her time as she prefers. In this way, she doesn't neglect her children, and she tends to them so that they go to school clean and safe. Her dream is to open a little restaurant. It is one of her nearest goals. For this, she will have to work hard. This will be her second loan with Kiva. For this reason, she promises to be punctual with her monthly payments. Medaly will invest the 1000 PEN in the purchase of wheat and other types of bread as well as sweet pastries to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy wheat and other types of bread, among other items

loans.name: Shehaaf

texts.en:
Shehaaf is 37 years old and has a family with 3 children. Shehaaf previously worked for his father in the rice fields. With the support of Seva MFI, he started independently with rice cultivation. With the savings, he bought a pickup; this is providing the family with extra income.

Shehaaf still lives with his parents. He dreams about his own home and wants to save for this. Shehaaf has repaid his entire past loan from Seva MFI on time. He applied for a new loan of SRD 7,000 to purchase pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Dana

texts.en: Dana is a 19-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She works as a private teacher at her house. She is quite new in this domain but she succeeded in this major since she loves teaching students. Today, Dana looks forward to borrowing a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase books and supply the teaching room that she has prepared at her house with necessary equipment. Dana is very eager to receive the loan as it will help her achieve her goal by offering her students a good education.

loans.use: to purchase books and supply her teaching room with necessary equipment

loans.name: Khalig

texts.en:
In the pictures you see Khalig standing together with his wife. He is a man of 45 years and has two children. He has been in agriculture for over 20 years, and raises sheep and cows. Throughout these years, the business has allowed him to provide for his family and he is grateful to his father, who first taught him the trade.

There are currently a few cows and sheep in Khalig's barnyard. He would like to increase the number of animals he owns; this is his goal in applying for a loan. He plans to use the requested amount to buy sheep. He appreciates your assistance.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Meet Emmanuel, a farmer living in Eldoret. He has been farming for the past five years. In his farm he grows crops and rears dairy cows and poultry. Like many farmers in Eldoret, Emmanuel chose to invest in poultry farming because it's so easy to get egg production. He enjoys the poultry laying eggs and hatching chicks. The major challenges he faces are disease and pest control.

Emmanuel chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because he needs help in expanding his poultry project. During the training session, he learned how to keep good records in his farming business. He said this loan will enable him get more income, and thus improve their living standards.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is a 62-year-old farmer who lives in the rich highlands of Eldoret. He is a very established farmer, who enjoys every bit of farming and has done it for 28 years. His main source of income comes from the sale of milk, eggs and crops. In addition to farming, he also has a personal business. He expressed that his satisfaction will come from adding more to his flock, but his major challenge is his difficulty in feeding his flock during dry seasons.

Raphael chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they give thorough training to farmers before giving out loans. During the training sessions, he learned how to keep proper records. This loan will help him construct a dairy shed for his livestock, where they will feed well and thus produce more milk. This will bring in more income.

loans.use: To construct a dairy shed.

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en:
Theresia is married and a mother of five children. They live in a four-bedroom apartment in Bamenda, Northwest Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life, a few of which are inadequate finances to start up a business of her own, sickness, and worst of all, the accident of her son.

With this new loan requested she will buy Koki beans, oil, fowls and feed. She holds a positive view of the business succeeding because she has been doing it for a long time and has regular customers who buy her products. With this business activity, the community will benefit from her moderate selling prices, she will provide food for people at their job sites and provide fowls for consumption, and the waste from fowls will be used as manure to boost yields. 

With the profit from this loan, she will cater to her family needs, ensure her children's education, change the roof of her house and increase her capital. She prefers loans from GHAPE because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and also the members are trained in marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: To buy Koki beans, oil, fowls and feed.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is married with six children, and three of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (cousins).  She has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this business for seven years. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She works six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only seven days out of every week. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She is aspiring of owning a delivery van to ease the transportation and also of becoming a wholesaler. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but not to  piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Majid

texts.en:
Majid is 54 years old and married. He lives with three people. His two children are 18 and 22 years old.

Majid has been a farmer since he was young, breeding cattle. He also works as a gardener.

The loan will be used to repair the house. He will put a roof for the house that he built for the family, so they can live more comfortably, without water coming in during the rains.

loans.use: To buy the roof of the house.

loans.name: Kasyoka

texts.en:
Kasyoka is married woman with eight children, all of whom completed their education. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past tfive years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Mirabel

texts.en:
Mirabel is married and has two children. The family live in a one bedroom house in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. Mirabel has faced so many challenges in life, among which are inadequate finance to start up a business of her own and cater for her family needs, sickness, the death of her son and her father, and her husband's accident.
With this new loan requested Mirabel will expand her farming business by buying more of her business articles, such as bread, plantains, pure water (tangui), and sweet drinks, and will also add SIM cards retail to her business. She holds a positive view of this business succeeding because she has been doing it for about three years and has regular customers who buy from her. With this business activity, the community will benefit because Mirabel sells her products at moderate prices, and the distance to buy from the market will be reduced. 
Concerning the profit made from this loan, Mirabel will expand her farming business, ensure her children's education, provide medication when needs arise and save some for a bigger investment. She prefers GHAPE loan because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and also the members are trained on marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: To buy bread, plantains, tangui, sweet drinks and SIM cards

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is married with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees. 

For the past ten years, Chizi has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 50,000 KES she wants to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is married with four children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwaka has operated a fish selling business at the market for the past ten years, selling to her town dwellers and neighbours. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing fish, especially during cold currents in the deep sea. 

Mwaka is requesting a loan to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood. She decided to join Yehu to access loans at a lower cost to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood

loans.name: Rahel

texts.en:
Rahel is a hardworking and enterprising woman who is married with seven children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, Rahel has practised farming, growing various crops such as vegetables and tomatoes. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the 40,000 KES Rahel wants to purchase seeds and pesticide for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and pesticide for her business

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a single woman, with three school-going children. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. 

Hellen operates a cafe business making consumables like rice, tea, beans, and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality as a major challenge.

With the 10,000 KES she wants to purchase stocks of goods, maize flour, wheat flour, rice and drinks for the business. Her dream is to see her children get better education and become important people in society.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of goods, maize flour, wheat flour, rice and drinks for the business.

loans.name: Paulina's Group

texts.en:
Paulina, who is in her early 60s, is single and has two adult children who are living independently. She has been running a small business selling general provisions and drinks for 12 years now. She works from 7:00 am to 9:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 
This will be Paulina's sixth loan from ID-Ghana. She used the previous loan to increase her stock of provisions and drinks, and has repaid back the loan successfully. She used the profit for household expenses and she will use this loan to buy more provisions such as biscuits, soaps and bottled drinks. Currently, she owns two stalls in Teshie and Nungua, and she dreams of owning more annex shops with the same products in order to increase sales and make more profit. 

Paulina will take this loan with Robert and they will hold each other accountable for repaying back the amount of GHS 1,800.

loans.use: To buy more goods such as biscuits, soaps and bottled drinks for resale.

loans.name: Dove Group

texts.en:
Irene, who is in her mid-twenties, is married with a school-age daughter. For three years now, Irene has been supporting her family by running a beauty salon. She is doing great with her business and is able to make a good return per month. Irene opens her salon from 8.00 am to 10.00 pm every working day. 

This will be Irene's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy more equipment for her salon in order to service more clients. With her previous loan, all of which she paid back successfully, she also restocked her salon with new equipment. She used her profit to cover her daughter's school fees and home expenses. Irene dreams of making her salon big and user-friendly. 

She will share this loan with her loan group" DOVE”, which comprises of three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Good Work Group

texts.en:
Mwarabu is a married man with two children, one of whom is in school. He is in his late twenties and has had a business selling local chickens since 2007. He works from 6:00 am to 6:00 pm every working day and can now generate a good monthly profit. . 

This is Mwarabu's second loan request from Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania, and he will use it to buy more chickens. He put his previous loan to the same use and he paid it off successfully. He used the profit to cover school fees and home costs, and dreams of building a family house. 

Mwarabu will share this loan with his group" GOOD WORK", which totals seven members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more local chickens for resale.

loans.name: Lorlin

texts.en:
Lorlin is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling medicines in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase more medicines to sell in her medicine business.

Lorlin has been in this business for 10 years. Lorlin earns additional income from food vending.

Lorlin has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more medicines to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Liberty

texts.en:
Ma. Liberty is 49 years old and widowed with five children.

Ma. Liberty works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Ma. Liberty has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

Ma. Liberty aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo  se reúnen cada 15 días en Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su gran artesanía como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.
En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos ambos mayores de edad pero que aun vive con ella. Su esposo es chofer. Ella es artesana desde hace varios años, estuvo en una academia de corte y confección en la cual aprendió muy bien esta profesión.
Doña Ana tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa lugar donde desde se dedica a coser ropa de todo tipo de ropa, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares que requieren de sus servicios, además también vende ropa de todo tipo la cual lo realiza puerta a puerta aunque le mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza en su propio taller. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar. Lleva más de 13 años dedicada a estas actividades con las cuales se ayuda a salir adelante.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar ropa de todo tipo, telas, hilos y otros materiales para la costura. Esta desde el inicio en el banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le ha brindado el banco. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando día a día.
texts.en:
The Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo Community Bank meets every 15 days in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its rich culture and handicrafts, such as its toquilla straw hats, famous both in Ecuador and beyond.

Señora Ana lives here. She is 47 years old and married. She has two children with her husband, who are both grown-up but still live with her. Her husband is a driver and she has worked making handicrafts for many years. She learned her trade in a dressmaking academy.

Ana has a small sewing workshop in her home, where she makes all kinds of clothing. She works on the bais of orders from individuals who require her services, and also sells different kinds of clothes from door to door, although she sells the majority of her wares in her own workshop.

She works every day from 6am to 10pm, and sometimes even later when she has orders to finish. She has been in this business for over 13 years, which helps her to move forwards. She is going to use this new loan to buy all kinds of clothing,  fabric, threads and other materials for dressmaking. She has been a member of the community bank since the beginning, and she likes it because of the help it always offers her. Her dream is to keep improving each and every day.

loans.use: to buy clothing, fabric, threads and other materials for dressmaking.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
This is Lydia. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase greater quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed in the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Lydia dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes that her family will always be in good condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Sivn

texts.en:
Sivn is from the village of Prey Chhor district in Kampong Cham province. She is 33 years old and a single woman, who lives with her mother. She works in the local village as a farmer and a construction laborer to support her daily living costs. She is a hardworking woman who aims to uplift her family out of poverty and provide enough to her old mother

In order to further develop her farming business, Sivn needs to buy a cow to work on her farm. For this reason, she has applied for a loan amounting to KHR 1,200,000 from HKL and Kiva. This will allow her to manage the farming chores effectively, and minimize the costs incurred in renting other villagers’ animals. She will continue with the loan funding and is hoping that she is able to improve her farming productivity.

loans.use: to buy a cow to work on her farm.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more products for her variety store which has been running for four years now. Her loan also helped in the education of her child. The income she got from her business assisted in their everyday household expenditures. She also has a tricycle for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and child’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Jennifer hopes that her business will last longer and dreams that her family will always be in good health. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her general store.

loans.name: Eldona

texts.en:
Eldona is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Eldona is 36 years old and has four children who are still in school.

Eldona has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Eldona requested a PHP 11,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Eldona has been in this business for five years. In the future, Eldona would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Leodilyn

texts.en:
Leodilyn works hard to support her family. Leodilyn is married and has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines.

Leodilyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of ready-to-wear like blouses, shorts, t-shirts, etc. to sell.

Leodilyn has been in this business for six years now.

Leodilyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of ready-to-wear like blouses, shorts and t-shirts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is restless, with incredible energy in her small frame. She manages a small farm, fishes, and sells prepared fish as her primary sources of income, and also as means of avoiding boredom. 

She wants to improve her farm's productivity and is investing in a small, six cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester to convert animal waste on her farm into renewable biogas and biofertilizer. She'll use the biogas for domestic use in the kitchen and to heat bathwater and will also use it to reduce the amount of firewood and propane she currently uses to cook the fish she sells. 

This loan represents 10% of the total cost of her Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester kit.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is 51 years old and has two children. Avelina is married and has one child who is still in school.

Avelina is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. Avelina requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Avelina has been in pig-fattening for 12 years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Avelina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Vanessa Alexandra

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo se reúnen cada 15 días en Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su gran artesanía como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.
En este lugar vive la señora Vanessa, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 10, 7 y 4 años de edad, los  dos mayores estudian en escuela, el menor en jardín de infantes. Su esposo es controlador de un bus.
Doña Vanessa es una muy buena esposa que  para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos que generan sus tres hijos se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta,  ella también trabaja a base de pedidos que le realizan  sus clientes. Trabaja tres días por semana pero sobre todo por las mañanas ya que a estas horas aprovecha que sus hijos están en la escuela y ya en la tardes no sale porque tiene que ayudarles en sus tareas escolares, ella deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada fin de semana. Lleva más de 4 años dedicada al comercio con el cual sale adelante dándoles lo mejor a sus pequeños.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo. Lleva 4 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos mejora su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
The Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo Community Bank meets every 15 days in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its rich culture and handicrafts, such as its toquilla straw hats, famous both in Ecuador and beyond.

Señora Vanessa lives here. She is 26 years old and married. She has three children with her husband, aged ten, seven and four. The two eldest study at school, and the youngest goes to nursery. Her husband is a bus conductor. 

Vanessa is a very good wife who, in order to help out her husband with the costs of bringing up their three children, works selling all kinds of clothing door to door. She also works on the basis of orders made by her customers. She works three days a week, mainly in the mornings, since she makes the most of the time when her children are at school. In the afternoon, she stays at home, because she has to help them with their homework. She lets her customers pay on credit, which she collects every weekend. She has been in this business for over four years, which allows her to get ahead and offer the best to her children.

This loan is to buy different kinds of clothing. She has been a member of the community bank for four years, and she likes it because its loans have enabled her to improve her business. Her dream is to offer the best of everything to her little ones.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Dieynaba

texts.fr:
Madame Dièynaba est entrée dans le commerce il y a de cela 6 ans. Elle vend des habits prêt à porter pour femme et des tissus. Elle est âgée de  57ans, mariée et mère de famille. Elle a ouvert  une cantine  au marché. Avec  le crédit elle va acheter  des body, des jeans, des chemises, des habits prêts à porter et des tissus qu’elle revend à sa clientèle.  Elle commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 12h
Dieynaba n’a pas de charges et travaille pour diversifier ses produits et services. Elle a comme souhait  d’ouvrir une autre cantine pour augmenter  son bénéfice.
texts.en: Dieynaba entered into this business six years ago. She sells ready-to-wear women's clothes and fabrics. She is a 57-year-old woman, who is married and also a mother. She opened a stall in the market place. With her loan, she will buy leotards, jeans, shirts, ready-to-wear clothes and fabrics, which she will resell to her customers. She starts her day at 9 AM and finishes at 12 PM. Dieynaba doesn't have much money and works in order to diversify her products and services. Her wish is to open another stall in order to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy fabrics destined for resale

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.en:
Inocencia, 57 years of age, still single and living with her four siblings in one house in their village. She's been involved in a farming business for almost ten years and earned a net income of 20,000 PHP from her last cropping. Her profits were spent in her hog-raising business in order to make additional income.

Now she wants to request a loan from the generous lenders amounting to 25,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers, seedlings, and insecticides for her farm. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seedlings, and insecticides for her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish and crabs to sell.

loans.name: El Control  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito El Control está formado por 7 mujeres quienes son amigas y vecinas  que se han reunido con un mismo objetivo el cual es el crecimiento personal y el de sus negocio, son personas amables y gentiles que están en la lucha para ofrecer un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Viven por los alrededores de la parroquia Turi en Cuenca, lugar que es conocido como el mirador de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene varios lugares para disfrutar, se encuentra rodeada de bellos paisajes, su gente se dedica a la agricultura, crianza de animales y laboran en diferentes actividades en la ciudad.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Jessica, este es el tercer crédito que realiza en el grupo de crédito El Control, le gusta este tipo de crédito por la unión y solidaridad de todas sus compañeras y amigas del grupo, a la vez que poco a poco va creciendo en sus actividades económicas.
La Señora Jessica es madre soltera de 2 preciosos hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad, su primer hijo está en el inicial, la casa en la que vive es arrendada.
Doña Jessica se dedica a laborar en varias actividades, en el mercado vende frutas de temporada de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo, tiene este negocio desde hace 6 años, por la noche en su casa se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida rápida. 
El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de frutas y víveres para sus negocios. Su meta es de incrementar sus negocios.
texts.en:
The El Control loan group is made up of seven women who are friends and neighbors, who got together with the common goal of personal and business growth. They are friendly and kind women, who are fighting to offer their children a better future. They live in the parish of Turi in Cuenca, which is known for the viewpoint it offers of the city of Cuenca. There are many places to see there and it is surrounded by beautiful countryside. Its inhabitants work in agriculture, animal husbandry and various businesses in the city. 

One of the members of this group is Señora Jessica. This is her third loan with the El Control loan group. She likes this kind of loan because of the unity and solidarity of all of the group members, and because little by little, their economic activities grow.

Jessica is a single mother to two beautiful children aged four and two. Her eldest child has just started school. They live in a rented house.

Jessica makes a living in various activities. She sells seasonal fruits in the market from Mondays to Saturdays, with no fixed hours. She has had this business for six years. At home in the evenings, she makes and sells fast food.

She will invest the money from this loan in buying fruit and provisions for her businesses. Her goal is to expand her businesses.

loans.use: to buy fruit and provisions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Any Mariela

texts.es:
Any es una joven de 27 años de edad emprendedora, luchadora, la cual es casada y aun no tiene hijos por lo que día a día lucha en compañía de su esposo para salir adelante y poder ofrecer a sus futuros hijos un buen futuro. Ella tiene un grado de educación secundaria graduándose como maestra de educación primaria desempeñando en la actualidad su profesión en una escuela de la comunidad. Su esposo trabaja como motorista y también como agricultor el cual apoya todas y cada uno de las decisiones que ella toma para poderse superar en familia y en hogar. Actualmente viendo ella la necesidad de ofrecer a sus vecinos, familiares y amigos un nuevo producto más cerca d sus hogares decidió emprender una idea de negocio llevándola  a la realidad la cual se trata de la venta de variedades con la cual está comenzando y su anhelo y sueño es ver crecer su tienda. 
Por lo que sus primeras compras para surtir su negocio no son muchas y decidió acercarse a las instalaciones de la cooperativa COMIXMUL y solicitar financiamiento para la compra de 2 vitrinas, 4 mostradores, cuadernos, ropa para la temporada, mochilas entre otros que sus clientes le han buscado y no ha podido vender por la inexistencia del mismo.
Sus planes para el futuro es convertir su pequeña idea de negocio en una tienda en general la cual pueda vender todo tipo de electrodomésticos línea blanca, juegos de sala, comedor, estufas entre otros que ella anhela y sueña vender en su negocio.
texts.en:
Any is a young 27 year old entrepreneur. She's a real fighter, and is married but does not have any children yet. Every day, she works alongside her husband to move forwards and offer her future children a good future. She completed higher education, graduating as a primary school teacher, and currently works at a local school. Her husband works as a motorbike driver and a farmer, and supports every one of the decisions she makes to move ahead as a family and a household. 

Today, having seen the need to offer her neighbors, family and friends new products closer to their homes, she decided to set up a business selling a variety of goods, with which she is beginning her dream of seeing her shop expand.

Since the first purchases she makes to stock her shop are limited, she decided to approach the COMIXMUL cooperative and request a loan to buy two display cases, four counters, notebooks, seasonal clothes, backpacks and other items that her customers have asked her for and that she hasn't had in stock.

Her future plans are to convert her small business idea into a general store selling all kinds of home electrical appliances, games, dining goods, heaters, and other items that she dreams of selling in her shop.

loans.use: to buy equipment and goods to sell in her business.

loans.name: Gita Prasad

texts.en:
Gita Prasad  is 45 years old and a married woman. She is a housewife and she is illiterate, but can sign her name. Her husband is 55 years old. They live in the small town of Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri. They have three children. One is studying in class 12. They are living in a concrete home. Her husband has a grocery business which is not running smoothly because they are unable to buy a wide variety of grocery items to make their shop more attractive to consumers. They are both earning from this business and they don’t have any other source of income. 

From her neighbor Gita Prasad came to know about BJS loan funding. As soon as she heard about BJS, she applied for a loan of INR 15,000 to help her husband buy a variety of items for their grocery shop such as chips, biscuits, detergent, etc. She is sincerely thankful to BJS and Kiva because she is very much in need of this loan.

loans.use: to buy a larger variety of grocery items to expand the business.

loans.name: Silvina

texts.en:
Silvina is applying for a loan of $ 1,500 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 28 years old. She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as trousers, shorts, shirts with long and short sleeves and clothing for children. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for bigger loan in the future. 

Silvina is living in a town near by the school; her kiosk is located.

loans.use: To buy trousers, shorts, shirts with long and short sleeves and clothing for children.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza earns a living through her retail sales of farm products. She is married, and she has been in the business for more than two years now.

Liza is asking for a loan to buy more products to sell like bananas, cassava, potatoes, and others. With this, she will be able to sell more thus augmenting her sales and income.

In the future, Liza hopes of making her business a success so it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of her family, like the schooling of her son.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell, like bananas, cassava, potatoes, and others

loans.name: Moeu

texts.en:
Moeu is 28 years old and married, with two children. 

She is a market vendor in local village of the Rokhak Kiri district, Battambang province. She opens her grocery store from 6:30 a.m. until 3 p.m. Her husband helps her manage the store every day. Having been in this business for nearly 10 years, she is able to make a daily income of KHR 20,000.

Currently, Moeu’s family doesn’t have a safe latrine for use at home, so she wants to improve theeir sanitation and personal hygiene. In this particular way, she has requested a loan of KHR 4,000,000 to build a household latrine. 

Thanks to the water loan program offered by HKL and Kiva with a special interest rate, she is encouraged to focus on a healthy living conditions, safeguard the health of her family, and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a household latrine.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 25 years old and her husband, Tapas, is 30 years old. They live in a 'kachha' house (made of mud, bamboo, straw, etc.) in the small village of Dhupguri. Anita is a hardworking housewife and has been educated up to standard 9 (Grade 9). She has two children. Amongst them, one is in standard 2 (Grade 2). She wants her children to lead a very successful life with a good education. 

Anita and her husband have a clothing retail business. They have chosen this business as it’s a very profitable business in the locality. With this loan from BJS she wants to extend her business and purchase a larger variety of clothes. Her self-confidence and enormous skill with people make her a good entrepreneur, which helps her to improve their economic and social condition.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for her retail business

loans.name: Amena

texts.en:
Amena is a housewife in Purba Magurmari village, Jalpaiguri District, West Bengal. She is a 44-year-old woman, married to Iaenul, with five children. Amena is an illiterate woman but can sign her name. On the other hand her husband studied up to standard V (grade 5). She and her husband run their grocery shop. Sometimes they are obliged to purchase grocery items on credit which creates a great problem in their business. 

Amena has applied for a loan from BJS so that she can purchase a variety of grocery items for cash, and she also wants to extend her business.  She believes this loan will bring a significant positive change in her life. She has proved that it is not that difficult to see the light by overcoming the dark hurdles if financial assistance is added to one’s industry. She is very much grateful towards BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: to buy a variety of grocery items for her shop.

loans.name: Binodini

texts.en:
Binodini is a 44-year-old married woman. She is a housewife and she is illiterate, but can sign her name. Her husband Saroj is 56 years old. They live in the small town of Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri. They have three children. One is studying in class 10. They are living in a concrete home. Her husband has a grocery business which is not running smoothly because they are unable to buy a wide variety of grocery items to make their shop more attractive to consumers. They are both earning from this business and they don’t have any other source of income. 

From a friend Binodini came to know about BJS loan funding. As soon as she heard about BJS, she applied for a loan to help her husband to buy a variety of items for their grocery shop such as toffee, toothbrushes, snacks, etc. As soon she gets the loan, she dreams of purchasing all the necessary grocery items to run her shop smoothly.  She wants to make her business more developed so that in the future, her son can become established in his life. She is sincerely thankful to BJS and Kiva because she is very much in need of this loan.

loans.use: To buy a larger variety of grocery items to increase the business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma earns a living through her retail sales of cosmetic products. She is a married, with four children. 

Norma has been in the business for more than three years now.  She is asking for a loan to buy more cosmetic products, like perfume, lotions, soap, toiletries, lipsticks, and others. 

With this, she will be able to sell more and earn more. She dreams of expanding her business in the future and saving money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetic products, like perfume, lotions, soap, toiletries, lipsticks, and others

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
This is Rowena, 44, resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Frankline, a store-keeper and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rowena operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Rowena dreams that her stall will be bigger and hopes that her children will finish their studies.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Hao

texts.en:
Hao was born in 1993.  She lives in Yen Phong, Bac Ninh, Vietnam. She is learning hotel and tourism management at Hanoi Open University. Her course lasts 40 months, and she will be graduated in June, 2017. (The woman who sitting next to her in this picture is her mother.)

Hao’s family has seven members. Her parents are farmers. Her father also works as an electrical repairman to earn a living. She has a brother and two sisters. She is her parents’ older daughter. Her family’s income is about VND 5,000,000. 

She is the first person in her family who studies in the university. Hao has a passion for her major. She realizes that her country is developing well, and this job will continually expand. She believes that after finishing this course, she will have enough knowledge and opportunities to apply for a high-paid job. Moreover, she can also promote her country's and her hometown’s images to the world, too. 

She wants to borrow VND 15,300,000 to pay her education’s fees. Besides lacking education’s fees, she has other difficulties, such as lacking studying tools. 

Through this program, she wants to tell people that she appreciates the help of people all around the world who have contributed to this kind of program. This has contributed a lot to the education of her individually and of Vietnam’s youth generation in general.

loans.use: to pay her education’s fees.

loans.name: Sahera

texts.en:
Sahera is a 39-year-old married woman with three children. Her husband is a mason and Sahera is a day laborer. Both of them are illiterate. One of her children is not receiving an education. They live in a small town of Dhupguri. 

From the very beginning they have struggled a lot. To earn more money, Sahera has  shifted to another  business  and plans to purchase a cow for extra income so that they can sell milk and milk product to the market. They hope that this loan will be very useful to them.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to sell milk and milk products.

loans.name: Gitika

texts.en:
Gitika  is a 25-year-old married woman. She studied until class 8. Her husband Bishnu is 30 years old and he studied until class 5. They live in the small town of Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri. They have two children. Her husband is running a thread mill and that is not going smoothly so she decided to earn money by herself. She thought of buying seeds for potato cultivation so she applied for a loan. 

Gitika heard about BJS from her friend and then she decided to take the loan for her upcoming business. With her loan of INR 15,000 she will purchase seeds and start potato cultivation. She is very excited about her new business, and she is thankful to BJS and Kiva because she needs this loan for the growth of her family.

loans.use: To buy seeds for potato cultivation.

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en:
A $ 1,500 loan is offered to Domingas to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2011 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like fish water, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, biscuits and slippers. She is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy fish, water, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, biscuits and slippers.

loans.name: Phong

texts.en:
Phong was born in 1988. He lives in Yen Phong, Bac Ninh, Vietnam. He is learning a master's degree in a water-supplying major at the National University of Civil Engineering. His course lasts 20 months, and he will be graduated in August, 2014. (The woman who was sitting next to him in this picture is his mother.)

His family has five members. He has a brother and a sister. His parents are farmers. His family’s total income is VND 7,000,000 per month. He has a part-time job to help pay his education’s fees. 

He chose this major because he thinks this sector is indispensable in life, so that after finishing the course, he will have more opportunities to apply for a high-paid job or get promotion in his present job. 

He wants to borrow VND 9,180,000 VND to pay his education’s fees. If he can’t access this loan, he can’t continue the course because he doesn’t have enough time to go to work to pay for studying. Besides lacking education fees, he has other difficulties, like lacking learning equipment. 

He appreciates the humanity of this program, and he will try his best in studying and working for the best future. He hopes that other students in Vietnam can also supported by this kind of program, like him.

loans.use: to pay his education’s fees.

loans.name: Jatan Bala

texts.en:
Jatan Bala is a 35-year-old married woman with two children. Her husband is 40 years old. Jatan Bala has studied up to class IV (grade 4) and her husband has received education up to VIII (grade 8). Both children are receiving an education. 

Jatan Bala's husband runs a betel leaf shop and she is a housewife. Betel leaves are sold as breath fresheners. Unfortunately, the income from his shop is not enough, so Jatan wanted to find another way to make money. They have struggled a lot, but now Jatan Bala does not want her children to suffer from poverty. 

Jatan Bala is a very ambitious lady, so she decided to take a loan from BJS to purchase a cow so that she can earn money by selling milk and milk products in the market. She took a loan from BJS of INR 15,000 and hopes that their business will flourish and their economic status will also rise. They are thankful to BJS for giving them the support to start their new dairy business!

loans.use: To purchase a cow to sell milk and milk products.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda earns a living through her dried fish vending. She lives with her family in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. 

Rosenda is asking for a loan to buy more dried fish to sell. With this, she will be able  to improve her sales and income. Rosenda hopes to make her business a success so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rosalie works hard to support her family.

She has a business making fishing nets in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Rosalie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like nylon thread, rope, etc. for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like nylon thread and rope for her business.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita, 55 years of age, is married and they are blessed with four children. Her husband works as an OFW at Saudi Arabia. She's been in the  farming business for almost 30 years and earned a net income of 100,000 PHP in the last harvest. 

The profit that she earned was spent on her hog raising business and retail store business, but then due to insufficient funds for her farming activity she decided to apply to the generous lenders for a loan  amounting to 50,000 PHP to purchase farm necessities such as insecticides, fertilizer, and rice seedlings. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted to make her business more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase farm necessities such as insecticides, fertilizer, and rice seedlings.

loans.name: Lalita

texts.en:
Lalita is a 30-year-old married woman and her husband is 35 years old. Both Lalita and her husband are illiterate. Lalita is the mother of two children. She lives in a small village of Dhupguri. Her husband is a farmer. For farming, lots of money is required to cultivate crops and land is also needed. Her husband farms in someone else's field and has to give a certain amount of money to the person who owns the land. It was becoming very difficult for Lalita to arrange the basic necessities of life because of the need to pay for use of the land. 

Lalita came to know about BJS and took a loan of INR 8000 so that she can purchase a cow and can sell milk and milk products at the market. She hopes that she will help her husband so that he can purchase his own plot of land for farming. She also dreams of giving an education to her children. Lalita is sincerely grateful  to BJS and Kiva for extending a helping hand.

loans.use: To purchase cow to sell milk and milk products.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 58 years old and married. Rosalinda works very hard to provide for them.
