Rosalinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, cooking oil, soft-drinks, noodles, coffee, etc. in her general store.

Rosalinda has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, cooking oil, soft-drinks, noodles, coffee, etc. 

Rosalinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, cooking oil, soft-drinks, noodles and coffee.

loans.name: Mena

texts.en:
Mena is 43 years old and married with three children.

Mena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods like biscuits, canned goods, noodles, vinegar, sugar, etc. to sell.

Mena has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns additional income from selling purified drinking water.

Mena aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more goods like biscuits, canned goods, noodles, vinegar and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Thoa

texts.en:
Thoa was born in 1993. She lives in Yen Phong, Bac Ninh, Vietnam. She is studying Human Resources Administration in the Vietnam University of Commerce. Her course lasts 48 months and she will graduate in December, 2015. 

The woman who is sitting next to her in this picture is her mother. Her family has four members. She is the first person in her family to study in the University. Her parents are farmers. Her family’s total income is about 15,000,000VND per month. 

Thoa still receives subsidies from her parents to pay her education fees. She chose this major because she thinks that after finishing this course, she will have more opportunities to apply for a good job and have good promotions in her career. 

Thoa wants to borrow 15,300,000 VND to pay her education fees. If she couldn’t access this loan, she would not be able to continue the courses because her parents can’t give her subsidies anymore. Besides the lack of education fees, she has other difficulties, like the lack of learning equipment. 

She appreciates the humanity of this program and she will try her best to study and work for the best future. She also hopes that other students in Vietnam like her can also be supported by this kind of program.

loans.use: to pay her education fees.

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en:
Adoracion is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. Her pineapple farm and cassava crops are continuously growing. Truly her loan is helpful in her business as well as in their household expenditures. There are some challenges that she is going through with her business but by the grace of God, she always manages to overcome them and still have a positive outlook on life. She is planning to expand her business by buying more seeds to plant.

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy gardening materials and supplies such as seeds and fertilizer needed in her business. Her profits from his business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Adoracion hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams that her family will always be in good health. She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and garden inputs for her business.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Merlinda has been in this business for eight years. Merlinda earns additional income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her food-vending business.

Merlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy was born in 1992. She lives in Bac Ninh province. Her major is Preschool Pedagogy at Bac Ninh Pedagogical University. Her course lasts three years and she will be graduated in 2013. In this picture, she is carrying her child and sitting next to her husband. 

Thuy’s family has three members and she is her parents’ oldest daughter. Both Thuy and her younger sister graduated from high school, but only Thuy has a higher education. Her family’s income is about 5,000,000 VND per month. She chose this major because she loves children very much and she wants to have a stable job. That’s why she will try her best to continue until the end of this university’s course. 

She wants to borrow 10,710,000 VND to pay her education fees. Besides lacking the education fees, she has other difficulties, such as living expenses and transportation fees. After graduating, she hopes to find a high paying job to help support her family and improve their standard of living. 

If she couldn’t access this loan, she might have to stop studying at the University. Through this program, she wants to tell people that she appreciates the help of people all around the world who have contributed to this kind of program. It has provided a lot to the education of her individually and to the Vietnamese youth generation in general.

loans.use: to pay her education fees.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita dreams of having a comfortable lifestyle someday. She is 59 years old, married and blessed with three children. Anita does hog-fattening and usually earns PHP 5,000 every time she sells them, which she uses for daily consumption and allowances.

Now Anita’s hog-fattening business needs additional capital to buy feeds and vitamins. She knows that with the amount of loan she requested, she could ensure they get proper nutrition and reach their optimum growth. For this matter, Anita is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000. She believes that this amount of loan will do much to improve her financial stability and way of living.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en:
Nazeeran is 43 years old and is a hard-working woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan with her family. Her husband is the only earning person in the family. He owns a shop selling stones that are used in jewellery making and embroidered dresses. 

Her husband needs funds to purchase products for his shop to continue his business. Therefore his wife, Nazeeran has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband. He will use the loan amount to purchase a variety of colorful stones. 

Nazeeran hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband work. She is a responsible mother of four children and her biggest dream is to provide quality education to her children. She prays a lot for the success of her husband's success and for the bright future of her children.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of colorful stones.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is married and has two children.

Teresita is engaged in growing of citrus fruit, particularly calamansi. Before, she was a small-scale vegetable vendor. With her desire to succeed and obtain her dreams,Teresita did her best to improve the production of her citrus farm land. Sometimes she buys her co-farmers' citrus fruit and sells it and her own harvested fruit to big buyers.

Since her citrus production has improved, she requested additional capital of PHP 50,000 which allows her to buy more citrus fruits and pay for the expenditures in harvesting her fruits at their farm.

Teresita hopes to run a mini agricultural supply business someday.

loans.use: to buy more citrus fruits and pay for the expense of harvesting her own fruit.

loans.name: Naisrin

texts.en: Originally from Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Naisrin is 47 years old and a mother blessed with three dependent children. For the sake of her family, rice farming and working for others for a fee are her core sources of income. She has been involved in her current business for ages and it has returned her about US$ 6 per day. This is the first loan for Naisrin with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan amount to pay for tuition fee and school materials for her son who wants to pursue his Bachelor's degree, majoring in electronics. She hopes that her son will have specific skills to earn a living.after graduation.

loans.use: To pay for tuition fee and school materials for her son

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 42-year-old house wife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of two children. Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas, oranges in his shop. Presently, he needs to purchase a variety of fruits for the winter season from the field. However due to the lack of funds he finds it difficult.

Therefore, his wife Shaheen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. Her aim is to help her husband to purchase variety of fruits for winter season, like apples, oranges, bananas etc from the field so he can sell them in the market at a profitable price.

Shaheen's dream is for the bright future of her children. She is very much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of fruits like apples, oranges and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is 32 years old and is a mother of four children. 

She is taking loan for her husband who wants to buy leather to sew leather jackets for the winter season. Her husband sews and sells the leather jackets to garment shops. The winter season is going to start in Pakistan and the cost of leather jackets becomes double. For that reason, he wants to buy leather so that he can earn a maximum profit in the winter season.

Therefore, Nazia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he can buy leather to sew jackets. She hopes that her husband will utilize this amount in positive ways. Nazia thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy leather for sewing leather jackets.

loans.name: Abdunaim

texts.en:
Abdunaim is a purposeful man. He is 23 years old. Abdunaim is married but has no children. His wife is a seamstress. 

Abdunaim always wanted to provide his family with all necessary things. It’s for this reason that six years ago began own business of driving. Thanks to his good service, he has managed to gain many customers. Since he’s had his business, his family’s quality of life has been improving and the financial challenges are being solved little by little. 

He is asking for a loan to buy new car. In this way his business will have the opportunity to provide better service and to increase his income, which will allow him to offer his parents and wife a better quality of life and better financial opportunities for getting ahead.

loans.use: To buy new car for his taxi business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 33 years old, married and has three children.

She and her husband work together in order to earn a living. Jocelyn generates income through her hog-fattening business. She has been involved with this kind of business for two years. 

With her determination to improve her way of life and increase her income, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000, which will be used to buy feeds, medicine and vitamins for her hogs. She hopes and prays to gain enough profit from her hog-fattening business to meet her family's basic necessities.

loans.use: to buy feeds, medicine and vitamins for her hogs.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma is 35-year-old lady, and she is a very poor and needy woman. The major reason for this is that her husband does not have a profitable job at this time. She and her family are living hand-to-mouth.

Her husband provides sheltering services to earn money to feed the whole family. When planks have broken and lost their smoothness, he replaces them with new ones. Now her husband is unable to continue his business without new planks. Therefore, Uzma requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy new, smooth wooden boards and bamboo to continue his business again. 

She hopes that this loan will bring positive changes in her life and that her husband will earn maximum profit with the help of this loan. Uzma is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner because it empowers her husband to buy new sheltering materials for his business.

loans.use: To buy wooden boards and bamboo for providing sheltering services.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 55-year-old married woman; she is taking out a loan for her son who has to buy a new body for his auto rickshaw. Her son has been driving an auto rickshaw for many years in Lahore, Pakistan. He drives his rickshaw by day and night so as to get maximum profit. A few days ago he was driving his rickshaw on the road as usual and unintentionally got into an accident. Due to the collision, its body got serious damages. Now his passengers feel uncomfortable during travel.

Razia requested a loan so that her son could replace the rickshaw body and fix the engine problem so that he can drive it smoothly again. Her son is responsible for his own family; his children are fully dependent upon their father.

She thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw body and do some engine maintenance.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is  taking a loan of $1500 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep for her stall such as chicken, beef, salt, beer and a bucket.She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $600.  She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy chicken, beef, salt, beer and a bucket

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad is 35 years old, a hard-working woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan with her family. Her husband is the only earning person in the family. He owns a shop for stones and beads that are used in jewellery-making and embroidered dresses.

Her husband needs funds to purchase stones and beads from various areas to sell at a profitable price at his shop. As he doesn't have savings to purchase the needful things, his wife, Shamshad, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband. He will use the loan amount to purchase a variety of colorful stones and beads. 

Shamshad hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's work. She is a responsible mother of four children and her biggest dream is to provide quality education to her children. She prays a lot for the success of her husband's business and for the bright future of her children.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of colorful stones and beads

loans.name: Yevgine

texts.en:
Yevgine is an experienced farmer from the Gogaran village of Lori region. She lives with her husband. 

Both of them are extensively engaged in agribusiness, which is the main source of their income. They are involved in cattle breeding, in aviculture, in beekeeping, and in cultivation of wheat, potatoes, and alfalfa. 

As the life is getting more expensive day by day, Yevgine wants to expand her agribusiness in order to meet her family's needs more effectively. A loan of USD 2,500 will be a great support to this hard-working woman and her family, enabling her to purchase seven steers and to make previous credit repayments. 

Yevgine and her husband rely on the good will of the lenders and will be very grateful to them for their support in collecting the needed loan to sustain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase seven steers and make previous credit repayments

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is 40 years old, and she lives with her spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She wants to make some savings so she can provide better living facilities for her children, but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income.

Her husband has been driving an auto rickshaw for many years; his income is insufficient to feed his entire family.  He has to maintain the auto rickshaw body, but he does not have enough to fix the problem. 

Therefore, she has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband will be able to buy a new auto rickshaw body. 

She hopes that she will be able to make enough savings till the time of her chidren's marriages in the future, and she will succeed in providing higher education to her children.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw body for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Tuyen

texts.en:
Tuyen was born in 1995. She lives in Yen Phong, Bac Ninh, Vietnam. She is a Business Administration major at the Thai Nguyen Economic and Business Administration University. Her course lasts four years and she will be graduated in 2017. The woman who is sitting next to her in this picture is her mother. 

Tuyen’s family has five members. Her parents are farmers. Her father also works as a construction worker to earn a living. She has a brother and two sisters. She is the only one in her family who has tried her best to seek higher education. Her family’s income is about 10,000,000 VND. 

She has a passion for the major she is studying because she thinks that it can be developed well in the near future. She said that this major is suitable to the country’s industrialization and modernization process. Tuyen believes that after finishing this course, she will have knowledge and opportunities to apply to a company and get a high-paid job. 

She wants to borrow 10,098,000 VND to buy a computer to support her major. Besides the lack of studying tools, she has other difficulties, such as her living costs and transportation fees. Through this program, she wants to tell people that she appreciates the help of people all around the world who have contributed to this kind of program. This program has provided a lot to her education as an individual, and also to the Vietnamese youth generation in general.

loans.use: to buy a computer to support her studies.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia is 40 years old and lives in the town of Ibanda in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past five years, Scovia has been working hard to manage her textile shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Scovia has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to expand her business, and will help Scovia to generate greater profits. She will purchase more clothes to be sold in the shop. Scovia hopes that in the future she will be able to own two more clothes shops. 

Scovia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Scovia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Loyce

texts.en:
Loyce is 40 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 11 years, Loyce has been working hard to manage her clothes business, which sells different types of clothes. 

To help expand her business, Loyce has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more stock and venture into all types of clothes, and will help Loyce to generate greater and increased profits. Loyce hopes that, in the future, she will be able to become rich.

Loyce is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Loyce who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more stock and venture into all types of clothes

loans.name: Keziah

texts.en:
Keziah is 39 years old and lives in the town of Tororo in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, Keziah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells foodstuffs.

To help expand her business, Keziah has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase her stock with more foodstuffs to sell, and will help Keziah to generate greater profits and to increase the stock. Keziah hopes that, in the future, she will be able to expand the business.

Keziah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Keziah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to increase stock with more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Emprendedoras  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Emprendedoras está formado por 7 mujeres que viven por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad goza de una arquitectura colonial que guarda su historia, por ello recibió el nombre de Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, por su geografía accidentada esta ciudad cuenta con varios lugares en donde se puede disfrutar de la naturaleza y belleza del campo. Su gente al igual que las socias son mujeres que luchan el día a día para mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares y así brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos, son mujeres que siempre nos regalan una sonrisa y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Erika, está realizando su primer crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañera del grupo de crédito Emprendedoras, fue invitada a este hermoso grupo por su mamá y espera con los créditos cumplir poco a poco sus objetivos que tiene establecidos.
La Señora Erika tiene 24 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña de 7 años de edad que está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad, vive en una casa que arrienda.
Doña Erika desde hace 5 años labora como empleada privada actividad que la desempeña de lunes a viernes 8 horas diarias y el sábado hasta el medio día.
El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de una computadora para su hija ya que necesita para la escuela. Su meta es de ponerse su propio taller de tapicería ya que ese es su arte pero le hace falta capital.
texts.en:
The Emprendedoras (Enterprising) credit group is comprised of 7 women that live around the city of Cuenca.  This city enjoys a colonial architecture that keeps its history - for this it received the name of Cultural Heritage of Humanity.  Because of its rugged terrain this city has several places where one can enjoy the nature and beauty of the countryside.  Its people, like the women of this group, struggle every day to improve the economic stability of their homes and thus provide a better future for their children.  They are women who always reward us with a smile and still maintain the culture and traditions of their people.

One of the members of this group is Señora Erika.  She is completing her first loan along with her friends and fellow members of the Emprendedoras credit group.  She was invited into this beautiful group by her mother and hopes with the loans to complete a little at a time the objectives that it has established.

Señora Erika is 24 years old, is the single mother of a 7 year old daughter who is studying in a city school, and lives in a rented house.  Doña Erika has worked for the last five years as a private employee, an activity that she performs Monday through Friday 8 hours per day, and Saturday until noon.

She will invest the money from her loan in the purchase of a computer for her daughter which she needs for school.  Her goal is to get into her own upholstery shop because that is her craft but she lacks the capital.

loans.use: to purchase a computer.

loans.name: Rubik

texts.en:
Rubik is a young entrepreneur from the town of Spitak in the Lori region of Armenia. He lives with his wife, brother and parents. 

Rubik and his father are the only breadwinners of the family and work really hard to make ends meet. To be able to meet his family’s needs, Rubik runs a small store with construction materials. Previously, he worked as a seller in a construction materials store, but he decided to run his own business. Rubik’s father works in the transportation sector. 

The assortment of goods that Rubik sells in his store is not that big and needs to be updated from time to time for his small business to function in a sustainable way. To reach that goal, Rubik needs a loan of $3,000 USD. He will use the loan to purchase a new assortment of construction materials to sell in his store and to make previous credit repayments. 

He and his family highly rely on the lenders' support and will be grateful to them for their goodwill in helping to collect the needed loan.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of construction materials to sell in his store and to make previous credit repayments

loans.name: Floriana

texts.en:
Floriana is married with seven children. She buys and sells hardwood charcoal. She needs this loan to buy charcoal because she is increasing her number of customers and needs to increase her amount of charcoal to meet their demands.

Her greatest desire is to provide an education for her children who attend school so that she can guarantee them a prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 33 years old and lives in the town of Tororo in the Mbale region of Uganda. She has 2 children who are all currently in school. For the past 3 years, Harriet has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes to sell, and will help Harriet to generate greater and increased profits and pay school fees. Harriet hopes that in the future she will be able to educate her children.

Harriet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Harriet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Dai

texts.en:
Dai was born in 1992. He lives in Bac Ninh province. He is an Automotive Technology major at Hanoi Industrial University. His course lasts 36 months and he will be graduated in 2014. His education fees are subsidized by his parents. The woman who is sitting next to him in this picture is his mother. 

Dai’s family has four members. His parents are farmers. He has an older sister. He is the second person in his family to graduate high school and have a higher education. His family’s income is about 5,000,000VND per month. Dai has a passion for his major. He finds interesting ideas from his studies. He also understands that learning helps him have the qualifications to get a high-paid job and bring income to his family. 

He wants to borrow 15,300,000 VND to pay his education fees. If he couldn’t access this loan, his continued studying could not be ensured. He appreciates the help of people all around the world who are raising funds for this kind of program. It supports the education of several students in Vietnam, and he hopes that this program could be expanded to help more of them.

loans.use: to pay his education fees.

loans.name: Bashira

texts.en:
Bashira is a 38-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan and is the mother of 4 children. Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas, and oranges in his shop. 

Bashira has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a variety of fruits from the field to sell them in the market at a profitable price. Her dreams are for the higher education of her children. Bashira is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruits to sell

loans.name: Bunna

texts.en:
Bunna is 57 years old, married, and has five children, four of whom are married and live independently. Only her youngest child is still studying at school. Bunna works as a civil servant, earning a monthly salary of USD80.00 per month. She also takes time to help her husband manage their farm in Kampong Chhnang province. 

The challenge for Bunna is that she doesn’t have her own motorcycle for commuting to her workplace, so she has to pay taxi fare for a ride. To help reduce her traveling expenses, Bunna would like to buy a motorcycle to provide her need for daily transportation. Due to the lack of capital, she has applied for a loan amounting to 1,000 US dollars from HKL and Kiva lenders. She thanks lenders for their generosity towards a poor fellow like her.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to provide her need for daily transportation.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha, 34, is married with one child, who is attending a local school. She currently lives with her husband, child and younger brother in a small house in the province of Kampong Cham in Cambodia. To earn a living, she and her husband work in agriculture and also sell firewood wholesale in their region. They have been in the wholesale business for almost a year, and together earn a sufficient income to cover their costs of living.

To sustain their business and maintain their income, Chantha needs a loan of $300 US as working capital to buy firewood to increase her stock. This will let her continue with her sales and improve her income. 

Her future plans are to expand her business in the next two years, to send her child to a good university in Phnom Penh and to renovate her house. She thanks lenders for their generosity to her family.

loans.use: to buy firewood to increase her stock.

loans.name: Nazeera

texts.en:
Nazeera aged 38 and is the mother of seven children. Her husband owns a shop in which he has installed a few compression molding machines. He takes orders for manufacturing plastic accessories and hires laborers for the molding machines on daily wages. For the manufacturing of different plastic accessories, he needs different categories and qualities of raw materials.

Now he has a larger contract than before but does not have enough funds to buy an additional molding machine and crushed raw materials to continue his manufacturing. Therefore, Nazeera requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to buy a molding machine and crushed raw materials for the molding machine. 

She has to look after a huge family and take care of each of her kids: their school fees, their diet and their health. For these purposes, she has need of a huge income and her husband is the only single person who is responsible to bear the household expenses. 

She is very happy after taking this loan and thanks Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an additional molding machine and crushing raw material for manufacturing plastic accessories

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresia is single and the mother of one child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.

She sells fruits and green vegetables. She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. She is requesting a loan to buy sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Rabiqa

texts.en:
Rabiqa requested a loan for her husband. He offers barbecues in the evening to the common people of his area. For this purpose he has to use grills, coal, chicken and a stall to offer his fast food. During the whole day he has to prepare the mixture of spices and mix it with the pieces of chicken. His business is working well and he has become famous in his town. To cope with the demand and to earn maximum profit, her husband wants to invest more money in his fast food business. 

Rabiqa is 23 years old, the mother of a daughter and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. With the loan amount her husband will buy more grills and chicken to offer barbecues. She hopes that through this business her husband will be able to get more income than before.

She thanks Kiva and its field partner, the BRAC Pakistan team.

loans.use: To buy more grills and chicken to offer barbecues.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 36-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. Her husband is a driver by profession and drives an auto rickshaw in Lahore city. He provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving his rickshaw for many years to cover the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine.

For this reason, Shahida has applied for a loan to buy new wheels for her husband's vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business. 
She is thankful to Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To repair an auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 43-year-old married woman. She has been in the work of hand embroidery for many years. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are in great demand, and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan to buy reels of silk threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way, she will be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful of getting an increase in her income by targeting more customers. 

She is taking her first loan, and she assured us that she will show good repayment history. Naseem dreams of her children's bright future and desires to build her own house, as she is now living in a rented house with her family

loans.use: To buy reels of silk threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Belina

texts.en:
Belina is married with six children. She runs a second-hand clothing store that helps her generate income for her family. Belina opened her store a year ago with her own working capital of 200 USD. 

Belina is requesting a 1,000 USD loan to buy stocks such as trousers, shorts, and short- and long-sleeved shirts to keep in her store. She is a hardworking woman who hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shorts, and shirts

loans.name: Dios Con Nosotros. Group

texts.es:
EL banco comunal Dios con nosotros está conformado nueve integrantes tres hombres y seis mujeres, padres  y madre responsables con 15 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de Malpaisillo lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Estas personas se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Y se esfuerzan día a día para bridarles estabilidad  económica, emocional, a su familia.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora del banco es Rosa y tiene por actividad económica la venta de pan como picos, semitas, cachos, tortas de pina, pan simple, pasteles. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta pan, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal Dios con Nosotros agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para brindarles un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
The "Dios con Nosotros" communal bank is comprised of nine members, three men and six women, who are responsible fathers and mothers with 15 children. They are from Malpaisillo, located in the northern part of the country. The group's members are characterized as being hard-working, responsible, and working toward personal success. They work every day to bring economic and emotional stability to their families.

Because of her efforts and desires to move forward, Rosa is the coordinator of the communal bank. She makes a living by selling bread such as bites, tarts, snacks, pineapple cakes, plain bread, and pies. She works 10 hours a day, offering her products by traveling and also from her home. The purpose of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock up her business by buying and selling bread. With this investment, she hopes that she will be able to earn better income in the near future. The "Dios con Nosotros" communal bank is thankful for the help that Kiva lenders provide to people with few resources from poor countries such as Nicaragua. This helps them to have a better future.

loans.use: to invest working capital and stock her business in buying and selling bread such as bites, tarts, snacks, pineapple cakes, plain bread, and pies.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima, 38, is a married woman with one child, who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

Halima operates a grocery stall, selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town-dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of high costs of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

She has decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business. With a loan of 15,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to buy tomatoes, onions and variety of other vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions and a variety of other vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Holiness

texts.en:
Holiness is married and a mother of four children who attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.

Holiness sells fruits and green vegetables. She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment someday. She is requesting a loan to buy sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en: Hanaa is a 57-year-old Lebanese widow living with her five children, some of whom are still attending school. In 2006, after the loss of her husband, she was forced to do whatever it takes to help her children live in good conditions. So, she started selling clothes from her home. With the unsatisfactory income that she earns, Hanaa is doing her best to support her children and provide them with needed education. She seeks to improve her business by purchasing a large quantity of clothes with the requested loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. Her main objective is to increase her sales so that she will be able to gain a superior income and enhance the family’s lifestyle. In the future, she looks forward to borrowing more Kiva loans and opening a proper clothing store where she will sell women's accessories as well.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of clothes for resale

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina, age 22, is a responsible mother of three children living happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. This is her first loan with BRAC. She is a new member and she agreed with the terms and conditions of BRAC.

Her husband owns a scrap shop and deals with scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles, etc. He has been running his business for many years. Nowadays, due to household expenses, he does not have the amount needed to buy scrap goods, and so he does not have scrap to sell for getting money.

Therefore, Samina requested a loan for her husband so that he could buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents. 

She is very impressed with this honorable support and expresses her wish to take more loans after the payment of this loan. She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy scrap goods such as iron, aluminum, plastic bottles for resale.

loans.name: Gulnaz's Group

texts.en:
Gulnaz is a 53-year-old married woman and mother of five. She has been running a business of selling clothes for many years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to people in her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good-quality clothes in her community. 

Gulnaz has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy a stock of different clothes for the winter season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. With this investment, she will be able to earn more income through greater sales. 

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving her children a good and quality education through all her hard efforts in her business. 

Gulnaz gives thanks to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a stock of different clothes for the winter season.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, es un joven estudiante muy sacrificado, ya que estudia y trabaja a la vez, y comenta que es muy difícil pero es la única forma de poder ser alguien en la vida.
Está estudiando la carrera de Administración, y comenta que le gustaría poder aplicar todo lo que aprende en la universidad en su trabajo y así poder ir ascendiendo y tener un mejor ingreso. Él vive con su abuela, quien ha sido su mayor sostén.
Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación, ya que tiene muchas cuotas que cubrir y dice que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Edgar is from the city of San Ignacio. He is a young student who sacrifices a lot since he is studying and working at the same time. He comments that it is very difficult but it is the only way to be able to be someone in life.

He is studying Administration and he comments that he could like to be able to apply all that he is learning at the university to his work and so be able to be promoted and have a better income. He lives with his grandmother who has been his main support.

He is asking for this loan to be able to invest it his university expenses since he has many fees to pay and he says that it will help him a lot.

loans.use: for university expenses.

loans.name: Nordi

texts.es:
Nordi es una persona solidaria, centrada y con una familia estable, ella quiere  ser una persona útil a la sociedad y es por eso que está estudiando una carrera universitaria.
Está siguiendo la carrera de derecho, ya que quiere ser una buena abogada, y con miras a ello es que se está esforzando al máximo. Desea poder ayudar a aquellas personas que necesiten de su ayuda.
Pide este préstamo, ya que lo necesita para cubrir sus cuotas de la universidad. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo, que le permitirá seguir estudiando y luchando por su meta.
texts.en:
Nordi is a supportive, centered person, with a stabled family. She wants to be someone who is useful to society. That is why she is in college. 

She is studying law, because she wants to be a good lawyer and to do that she is making a maximum effort. She wants to be able to help people who need her help. She is asking for this loan because she needs to to cover her college tuition. She is grateful for this opportunity that has been given to her, so she can keep studying and fighting for her goal.

loans.use: to pay for college tuition.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura vive en la ciudad de Pilar, vive con sus padres, y comenta que estudia y trabaja al mismo tiempo.
Su sueño es poder estudiar en otros países para poder hacer postgrados y así seguir creciendo, ya que sabe que la única forma de ser alguien en la vida es estudiando.
Es una persona muy sacrificada que está luchando y está esforzándose por crecer y salir adelante. Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en las cuotas de su universidad y así seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Laura lives in the city of Pilar. She lives with her parents and comments that she is studying and working at the same time. 

Her dream is to be able to study in other countries to do postgraduate studies and so continue growing, since she knows that the only way to be someone in life is through education.


She is a very selfless person who is struggling and is making an effort to grow and come out ahead. She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in university fees and so continue studying.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.en:
Emilio, age 40, is married to a semi government employee and they blessed with three children. 

He has done a rice farming business for almost 30 years, and last harvest season earned an amount of 70,000 PHP. His profit was used in the school allowances and daily expenditures of their family. 

Due to insufficient funds in his farming business, he decided to avail a loan amounting to 50,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers, seedlings, and insecticides for his farm. He's hoping that his requested loan will be granted so that his business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seedlings, and insecticides for his farm.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo desde muy joven se vió con la necesidad de trabajar, empezó a trabajar en el campo, y también con la gente que realizaba las obras de asfalto, luego en una Cooperativa, sin dejar de lado el estudio. Hoy día se encuentra culminando la carrera de Administración de  Empresas, que con mucho sacrificio logro.
Se esforzó mucho para estudiar, y así que ya no tenga que hacer trabajos muy duros, y sacrificados. Quiere ser un gran administrador y también poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de su tesis, ya que esta por defenderlo y le será de mucha ayuda. Esta agradecido por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir sus metas.
texts.en:
Since he was very young, Hugo has had to work. He started working in the fields and also with people who did asphalt work. Later he worked in a cooperative, without leaving school. Today he is finishing his major in business administration, which he was able to achieve with much sacrifice.  

He worked very hard at his studies so he wouldn't have to do difficult and demanding work anymore. He wants to be a manager and also be able to help his family. He is asking for this loan to invest in paying for his thesis, since he is about to defend it and it will be very helpful. He is grateful for this opportunity that he is getting to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to pay for his thesis expenses.

loans.name: Alex Bright

texts.en:
Alex Bright is 27 years old and married without children. He lives in the town of Lyantonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. For the past five years, Alex Bright has been working hard to manage his shop where he sells foodstuff. 

Alex Bright is requesting a 2,500,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to purchase more stock. His loan will help him generate greater profits and boost his business. Alex Bright hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business. 

Alex Bright is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Alex Bright who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase stock

loans.name: El Mirador  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito El Mirador está formado por 8 socias y 1 socio que viven por los alrededores de la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, este lugar gracias a su geografía accidentada se puede disfrutar de la belleza de la ciudad de Cuenca, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo antiguo y lo moderno. Su gente al igual que todas las socias son mujeres que están trabajando y se esfuerzan a diario para mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares, su objetivo en común es lograr que su familia tenga un mejor futuro.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Blanca, forma parte del grupo de crédito El Mirador desde hace 3 años, tiempo en el que ha llegado a establecer una muy buena amistad con todas sus compañeras del grupo, al mismo tiempo que los créditos le benefician para su negocio.
La Señora Blanca tiene 34 años de edad, está divorciada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 17 y 2 años de edad, su primer hijo está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
Doña Blanca es comerciante de artesanías, especialmente se dedica a la venta de sombreros de paja toquilla, vende este producto de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. 
El dinero de su crédito es para comprar sombreros de paja toquilla para continuar creciendo en su negocio. Su meta es viajar a los Estados Unidos.
texts.en:
The communal bank El Mirador comprises one male and eight female partners, who live on the outskirts of Turi parish in Cuenca. The area, thanks to geography, enjoys the beauty of the city of Cuenca, and its architecture is a mix of old and new. The residents, like all this group's female members, are working and striving each day to improve their households' financial circumstances. Their common goal is achieving a brighter future for their families. 

Blanca has been a member of the communal bank El Mirador for three years and has become friends with the other members and benefited from the loans, which have helped her business. Blanca, 34, is divorced and has two children, ages 17 and 2. Her oldest child attends a city high school. They don't own a house and live in a rented one. 

Blanca sells handicrafts, particularly straw hats, all week on a flexible schedule. She will use this loan to buy straw hats to continue growing her business. Her goal is to travel to the United States.

loans.use: to buy straw hats.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Maria, quien con su anterior credikiva adquirió una máquina y ahora contrata una empleada aumentar sus producción. Tiene mas ingresos y su calidad de vida se ve impactada positivamente. Ella dice a los finaciadores  de Kiva "gracias por su ayuda" Hoy requiere un nuevo crédito pues necesita aumentar el valor de la compra de telas, para responder a pedidos de sus clientela y hacer cada vez mas exitoso su negocio.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Maria, who with her previous Kiva loan acquired a sewing machine and now has hired a worker to increase her production. She has a higher income and her quality of life has been impacted positively. She says to Kiva lenders, “Thank you for your help.” 

Currently she requires a new loan since she needs to increase the value of her cloth purchases to respond to her customers’ orders and to make her business even more successful.

loans.use: to purchase cloth.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana lives in a town with her family. She opened her kiosk in 2012 with her own working capital. She generates a good income from selling. 

A $600 loan has been offered to Ana to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy stock for her store, like bread, wheat, sugar and an oven. 

Ana has been thinking about running a big business after years of involving herself in business. She is happy for this loan because it is offered to poor people to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy bread, wheat, sugar and an oven.

loans.name: Franz

texts.es:
Franz es un hombre muy trabajador vive con su esposa en la zona de Vino Tinto (final) ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.  Se dedica principalmente a la costura al arreglo de prendas de vestir, pantalones, chamarras sacos, camisas etc etc y a la confeccion de ternos, trabajo muy esporadico.  La esposa trabaja como ayudante de cocinera en una clinica. En la misma zona trabaja todo el dia a partir de las 6:30 de la manana hasta las 7 de la nnoche; Franz necesita el credito para hacer la compra de materia prima (telas, forros, cierres, etc.) y de esta manera poder tener mayores ingresos y asi poder hacer frente a los gastos que tiene en su hogar.

El sueño de Franz poder tener mayores ingresos en base al sacrificio que hace su familia, y poder tener una vejez tranquila, espera  contar con un salario de vejez que le permita vivir mejorar su calidad de vida. esta es la segunda vez que su crédito se canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Franz is a hard worker and lives with his wife in Vino Tinto in the city of La Paz. He mainly works as a tailor, altering garments such as pants, vests jackets, and shirts and making suits, which is sporadic work. His wife is a cook's assistant in a clinic. Franz works in his neighborhood from 6:30 a.m. until 7 p.m. 

Franz needs a loan to buy tailoring supplies (fabric, linings, zippers, etc.) to increase his income and be able to pay household expenses. Franz wants to earn more based on his family's sacrifices, to live with less worry in his older years, and to have a retirement income that will support a better quality of life. This is his second loan cycle with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy fabric, linings, zippers, and other tailoring supplies.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramones de la ciudad de Curuguaty, él está trabajando  en una empresa, y también se encuentra culminando el 4° año de licenciatura en administración de Empresas, con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio está luchando por salir adelante y ser un buen profesional.
Comenta que su sueño es poder tener su propia empresa y administrarla gracias a los conocimientos que adquirió por medio de sus estudios.
Ramon pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de tesis, ya que de esa forma estará a un paso de cumplir con su meta añorada de recibir su título. Agradece también por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo de seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Ramon is from the city of Curuguaty. He works in a business and is also finishing his fourth year toward a Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration. With much effort and sacrifice, he is working to move forward and become a professional.

He said that his dream is to have his own business and manage it using the knowledge he learned from his education.

Ramon is requesting this loan to cover the costs of his thesis. This will help him reach his goal of earning his degree. He is also thankful for this opportunity to keep growing.

loans.use: to pay thesis expenses.

loans.name: Nasser

texts.en: Nasser is a 45-year-old married man from Lebanon and the father of four school-aged children. He is a truck driver who transports pesticides. He deals with farmers and always satisfies their demands by providing them promptly with the needed quantity of fertilizers to help them grow their crops faster. Today, Nasser is seeking to borrow a loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l. to repair his truck in order to ease his products' transport. He is also looking to expand his operation geographically and target a wider clientele with the intention of gaining a higher income.

loans.use: to repair his truck

loans.name: Doris Marina

texts.es:
Doris tiene 38 años de edad y con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro logro iniciar su negocio de venta de abarrotes en su vivienda, Doris trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo puede salir adelante cada día, sobre todo por sus hijos.

Doris está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como abarrotes al por mayor y productos de bazar, de esta manera podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle una profesión a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Doris, 38, managed to open a grocery shop in her house with hard work. Doris works about 10 hours a day, and her job has made it possible to get ahead and take care of her children.

Doris thanks the Kiva lenders, whose support will let her buy wholesale merchandise and groceries for her shop so that she can earn more and keep striving to achieve her great dream: "giving her children a career."

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is married and has five children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a honey business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she runs a shop selling household consumables. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to establish a bee keeping farm in the near future. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase honey for resale to her customers. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase honey for resale to her customers.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar is from Antarashat village in the Syuniq region. She lives with her husband and three sons (10, 10 and 5 years old). Gohar works as an administrative secretary at the village's local self-governance body, and her husband works in the government sector. Both of them work hard to be able to meet the growing needs of their family. Their salaries, however, are not enough to cover their family’s needs. 

Gohar and her husband are engaged in beekeeping, which is an important source of income for them. Her husband sells the honey in the local market, where the honey is a product in high demand. To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Gohar needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase new beehives. The loan will help her expand the agribusiness and meet the family’s needs more effectively. Gohar and her family rely on the good will of the lenders and will be very thankful to them for their support.

loans.use: to purchase new beehives.

loans.name: Zobi

texts.en:
Zobi is married with two children. She lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Zobi’s husband owns a shop where he offers raw materials for embroidery arts. This shop is the family’s only source of income and has to provide for the expenses of utility bills, school fees for the children, and household expenses. Zobi’s husband wants to offer precious stones to embroider bridal dresses but he cannot offer this due to high cost. There is a great customer demand for these stones. 

Zobi is requesting a loan from the Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to buy precious stones. This loan will maximize her family’s income. Zobi is very thankful to the Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan because they showed her a ray of hope to fulfill her desires.

loans.use: to buy precious stones to embroider dresses

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos y su esposa viven con su pequeña nina en alquiler de 2 ambientes de los cuales uno utilizan como habitacion para los tres el otro ambiente es cocina y una pequena sala de estar a la vez mas un pequeño baño se encuentra hubicado en la zona de Las lomas de la ciudad de La Paz. Juan carlos es dependiente, trabaja juntamente con su esposa en una Imprenta y percibe un salario fijo mensual,  mientras la esposa trabaja a destajo, Se dedican a la parte de compajinacion y prencista de la imprenta; muy aparte de este trabajo, Juan carlos hace el servicio de transporte en su pequeña movilidad, para asi poder cubrir los gastos familiares que tienen.
Juan Carlos necesita el credito para hacer arreglos en su movilidad (cambio de frenos y líquidos, ajuste del motor) y de esta manera no perder el ingreso que le proporciona dicho vehiculo.

El sueño de Juan Carlos es llegar a tener un ingreso suficiente para comprar una pequeña vivienda y de esta manera dar mayor estabilidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos and his wife live with their small daughter in two rooms. One they use as a bedroom for all three of them and the other is their kitchen and small living room. There is a small adjoined bathroom. It is located in the area of Las Lomas in La Paz. Juan Carlos is a shop assistant who works along with his wife in a printing shop. He gets a monthly salary. his wife  is paid by piecework. They work in the collating and printing department of the printing shop.

Juan Carlos also provides transportation services with his vehicle in order to pay the household expenses they have. Juan Carlos needs the loan in order to make repairs to his unit (changing the brakes and fluids and tuning up the motor) so as not to lose the income that the vehicle brings in. 

Juan Carlos' dream is to have enough income to buy a small house and in this way provide more stability for his family.

loans.use: to change his brakes and tune up his vehicle.

loans.name: Timinah

texts.en:
Timinah is a hardworking woman who strives hard to better the future of her family.

The previous loan helped her to purchase more vegetables, tomatoes and onions. Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of KES 15,000 to buy additional stock of fruits, a variety of vegetables and tomatoes to sell for profit. She appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Enerson Jaime

texts.es:
Emerson es un joven de 19 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con sus padres y hermanos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Emerson no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Emerson trabaja en su pequeña Juguería donde vende desayunos, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Emerson se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará una congeladora, la cual le servirá de mucho para almacenas y mantener la fruta fresca para sus jugos, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propio puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Emerson is a 19 year old man. He is single and lives in the city of Cañete, in the Imperial district with his parents and siblings. He is very hardworking and enthusiastic and puts all of his effort into getting ahead. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and out of a need to work, Emerson hasn't been able to go to college.

On his own initiative, Emerson works in his little juice business selling breakfasts. He works there every day for approximately 10 hours and he thinks it is going well for him because of his dedication and hard work. Emerson is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he will buy a freezer which will be very useful for storage and to keep the fruit fresh for his juice. This way, he will keep working and striving to make his big dream of owning his own sales stall come true.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and has one child who is still young. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past two years, she has operated a timber business, selling to her neighbors and town residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business, especially when conditions are dry. 

Mary is requesting a loan to purchase timber for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase timber for resale

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is 39-year-old married woman. She is a mother of three children. Her husband owns a clothing business, which is the only source of income for the family. 

He needs capital to continue his work. For that Shazia is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to purchase a variety of clothes to sell so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. 

With the help of the profit amount, he will put a side some savings for children's future education. Shazia hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase variety of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Saeeda Group

texts.en:
Saeeda group consists of four women from Al-Hodeida, Yemen. They have requested a loan of 80,000 YER. 

Saida, a 38-year-old married woman, is the leader of the group. She has had a business selling clothes, perfumes, incense and henna for seven years, since her husband became unable to pay for essential living expenses. This business was profitable. 

She wants to expand her business. She plans to continue to sell perfumes, incense and henna in addition to the clothes, so she applied for a loan in the amount of 20,000 YER. She looks forward to opening a store for selling clothes and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, incense and henna in addition to clothes for resale.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina runs a general store that helps her to generate income for her family. She opened her store a year ago with her own working capital of 600 USD.

Cristina is requesting a 1,000 USD loan to buy stock for her store such as coffee, sugar, salt, milk, noodles, cigarettes, Fanta, water, and biscuits. She is a hardworking woman who hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, salt, milk, noodles, cigarettes, Fanta, water, and biscuits

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is taking a loan of $600.00 to improve her business. She is married and runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock such as candles, shampoo, noodles, cigarettes, salt, coffee, sugar, salt and water to keep in her store. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200.00. She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy candles, shampoo, noodles, cigarettes, salt, coffee, sugar, salt and water

loans.name: Emil

texts.es:
Emil es  estudiante del 4to año de la Carrera de Administración de Empresas, cuenta que sus metas son la de terminar su carrera, ser un profesional y poder trabajar en lo que es su profesión, en una empresa donde pueda ejercer un buen cargo.
Su inspiración son mis padres porque ellos día a día se esfuerzan para que no le pueda faltar nada en su estudio y así poder terminar siendo un gran profesional. Se destaca por ser un estudiante muy sacrificado que quiere salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, y también para poder cubrir sus gastos de manutención.
texts.en:
Emil is a student in the fourth year of his business administration program.  He says his goals are to finish school, become a professional, and be able to work in his field in a good position in a business.

His parents inspire him because they make the effort every day so he lacks nothing in his studies and can end up as a great professional.  He stands out for being a very selfless student who wants to get ahead.

Emil's requesting this loan to invest in paying his university expenses as well as to cover expenses to support himself.

loans.use: to pay his school and other expenses

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura vive en compañia de su pequeña nina en la casa de su suegra; utilizan  2 ambientes de los cuales uno utilizan como habitacion para las dos el otro ambiente es para depositos o para cuando viene su papa de visita tienen una pequeña cocina, mas su baño. La casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani  de la ciudad de La Paz.  Maura es independiente y sus ingresos los consigue por la venta de edredones a pedido y realiza una trabajo extra efectuando la limpieza de departamentos.
Maura solicito el credito para la compra de mercaderia (más edredones) y aprovechar estas fiestas de fin de año y poder conseguir un ingreso extra.

El sueño de Maura trabajar duro y ahorrar para los estudios de su hijita y que pueda llegar a ser profesional y no depender de esta manera en la vida.
texts.en:
Maura and her young daughter live in her mother-in-law's house, which has one room for the two of them, another that serves as storage or a guest room when the father visits, a small kitchen, and a bathroom. The house is in Tembladerani in the city of La Paz. Maura is independent, and she makes money selling quilts to order and cleaning apartments. 

Maura has applied for a loan to buy merchandise (more quilts) to take advantage of the year-end holidays and earn more. Maura dreams of working hard and saving for her daughter's education so that her daughter can have a career and not depend on this way of life.

loans.use: to buy quilts to sell during the year-end holidays.

loans.name: Quang's Group

texts.en:
Quang was born in 1959. She is married with a son and daughter and lives with her family in Dong Anh, Hanoi. Quang’s husband is a worker and she sells building materials. She has done this for 15 years and earns about 4,000,000 VND each month. Quang’s family earns about 9,000,000 VND per month. She is a hardworking and dynamic woman whose dream is to expand her business to get more profit and to repair her house. She has participated in SEDA’s credit program since 2006 and her loans are steps to help her reach her dream. 

Quang is requesting a 12,426,000 VND loan to buy building materials to sell. She is a member of a group loan. Other members include: Thuy, who is 24 years old, and is requesting 5,886,000 VND to become a driver in a taxi company; Sinh, who is 61 years old with a child, who wants to borrow 7,194,000 VND to become a driver in a taxi company; Nhung, who is 24 years old, recently married, and who wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to repair her house; Lien, who is 54 years old with two children, and who wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy materials for sewing; Xuan, who is 50 years old with two children, who wants to borrow 11,554,000 VND to by pigs and chickens to raise; and Nhuan, who is 53 years old with a child, who wants to borrow 11,554,000 VND to buy building materials to sell.

loans.use: to buy building materials to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and cooking utensils.

loans.name: Freddy Angelo

texts.es:
Freddy es un joven de 19 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos economices y por la necesidad de trabajar, Freddy no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Freddy trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad,el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Freddy se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya gracias a la ayuda brindada comprar una laptop la cual compartirá con sus hermanos menores para que puedan contar con una mejor herramienta de estudios, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de estudiar una profesión.
texts.en:
Freddy, 19, is single and lives in Chincha with his parents and siblings. He works hard, is enthusiastic, and makes every effort to get ahead. Sadly, he lacked money to study for a career and had to begin working. Freddy is a field worker for a city agricultural fund. He works every day for about 10 hours and thinks that things are going well because of his dedication and efforts.

Freddy thanks the Kiva lenders, whose support will allow him to buy a laptop to share with his younger siblings. This will give them a better tool to study with, and he will keep striving to achieve his dream of studying for a career.

loans.use: to buy a laptop.

loans.name: Sidra

texts.en:
Sidra is a 41-year-old married woman who lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She does not work; she stays at home and looks after her family members because her children are still very young and her elderly parents need good care.

Sidra's husband is very hardworking and loves his family very much. He is involved in his own business in order to have a regular income for the family. He manufactures and sells furniture, such as single beds, chairs, and tables. He started this business many years ago. He has many regular customers and is also taking orders from other cities. This business yields a good income, but his family's needs are increasing day by day and he needs more money to afford household expenses. 

Sidra wants to buy more raw materials for her husband in order to expand the furniture-making business. This is why she came to BRAC Pakistan to obtain a loan. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial and productive for her husband's business as well as for the family.

Sidra thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy raw materials her husband's furniture-making business.

loans.name: Piriah

texts.en:
Meet 50-year-old Piriah Nyambeki. She is a farmer from Kisii, an area known for bananas and sugarcane. She has been farming for 8 years, growing tea and crops and also raising poultry to provide a source of income. She loves farming because it allows her to cater to her family's needs comfortably.

Piriah chose Juhudi Kilimo to fund her because their loans are provided at a low interest rate. During the training offered, she learned how to plan and organize her farm work.This loan will enable her to purchase a dairy cow, which will produce milk that will be sold for more income.This will improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sadaf

texts.en:
Sadaf is a 30-year-old married lady and a mother of three children. Her husband has run a small general store in the community for many years. He offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at their store. He makes enough money to provide for their family. 

Sadaf has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan that she will use to buy stocks of rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates to fully stock her husband's store. In this way, her husband will be able to meet the increasing demands of customers consistently. She dreams of expanding the business and plans to utilize part of her revenues to meet household expenses. Sadaf thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates for her husband.

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en:
Chanthou is married and lives with her husband and three children in her own home. For the past 10 years, she has been a farmer from Chieb village in the Baray district, Kampong Thom. Chanthou primarily grows rice on a two-hectare farm to earn a living. Her husband shares the responsibilities to the family by raising animals and fishing.

Chanthou is requesting a 4,000,000 KHR loan to buy two cows to fatten. Her husband will sell them for a profit after two or three months. Chanthou’s loan will allow her husband to sustain their business and make a consistent income. She thanks lenders for contributing their funds towards a poor fellow like her.

loans.use: to buy two cows to fatten and sell

loans.name: Joaninha

texts.en:
Joaninha is married. She runs a general store to help generate income for her family. Joaninha opened her store in 2009 with her own working capital of 600 USD.

Joaninha is requesting a 1,500 USD loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as Sprite, beer, bread, cigarettes, and shampoo, along with a refrigerator. She is a hardworking woman who hopes to run a bigger business in the future. Joaninha is happy for this loan that is offered to poor people to improve their future living conditions.

loans.use: to buy beer, bread, cigarettes, shampoo, and a refrigerator

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is married with three children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (one orphan). She has a medical clinic business. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more boxes of tablets, syringes, and syrups. She generates additional income through selling charcoal. She works in a shop six days out of every week and sells on both retail and wholesale. Her major business challenge includes defaulters and thieves. She aspires to own a fully stocked clinic and also to build her own house.  She resides in a rented house and her family has access to electricity but lacks access to piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of syrup, syringes, and tablets.

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Fanny, quien con su credikiva compró productos como perfumes, desodorantes y cremas , los cuales llegaron en su catálogo, con precios excepcionales , ella logró venderlos, dando un plazo a su clientela mucho más amplio para pagarle sus compras a crédito, pues contaba con un capital adicional, gracias a  su credikiva- .   Fanny se encuentra más animada y con mucho mas deseos de continuar fortaleciendo su negocio, pues le ha suministrado muy buenas utilidades. Por eso dice a sus financiadores de Kiva “Gracias por su apoyo, que Dios los bendiga y los guarde y que sigan apoyando a más mujeres “. En la actualidad está aplicando a una nueva financiación, para comprar nuevos productos, como perfumería y artículos de aseo personal, pues las promociones de fin de año aumentaron y ella necesita aprovecharlas, para complacer a su clientela y obtener una vez más, ganancias en su negocio y este es justamente el éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Fanny, who bought catalogue products at exceptional prices with her Kiva loan: perfume, deodorant, and lotion.  She was able to sell them and, with the additional capital, give her customers longer deadlines to pay on credit.

Thanks to her Kiva loan Fanny is more full of life and has a much greater desire to continue strengthening her business because it has given her very good profits.  This is why she says to her Kiva lenders: "Thank you for your help.  May God bless and take care of you, and may you continue to help more women."

Currently Fanny's applying for another loan to buy new products such as perfume and personal care products.  The end-of-year specials have expanded and she needs to make the most of them to satisfy her customers and earn profits once again.  This is what's successful about her Kiva loan.
