Sueña con habitar un país donde se pueda vivir con desarrollo sostenible pero por sobre todo sin contaminación, pues cree que es lo más importante que se puede heredar a nuestros hijos, es por este motivo que decidió continuar estudiando en el área medioambiental, pues sostiene que mediante el programa de estudios que está cursando podrá adquirir mayores conocimientos para buscar soluciones técnicas a los diferentes problemas del medio ambiente y de contaminación, ya que a nivel nacional no existen muchos expertos en esta área y que conforme pasa el tiempo y la tecnología avanza, nuestros recursos naturales desaparecen, menciona que uno de los pasos más importantes es concientizar a nuestras familias y orientar a nuestros hermanos e hijos al respecto.
Agradece a las personas que están haciendo posible que cuente con recursos para seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Edwin is a 34-year-old young man who was born in La Paz, Bolivia. He is an agricultural engineer and has a degree from the Universidad Mayor de San Andrés. He currently works as a Technician in the Agricultural Health and Food Safety Service in La Paz.

He has requested a loan to enroll in a Master's degree program in Environmental Assessment. He dreams of living in a country where there is sustainable development without pollution. He believes that this is the most important thing that we can leave behind for our children. This is why he has decided to continue his education in the field of environmental studies. Through the program that he will enroll in, he will acquire greater knowledge to look for technical solutions to different environmental and pollution problems. Nationally, there are not many experts in this area and, while time goes on and technology advances, our national resources are disappearing.

Edwin mentions that one of the most important steps we can take is to make our family aware of the issues and guide our brothers and children on this subject. He thanks the people who are making it possible for him to have the resources to continue studying.

loans.use: to enroll in a Master's degree program in Environmental Assessment.

loans.name: Selva Tatiana

texts.es:
Tatiana es una joven de 26 años de edad,  vive en la zona sur de la ciudad de Cochabamba, zona  con restricciones en cuanto al acceso a todos los servicios básicos.
Ella es la mayor de cuatro hermanos, su mamá los crió sola debido a que su padre los abandono cuando su último hermano no había nacido. La madre de Tatiana es enfermera, por lo que tiene turnos de trabajo bastante sacrificados.
Para poder apoyar a su familia y tener mayores oportunidades de superación, entró a estudiar administración de empresas a una universidad privada, pero por falta de dinero tuvo que abandonar la carrera.
Trabaja como administradora de un café Internet, su salario apenas le alcanza para los gastos de su casa.
En la actualidad estudia la carrera de Técnico Superior en Banca, está solicitando un crédito para poder terminar estos estudios. Ella ya recibió ofertas de trabajo de bancos, pero el principal obstáculo para contratarla es la falta de un título académico, al tenerlo podrá mejor sus ingresos económicos y ayudar en la estabilidad económica de sus hermanos menores y su madre.
texts.en:
Tatiana is a young woman of 26. She lives in the southern zone of the city of Cochabamba, a zone with restrictions in terms of access to all basic services. She is the oldest of four siblings. Her mother raised them while single, given that their father abandoned them when her last brother was not born. Tatiana's mother is a nurse; therefore she has work shifts that are fairly sacrificing. 

To be able to help her family and have better opportunities to get ahead, she entered to study business administration in a private university, but for lack of money she had to abandon her degree. She works as the manager of an internet café, her salary barely covers the costs of her home.

Currently, she is studying the Superior Technical degree of Banking. She is applying for a loan to be able to finish her studies. She has already received work offers from banks, but the main obstacle for hiring her is the lack of an academic degree. When she obtains it she will be able to improve her economic income and help with the economic instability of her younger siblings and her mother.

loans.use: to finish her studies in the Superior Technical program in Banking

loans.name: Leong

texts.en: Leong is 48 years old and married. She is blessed with four children, one of whom is in school. For her family, rice farming is the only source of income and it enables her to support her entire household.  This business has generated her about US $5 per day. This is the first loan for Leong with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking her first loan to pay the school fees for her daughter who wants to pursue her study in Accounting. She hopes to provide financial support for her daughter on time so as her daughter can get a good job after she graduates.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's school fees

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Victor es un hombre de 21 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar Victor no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Victor trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Victor se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada realizara el mejoramiento de la vivienda de sus padres, ya que desea reforzar las paredes y ponerle piso a su hogar, asi pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Victor is 21 years old, he is single and he lives in the city of Chincha with his parents and brothers. He is a very hardworking and enthusiastic person with a lot of motivation to excel; unfortunately, due to lack of financial resources and to the need to work, Victor has not been able to study to pursue a professional career. 

Out of his own initiative, Victor found a job in a farm in his city and he works about 10 hours every day. He believes that things are going well with his job thanks to his dedication and his efforts.

Victor is very thankful with Kiva Lenders because thanks to the help offered he will improve his parents’ home by fixing the walls and laying tiles to the floor, while he continues to work and striving to achieve his dream of owning his own home.

loans.use: to improve his home.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is a single mother of 4 children, and two of her children go to school. She has a business of a bar, and has been in this business for 3 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,800,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more crates of beer, soda, and jerrycans of local Gin.

She works in a shop seven days out of every week, and sells on retail basis only. She generates additional income through selling piped water. Her major business challenges are the seasonality and thieves. 

She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked pub and becoming a wholesaler. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer, soda, and jerrycans of local Gin.

loans.name: Umry

texts.en: Umry is a first cycle borrower with IMON. She is 58 year old. She is married and has three children. She worked more than 30 years in a school. Now, she is a pensioner. She has been busy with animal husbandry. She feeds cows. Her husband helps her with the business. Her son works in Russia. Umry has a problem in her family. Her daughter-in-law is ill. She learned about the illness of her daughter-in-law two weeks ago. She worries about her health. Umry does not have enough money to buy medicine to treat her daughter-in-low. She is asking for a loan of 550 Somoni. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy medicine to treat her daughter-in-law

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is married with four children and two of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has a business selling green bananas. She works in the market six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. Her major business challenge includes seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and to start going to the villages of Masaka for green bananas.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is married with two children, one of whom goes to school.  She also takes care of her mother.  She has a business of a retail shop and has been in this for two years. She generates additional income through farming.  

Prossy has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and jerrycans of cooking oil. She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters.  

She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked shop and also to build her own house.  She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more jerrycans of cooking oil, boxes of soap, cartons of salt and bags of sugar.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem, age 51, is a local villager in Bakan district in Pursat province. She has been working in the farming business for 34 years with her husband. She is able to earn an income of KHR 24,000 each day. With this little income, she is usually supporting the whole family’s basic needs, such as food, education, and other commodity costs. She has given birth to six children, four of whom are under her care.

During this period, Sem’s living conditions are not comfortable as she doesn't have a safe latrine for the household, so she decided to apply for a loan of KHR 2,000,000 to buy construction materials needed to build a latrine. 

Thanks to the water loan program offered by HKL and Kiva with a special interest rate, she is encouraged to focus on a healthy living conditions, safeguard the health of her family, and protect the environment.

loans.use: to buy construction materials needed to build a latrine.

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en:
Even though Antoinette grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. 

Currently, Antoinette is an entrepreneur. She is a seamstress in Niezers Gardens (near Elmina). Antoinette is married, and her husband works as a teacher. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s utility bills. 

Antoinette wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels of fabric, needles, and thread. 

In the long term, Antoinette plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels of fabric, needles, and thread.

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
After graduating junior high school, Augustina decided to set up her own fashion business in Cocola Depo (near Elmina). 

With over two years' worth of experience selling handbags, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will help her to purchase more handbags for resale. 

She aims at using the profits from her business to help her husband (who is a fisherman) with the upkeep of their family, whilst ensuring that their two children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more handbags for resale.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is single and has four children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Veronica is a successful businesswoman. 

She sells plastic containers (near Cape Coast). As the sole breadwinner in the family, Veronica uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Veronica will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of plastic containers, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Veronica plans to further diversify the products she sells,hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of plastic containers, thus improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Elizabeth is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling buckets and pots in Elmina. Elizabeth is married and has two children. Her husband works as a teacher. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Elizabeth wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of buckets and pots. In the long term, Elizabeth plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of buckets and pots.

loans.name: Araqsi

texts.en: Araqsi lives with her husband in Masis town. Last year, Araqsi started to provide designing services to locals. She makes table designs for different ceremonies such as birthdays, weddings, and baptisms. Due to Araqsi's hard work, customers value her work much. Together with her designing service, Araqsi is working at a local kindergarten as a tutor. The income that she gets is very important to cover her family's basic costs. Now, because of difficult financial conditions, Araqsi isn't able to purchase materials to provide designs for new orders that she currently has. Araqsi is asking for this loan and has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Araqsi and she will be very grateful to all lenders.

loans.use: to pay for needed materials to make table decorations

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 22-year-old married Palestinian refugee, living and working in a Palestinian camp in Lebanon.

Just like almost all of the Palestinians living in Lebanon, Jihad has a limited access to several working domains and sectors. Jihad has been working in construction since four years ago. He specializes in pasting floor tiles. His uncle provided him with the necessary experience to move forward with his domain.
 
He used to work as a nurse, but his low income forced him to move forward towards starting his own business, which he works hard to develop and improve. 

He is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to buy new tools and machines necessary for developing his business. He will buy a power engine and a special tiles' cutting machine to make his work easier and faster.
   
Jihad hopes to keep on expanding his business more and more to provide his family with a better living.

loans.use: to buy new tools (power engine and a special tiles' cutting machine) necessary for his business.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Comfort is an entrepreneur. 

She specializes in selling fabric in Elmina. Comfort is married and has two children. Her husband is currently unemployed. As the sole breadwinner in the family, the proceeds from her business normally go towards covering the entire family’s general expenses. 

Comfort wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of fabric. In the long term, Comfort plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory, allowing her to sell greater quantities of fabric.

loans.name: Bejan

texts.en:
Bejan lives in Vanadzor town with his wife and two little daughters (ages 8 and 5). Bejan has been earning his family's living by providing a construction service for six years already. As the only breadwinner of the family, Bejan works hard to sustain his family's living and provide appropriate conditions for them.

Now, Bejan is asking for this loan to be able to purchase tools and materials needed for providing the construction service. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan will greatly assist Bejan to continue his construction business and gather income for his family.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials needed for providing his construction service.

loans.name: Edilia

texts.es: Desde hace varias generaciones la familia de Edilia se dedica a la producción de café pues es la principal actividad económica de la región en donde vive. Ella aprendió todo lo necesario gracias a su padre y ahora produce su propio café. Desde hace unos años ella es socia de la "Unión Regional" que es a donde entrega toda su producción para que sea procesada y exportada. Para esta cosecha necesita de un crédito que utilizará para la reparación de una camioneta que utiliza para transportar su producción y otra parte del crédito la utilizará para el pago de cortadores de café.
texts.en:
Throughout various generations, Edilia’s family has been working in the production of coffee, as this is the main economic activity of the region where she lives. She learned everything in relation to the trade from her father, and she now produces her own coffee. 

Some years ago she became a member of “Union Regional”, the place where she delivers her coffee and it is later processed and exported. 

For this harvest season, Edilia needs a loan to repair a truck to transport her coffee, and to make payments to the coffee pickers.

loans.use: to repair a truck to transport coffee, and to hire coffee pickers.

loans.name: Santos Marcial

texts.es:
Santos Marcial tiene 51 años de edad, vive en Oyotun sin hijos dependientes, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, ubicado en la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Marcial se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior a su domicilio, adicionalmente se dedica a las labores agrícolas, El ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para mejorar la infraestructura de los corrales que ocupan sus animales y de esta manera mejorar su distribución teniendo una alta producción.
texts.en:
Santos Marcial, age 51, lives in Oyotun without dependent children.  It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo.  It is located in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

Marcial raises and sells barnyard animals.  His business is located in the area behind his house.  He also does agricultural work.

He has requested a loan for 1,000 soles in order to improve the infrastructure of the corals where he keeps his animals.  This way he will improve his distribution and have high production.

loans.use: to improve the infrastructure of the corals where he raises his animals.

loans.name: Abdukayum

texts.en:
He is what people usually call a man's man. Abdukayum is a 30-year-old man. He was raised in a poor family, and from his childhood, he was helping his parents. After finishing school, he got married. He was the one who supports, feeds, and takes care of his parents and the whole family. He prepared and provided the wedding party for his younger brother too. 

Now he is foreman; he builds and reconstructs houses. He has 5 kids. That’s why he needs to overhaul his house. His house is in bad condition. He is asking for a loan of 7,500 TJS to buy building materials for repairing house. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials for repairing his house.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly, de 62 años de edad, es una mujer muy alegre, emprendedora y dinámica.  Es viuda desde hace ya varios años, vive en su casa propia con su hijo mayor, su nuera y su nieto, a los cuales quiere mucho. El negocio que realiza Nelly es la venta de respuestos de motos y mototaxi, para esto tiene un espacio acondicionado en su propia casa.  Ha esta actividad se dedica  desde hace más de 25 años, el cual inició con su difunto esposo, tiempo en el cual le ha valido para hacerse conocida, siendo su tienda una de las más concurridas de la localidad, cuenta con la ayuda de su hijo y su nuera para la atención al público, además de un ayudante para los trabajos pesados de carga de cajas, al cual paga  semanalmente. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tiene y las  buenas ganancias que le deja. Este es su quinto préstamo con Kiva se siente muy contenta y agradecida con el apoyo que viene recibiendo, para lo cual se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con el cantidad prestada de 3000 nuevos soles comprará repuestos de motos y mototaxi al por mayor, mayor cantidad a menos costos para tener mayor margen de ganancias.
texts.en:
Nelly, age 62, is a very happy, enterprising, and dynamic woman.  She has been a widow for several years.  She lives in her own house with her oldest son, her daughter-in-law, and her grandson, all of whom she loves very much.

Nelly’s business is selling motorcycle and mototaxi replacement parts.  In order to do this, she has a space set up in her own house.  She has been engaged in this business activity for over 25 years.  She started with her deceased husband.  Her time in the business has made her well-known, as her store is one of the busiest in the area.

Her son and her daughter-in-law help her wait on the public.  She also has a helper for the heavy jobs of carrying boxes, and she pays him weekly.  She believes that her business is quite profitable because of the demand that she has and the good profits it gives her.

This is her fifth loan with Kiva.  She is very happy and grateful for the support she has been receiving.  She pledges to be punctual with her payments.  She will use the requested 3,000 soles to buy replacement parts for motorcycles and mototaxis wholesale.  She will buy a greater quantity at a lesser cost in order to have a greater profit margin.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts wholesale.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana, a 28-year-old single mother supporting two children, 10 and 6 years old, has been operating an M-pesa (mobile-phone based money transfer) shop for one year. Located in Mpeketoni, her business earns her a monthly income of ksh.10,000. 

Introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet officer, Susana is taking her first loan of ksh.20,000 to add more float to her business. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Susana's hopes for the future are to grow her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To add more float to her business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 30 years old, a female and married. She has five children 16,13,11,8 and 6 years old respectively, all of whom she supports.  She has been running a grocery business over the last two years, which is located at Kibaoni.  In her business she earns a monthly income of ksh.8,000.  Agnes was introduced to KADET by an officer and she is taking her first loan of ksh.10,000.  She intends to use the loan to add inventory to her grocery business, buying tomatoes, potatoes, brinjals, peppers and cabbages. Agnes will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her future business and family, are to educate her children and have a bigger business.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes, potatoes, brinjals, peppers and cabbage.

loans.name: Liliam Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny tiene 29 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en El Pedregal una zona rural del Distrito de Buenos Aires, que pertenece a Morropon, ubicado en la Región de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su familia se dedican a la venta de fruta en los caseríos aledaños, Marleny ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para comprar abarrotes para una pequeña bodega que piensa colocar en su domicilio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Marleny is 29 years old and lives with her family in El Pedregal, which is a rural area of the district of Buenos Aires in the province of Morropon. This province is part of the larger Piura region along the northern coast of Peru. 

Together with her family, Marleny works selling fruit in the nearby villages. She is requesting this loan for 1,000 PEN to buy groceries for a small store that she is planning to open in her home in order to improve her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as milk, rice and vegetables for her store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es una mujer de 41 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus 2 pequeños hijos, ella es madres soltera, trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Elizabeth no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Elizabeth trabaja como mesera en un restaurante de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Elizabeth se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada realizara el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea tarrajear y pintar las habitaciones de sus hijos, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una vivienda segura y adecuada para su familia.
texts.en:
Eelizabeth is 41 years old, she lives in the city of Ica and she is a very hardworking single mother of two children. She dedicates all of her efforts towards getting her family ahead in life. 

Due to lack of financial resources and the need to work, Elizabeth was not able to study to pursue a professional career. She works as a waitress in a restaurant in her city, and works shifts of about 10 hours every day. Things are going well at work thanks to her dedication and her efforts.

Elizabeth is very thankful to Kiva Lenders, as she will be able to improve her home by plastering and painting the walls of her children’s bedrooms. She will continue to work and dedicate her efforts towards achieving her dream of owning a safe and suitable home for her family.

loans.use: to improve her home.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has no electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail selling business for the past two years, selling from home to her neighbors and passerby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business. 

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase sacks of rice, wheat flour and sugar for resale. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice, wheat flour and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Elena Hermida

texts.es:
Elena Hermida tiene 47 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el caserío Pan de Azúcar una zona rural de Oyotun, donde su población se dedica al comercio de aves de corral, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Con la ayuda de sus hijos se dedican a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, para contribuir con los ingresos para su familia, Ella ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 300 nuevos soles para comprar alimentos balanceados para los mismos y de esta manera ofrecerlos a un mejor precio a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Elena Hermida is 47, and lives with her family in the hamlet of Pan de Azúcar, in the rural area of Oyotun, two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru. Its inhabitants make a living in the poultry business.

With the help of her children, she works raising and selling farmyard animals, to contribute to the family income. She has requested a loan of 1,300 soles to buy animal feed for them, so that she can sell them to her customers for a better price, generating greater profits.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar is from Vanadzor town and lives with her twin daughters. Her husband has migrated to Russia as a labour migrant in order to work there.  He sends some money home to the family to take care of their needs. To tackle financial hardships, Gohar has been involved in the retail business for many years. She sells perfumes to local people from her house and in this way earns income to cover her family's daily costs.
 
Gohar is currently asking for this loan to purchase a new stock of perfumes to resell to her customers. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to traditional credit products. This loan is very important for Gohar and she hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for perfumes to resell to customers.

loans.name: Dena

texts.en:
Dena lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is a business lady operating a small retail shop in town. The business has been growing over the years and now she wants to add extra stocks of flour and rice to serve more people. She hopes that in the next five years she will be running a successful wholesale business despite the challenge of competition from other traders. 

Dena knew of Milango through friends, who invited her to join so that they could save and be able to access credit to fund their businesses. She hopes that her business will grow so that she may educate her children and improve their standards of living.

loans.use: to add extra stocks of flour and rice to her retail shop.

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman is from Ghukasavan village which is in the Ararat region of Armenia.  He lives there with his parents and brother. Two years ago Arman started his manufacturing business. He makes different types of furniture and sells them to local people. Due to his high quality work, the furniture that he makes is much demanded among the locals.

Now, because of a lack of financial resources, Arman isn't able to satisfy the current demand of his customers. So by applying for this loan Arman asks for financial help to purchase a new stock of tools and materials. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for this young and enthusiastic man to be able to continue his business and gather more income for his family.

loans.use: to pay for a new stock of tools and materials to provide a manufacturing service.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar tiene 50 años de edad, vive en el Distrito de Lagunas, una comunidad que se caracteriza por el cultivo de plantas medicinales, a una hora y treinta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El es conocido en el medio por su labor de venta de productos medicinales, su hijo le ayuda en las ventas, Oscar ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para comprar maca y algarrobina, ya que estos productos son los más solicitados por sus clientes, con el crédito otorgado generara ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar, age 50, lives in the Langunas district.  His community is known for growing medicinal plants.  It is one hour and thirty minutes from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.

He is known in the field for his work selling medicinal products.  His son helps him with the sales.

Oscar has requested a loan for 1,500 soles to buy ‘maca’ [Peruvian ginseng] and carob flavoring.  These are the products that are most requested by his customers.  With the loan he was granted he will generate additional income for his family.

loans.use: to buy ‘maca’ [Peruvian ginseng] and carob flavoring.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is married with four children. She has received some schooling up to the end of junior high school. 

Currently, Esi sells footwear at Abransa (near Elmina). She has been involved in this industry for about ten years now. Her husband is a farmer.  Esi’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses.  

Esi will use the loan to increase her existing footwear capacity. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Esi plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing footwear capacity.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a fifty-one-year-old, married father of four children, who has worked in the flower selling business for thirty five years.  In January 2000, he started his own business to improve his living and respond better to his family's needs and requests.

In addition to selling flowers, Mohamad works with a wedding planner to decorate weddings and special events with special themes and designs. To keep on developing his business, Mohamad is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to increase his business merchandise with special Christmas flowers and decorating items to be ready for this upcoming holy occasion.

Mohamad enjoys his business a lot and he is working hard to develop and open another branch of his business in the future.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with special Christmas flowers and decorating items.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school, and are still under her care. They live at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Esther operates a clothes selling business. She sells at the market to her town-dwellers and her neighbors. She cites her major challenge to be the rate of competition. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase 2 bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 2 bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Gladyness

texts.en:
Gladyness is a married woman with four children, all of whom still attend school. They live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her kids.

Gladyness operates a clothes selling business.  She sells at the market to her town dwellers and her neighbors. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase 3 bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 3 bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María Elena tiene 57 años de edad vive junto a su familia en Cayalti, su población se dedica al cultivo de caña, arroz y a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella es conocida por su labor en la venta de alfañique (pasta de azúcar estirada y retorcida en barras delgadas) de esta manera María Elena contribuye con su esposo generando ingresos para su familia, Ella ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para comprar insumos para su negocio azúcar, colorantes y moldes para así seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is 57 years old and she lives with her family in Cayalti, a place two hours away from the city of Chiclayo in the northern coast of Peru, where the population works mostly in the production of sugar cane and rice.

Maria Elena is well known for selling “alfañique” (a sugar paste which is stretched and twisted into thin strips). This is how she helps her husband with the family income. 

She is requesting a loan of 2000 nuevos soles to buy ingredients for her business -like sugar, food coloring and baking molds- in order to continue to work.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, food coloring and baking molds.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Doña Dominga de 66 años, no estudio, es casada; su esposo se dedica a cultivar maíz, frijol y tule, sus tres  hijos ya no viven con ella.

Ella cultiva tule,  del cual elabora petates, trabajo que heredo de sus padres desde pequeña,  solo vive de la venta de petates y la agricultura, este trabajo lo hace al terminar los quehaceres del hogar. 

El crédito lo necesita, para pagar mano de obra,  para que le limpien el cultivo de tule, con el objetivo de obtener mejor cosecha.

Ella quisiera cultivar más tule, para mejorar la casa. Con el préstamo podrá hacer el trabajo que necesita.  Las ganancias las utiliza en alimentación, cree que con un crédito más grande puede cultivar más tule.
texts.en:
Dominga is 66 years old, never studied, and is married. Her husband makes a living growing maize, beans, and tule, a kind of grass. Her three children no longer live with her.

She grows tule, which she then uses to make bedrolls, work she inherited from her parents from a young age. She lives off the proceeds from selling bedrolls and from farming, activities she carries out after finishing the housework.

She needs the loan to pay for labor, to tidy the tule crop, in order to get a better harvest. She would like to grow more tule, so that she can improve her home. This loan will allow her to do the work she needs doing. She uses her profits to buy food. She believes that a bigger loan will enable her to grown more tule.

loans.use: to pay for labor, to tidy her tule crops, in order to get a better harvest.

loans.name: Susuana' Group

texts.en:
This group is starting their fifth loan cycle with ID-Ghana in Dansoman. The group is lead by Susuana and has four members. The members have a variety of businesses and they are moving along. The businesses include selling foodstuff, provisions, porridge, and poultry farming.

Susuana is married and has three children. She joined ID-Ghana three years ago, after being introduce to the loan scheme by an officer of the company. Susuana currently has a business selling food like cassava, plantain and yam. She has been in this business for fourteen years. This loan will allow her to increase her capital, and buy more food items to sell to customers. She will get them from a village close to Accra, and then she will sell them at her customers' request. This type of work allows Susuana to earn an income and support her household. When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she said she likes the financing and health training. They need a total amount of amount of GHS 4400 to manage businesses to growth.

loans.use: To buy foodstuff like cassava, plantain and yam and sell to customers.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman and has five children. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a food stall business, her potential customers are market dwellers and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuations of ingedients in the market.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of beans , cooking oil, wheat flour and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans , cooking oil, wheat flour and rice.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Adwoa is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling fish in Abransa (near Elmina). She has been involved in this enterprise for several years. Adwoa is married and has children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees.

Adwoa wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of fish. In the long term, Adwoa plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of fish.

loans.name: Jenipha

texts.en:
Jenipha has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passers-by. Her major challenge in the business, is high cost of transportation.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase 3 bags of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 3 bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en: Asma is a 24-year-old, single lady. She recently started a business selling cloth to contribute to the family income. She purchases a variety of printed and embroidered cloth from the main city, and then sells them to the locals. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. Asma requested a loan of PKR 25,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy variety of cloths for the winter season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through higher sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy variety of cloth for the winter season.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane lives with her mother in Vanadzor town. For over 5 years, Gayane has been organizing "Wonder-Child" contest-festival for local children (one of them is in the photo). 
Gayane works hard at organizing everything to make the event successful. The clothing that Gayane owns, she gives for a rent to parents whose children participate in the festival. Due to lack of financial resources, Gayane requests this loan to be able to purchase new stock of clothing. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions, to informal businesses, that do not have access to credit products. The loan is greatly important for Gayane and she will be very grateful to all her lenders for support.

loans.use: to pay for clothing supplies which she will allow participants to rent

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is from Vanadzor town where he lives with his parents, brother, and wife. Karen is providing vehicle repair service, and gathers income for his family's living. He repairs different types of vehicles, as well as resells spare parts of automobiles to his clients.

Now, to enlarge the business that Karen is involved in, he asks for this loan to purchase new stock of tools and materials needed for his work. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will be a huge support for Karen as he will be able to provide better service to his clients, and will gather higher income for his beloved family.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of tools and materials needed for his work.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en: Eric lives in the Mariakani area near Mombasa, Kenya. He is 24 years old and married. He operates a retail shop in town and he has been in the business for two years now. He knew about Milango through friends who asked him to join and he did. He now asks for a loan to buy one sack of sugar, rice and maize flour to sell in the business. He started his business from savings he made while he worked as a hawker. The challenges that he faces in the business include price changes and inflation. He will use the income that he raises to improve his standards of living.

loans.use: to buy one sack of sugar, rice and maize flour

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлана занимается продажей женской одежды в торговом центре. Она уже пользовалась микрокредитами от Надежды Украины и с их помощью смогла увеличить свой доход в полтора раза (на три тысячи гривен).
 
Этой зимой руководство торгового центра, где расположена тогровая точка Светланы, собирается отключать отопление с целью экономии денег. С одной стороны аренда у Светланы не увеличиться (не надо будет платить за отпопление, а с другой сторны будет ходолно и не комфортно как продавцам, так и клиентам. При этом, если бы Светлана торговала на открытом базаре, было бы еще хуже. Так что Светлана надеется, что эти грядущие изменения не сильно скажуться на ее бизнесе. 

Светлана хочет развивать свой бизнес. Она увеличит ассортимент товара, чтобы завлечь больше покупателей. Светлана просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 30000 гривен на закупку товара: джинсы, кофты, куртки и юбки.

Светлана собирается выходить замуж в следующем году и сейчас уже начинает готовиться к свадьбе.
texts.en:
Svetlana works with selling women's clothing at a shopping center. She already took used microfinancing through Hope Ukraine and with their help she was able to increase her income one and a half times (to 3,000 hryvnia). 

This winter the shopping center manager, where Svetlana's store is located, decided to turn off the heating to save money. On one hand, Svetlana's rent did not increase (as she will not have to pay for heating), on the other hand it will be very cold and not comfortable for the sales people, nor for the customers. Though, if Svetlana was selling at an open market space, it would be worse. Therefore, Svetlana hopes that the future change will not have much impact on her business. 

Svetlana would like to expand her business. She wants to increase the assortment of goods in order to attract more customers. Svetlana requests a loan in the amount of 30,000 hryvnia to purchase goods: Jeans, sweaters, jackets and skirts. Svetlana decided to get married next year and now she has already started preparing for the wedding.

loans.use: to purchase goods such as jeans, sweaters, jackets and skirt

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is married with one child. She has received some schooling until the end of junior high school. Emelia currently sells African print cloths in Aburansa (near Elmina). She has been involved in this industry for about 3 years now. Her husband is a fridge repairman. 

Emelia’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. Emelia will use the loan to increase her existing African print cloth capacity. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Emelia plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing African print cloth capacity.

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en: Marie Chantal is 32 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past two years. She wants a loan to buy more beans and sugar for sale. The profits from her business will be used for making savings.

loans.use: to buy more beans and sugar for sale

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos tiene 35 años de edad , vive en casa de su tío en la comunidad de Cayalti, a dos horas e la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda el servicio de transporte público trasladando a sus clientes en su mototaxi. a los caseríos aledaños a su zona, Juan Carlos ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento su vehículo y así seguir brindando el servicio a sus clientes
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 35 years old. He lives in his uncle’s house in the community of Cayalti, which is two hours from the city of Chiclayo, in the coastal region of northern Peru.

Juan Carlos operates a motorcycle taxi service, driving his customers to neighboring villages. He is requesting this loan for 1,500 PEN to perform maintenance to his vehicle so that he can continue to offer taxi service to his customers.

loans.use: to perform maintenance to his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Maria Vanessa

texts.es:
María Vanessa tiene 31 años de edad vive junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos en Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedican al cultivo de caña, arroz, café a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella tiene una pequeña bodega, ubicada en su propio domicilio, con los ingresos que recibe apoya a su esposo quien trabaja como obrero, María Vanesa ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abarrotes en general, una vitrina para exibir sus productos y de esta manera generar ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
María Vanessa is 31 years old. She lives with her husband and her four children in Cayaltí, a community dedicated to growing sugar cane, rice, and coffee. It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.

She has a little store, located in her own home and the income she receives helps support her husband who works as a laborer. María Vanesa has requested a loan of 3,000 soles to buy various groceries and a showcase to exhibit her products so she can generate additional income for her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries and a display case for her home based store.

loans.name: Sada

texts.en:
Sada lives in Mariakani, which is in Kilifi county around the Kenyan coast. She is 37 years old and married with four children under her care. She owns a food cafe that she has been operating for the last four years. She started the business from money she was given by her husband. The business has grown since she started it, and now she wants to buy food stuff, such as green-grams, flour, and cooking oil to support her in the cafe. 

She knew Milango through friends who asked her to join them. She joined so that she can be able to access credit to fund her business. She hopes that her business will become stable in the next five years, and she will transform it into a restaurant. 

The challenges that she faces in the business include price changes and inflation. She will use the income that she will raise from the business to construct a house.

loans.use: to buy food stuff, such as green-grams, flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Rahieb

texts.en:
Rahieb is 44 years old, and together with his wife, has two daughters. Rahieb works as a part-time driver for a bottling company. The remaining time he spends at his rice farm, where he, with the support of Seva MFI, started rice cultivation. 

With the income from rice cultivation, Rahieb started building a house. With the profit of each season, he further builds on to complete his house. He and his wife are also saving for the future of their two daughters. He needs a loan of SRD 10,000 to purchase pesticides and fertilizers for rice cultivation.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and fertilizers for rice cultivation.

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.ru:
Александра занимается  тепличным хозяйством. Со времени предыдущего кредита ее дети приобрели дом неподалеку и построили там две теплицы. Это способствовало увеличению дохода.
 
Александра хочет оптимизировать свой бизнес процесс. Сейчас она выращивать рассаду в одной из больших теплиц. При этом теряется время на высадку. Александра хочет построить отдельную теплицу для рассады. Это поможете сократить время высадки, а значит получить урожай раньше и продать его по более выгодной цене.
 
Александра просит предоставить кредит в сумме 30000 гривен на постройку теплицы для рассады, а также закупки семян, пленки и удобрений. Кредит поможет увеличить доход и те самым улучшить благосостояние ее семьи.

В прошлом году  муж Александры пережил инсульт.  Он почти не мог ходить, сейчас идет на поправку, но все еще не может работать в теплице.  Хотя Александре и трудно вести бизнес без помощи мужа, ей помогают дети. Все вместе они надеются на его скорейшее выздоровление.
texts.en:
Alexandra works with green house farming. Since her previous loan, her children bought a house nearby and build two greenhouses there. This contributed to increasing the income. Alexandra would like optimize her business processes. Currently she grows seedlings in one of the largest greenhouses. Doing this, she loses time for sowing. Alexandra would like to build a separate greenhouse for seedlings. This will help reduce the sowing time, and will mean receiving the harvest earlier and sell them for a better price. 

Alexandra requests a loan in the amount of 30,000 hryvnia to build greenhouses for seedlings, and also to purchase seeds, plastic film and fertilizer. The loan will help her increase the income and thus improve the welfare of the family. 

Last year, Alexandra's husband suffered a stroke. He could almost not walk, but now he is improving. However he cannot work in the greenhouse. As it is hard for Alexandra to manage the business without her husband's help, her children help her. Together they hope for his speedy recovery.

loans.use: to build a separate greenhouse for seedlings and also to buy seeds, fertilizers and plastic film

loans.name: Leoniya

texts.en: Leoniya, age 52, is a mother of six, and they all go to school. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past ten years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans and sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more beans and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Comfort did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Comfort sells maize porridge and bread in Aburansa (near Elmina). She has been doing so for about 2 years. 

She is married to a driver, and together they have 2 children. Comfort uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Comfort will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of maize and flour, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Comfort wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of maize and flour, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is married with two children and all of the children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (sister and her child). She has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this business for ten years. She has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler as well as to buy a delivery van to ease in transportation. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence lives in Kilifi county on the north coast of Kenya. She is 39 years old and is married with three children. She operates a food cafe in town. She started the business using her personal savings, and the business is currently growing. She discovered Milango through friends who asked her to join, and she did. She is asking for a loan to buy foodstuffs like maize, flour, and beans for her cafe. She hopes that in the next five years her business will have grown to become a successful restaurant in town. She will use the extra income that she will raise to improve her standards of living and expand her business operations.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs like maize, flour, and beans for her cafe.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail selling business for the past 2 years, selling from home to her neighbors and passerby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase sacks of rice, wheat flour, and sugar for resale. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice, wheat flour, and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Enfrenciah

texts.en:
Enfrenciah is a married woman with one child who is still very young. She owns a house that has no electricity or piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. Her major challenge is lack of sufficient capital.

With the loan, she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru:
Наталье пришлось в жизни не легко, чтобы добиться успеха нужно  много трудиться. Когда она вышла замуж  ей, и мужу трудно было найти работу в селе и семья испытывала фин.затруднения. Они жили  дружно с родителями и решили заняться привычным делом, тем чем занимаются  всю жизнь их родители, выращивать овощи. Стали  прилагать все усилия чтобы развить этот бизнес. 

Клиентка очень трудолюбивая и аккуратная, в доме и на огороде всегда порядок.  Однако для лучших результатов нужны большие вложения, поэтому она по совету друзей обратилась за помощью в «Надежду Украины». Благодаря предыдущему кредиту Наталья смогла сделать отопление в двух теплицах из четырех, что увеличило доход. Поэтому в этом году Наталья хочет провести отопление в оставшихся двух теплицах и поставить новый мощный котел, который будет отапливать все теплицы. Это – мечта Натальи и она усердно трудится, чтобы ее мечта осуществилась!

Наталья просит предоставить ей кредит в размере 40,000 гривен на отопительный котел и уже в эту зиму морозы будут не страшны. Наталья вместе с мужем сможет высадить раньше рассаду и тогда точно доход значительно увеличится.
texts.en:
Natalya has not had an easy life, and in order to get success she has had to work a lot. When she got married, it was difficult for her and her husband to find work in the village and the family had financial difficulties. They lived together with their parents and decided to work with a traditional business, which their parents worked with all their lives: Growing vegetables. They began to make every effort to develop this business. 

This entrepreneur is very hardworking and accurate, the house and the garden is always in order. However, in order to get the best results, she needs more investment. Therefore, on the advice of her friends, she asked for help from Hope Ukraine. Thanks to the previous loan, Natalya was able to install heating in two out of four of the greenhouses, which increased the income. Therefore, Natalya would like to install heating in the remaining two greenhouses this year, and install a new, powerful heater, which will heat all the greenhouses. This is Natalya's dream and she works diligently to realize her dream! 

Natalya requests a loan in the amount of 40,000 hryvnia for the heater and already this winter, the cold will not be intimidating. Natalya and her husband will be able to sow early seedlings and then the income will increase considerably.

loans.use: to install a new, powerful heater to heat all her greenhouses

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua operates a chop bar, where a variety of African dishes are sold. She has been doing this for 4 years. The foods she serves are fufu, banku, meat  soup, fish soup, and rice balls. She is married and has two children. Ekua uses her income to help her husband pay their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase maize, cassava, meat, fish, and other ingredients to prepare food for sale. With the new profit, Ekua plans to operate a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase maize, cassava, meat, fish, and other ingredients to prepare food for sale.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is 41 years old. He is a father of one child. He runs a barber shop and has been in the business for the past eight years. With the loan, he would like to buy more hair clipper machines for his salon. The profits from the business are expected to be reinvested in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more hair clippers for use in his salon.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: After graduating from middle school,  Ama decided to set up her own business selling "Kenkey." Kenkey is a traditional Ghanaian staple dish that is made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves.  She prepares her Kenkey on her own and proceeds to sell it in Abruansa (near Elmina). With over 15 years of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more maize, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty Kenkey. She aims to use the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a farmer) with the upkeep of their house while ensuring that their three children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to help her purchase more maize, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty ‘Kenkey’

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 36 years old. She sells beans and has been in the business for the past four years. With this loan, she would like to buy more beans for sale. The profits from her business will be used for making savings.

loans.use: to buy more beans for sale.

loans.name: Gilma Marisela

texts.es:
Gilma de 30 años, estudio noveno grado, es casada,; su esposo trabaja como vigilante, sus dos hijos de 7 y 10 años, bien junto a ella.  Ella elabora comidas típicas por las tardes (pasteles, enchiladas, yuca frita, etc.)

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar más insumos para elabora los alimentos  y la otra parte para pagar parte de un crédito con la Institución. Con el crédito podrá cumplir el deseo de negocio que tiene, y le ayudara a obtener mejores ingresos.

Ella quiere que sus hijos sean profesionales. Con los préstamos obtiene ganancias, las cuales invierte en alimentación y estudio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gilma is 30 years old. She studied to ninth grade. Her husband works as a caretaker. Her two children are seven and ten years old, together alongside her. She makes typical food in the afternoons) cakes, enchiladas, fried cassava, etc.)

The loan she is applying for is to buy more supplies to prepare meals and the other part is to pay part of a loan through the institution. With the loan she will be able to achieve her business dream that she has, helping her to obtain better income.

She hopes that her children become professionals. With her earnings from the investment she will make a profit which she will use for food and her children’s studies.

loans.use: to buy more supplies to cook meals and to pay loan fees with the institution.

loans.name: Nilima

texts.en: Nilima is a 25-year-old housewife from Aalata village, Dhupguri, Jalpaiguri Dist. She is married to Majinul, who is 27 years old, and they have two children. She has received a secondary education. One child goes to school and the other is just two years old. Her husband is a driver, who drives a car for hire. Nilima desires to start her own business cultivating potatoes on her own land and selling those potatoes in the local market. She has given preference to this business as potato cultivation is a very profitable job in her area. She wishes to take a loan to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer. She has a kacha house (house made of mud, straw, bamboo etc.). In the future, she dreams of building a beautiful concrete house of her own with the profits from her potato business so she can live happily with her family. She sincerely thanks Kiva and BJS for their support.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto de 41 años de edad, padre soltero con dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Es  originario del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. El sauce se caracteriza por los productos de productos lácteos, queso, crema, cuajada.  Luis se caracteriza por ser responsable, trabajador, con ganas de superación personal. El todos los días se levanta muy temprano con espíritu positivo, para salir a vender su mercadería y dar de  lo mejor. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar estudio por falta de recursos económicos.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de artesanía como ollas de barro, jarrones, casa de barro, al cancillas, jugos de cocinas de barro, gigantonas, ladrillos de barro. El dedica a su negocio unas 8 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la  compra y venta de artesanía, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Luis agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is 41 years old, and is a single father who cares for his two children. He is originally from Sauce, in the north of the country. Sauce is known for its dairy products such as cheese, cream and curd. Luis is a responsible and hardworking individual with dreams of bettering himself. Every day, he gets up early, with a positive mindset, to go out and sell his merchandize and give it his all. Unfortunately, he was unable to finish his studies due to a lack of economic resources.

Thanks to his hard work and desire to succeed, he works selling handicrafts such as clay pots, vases, wallets, clay kitchen sets, figurines, and clay bricks. He spends eight hours a day at his business, selling his products. The aim of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock his business buying and selling handicrafts, so that in the not so distant future he can make more profits. Luis is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders give to those with limited resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua to have a dignified way of earning a living.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock his business buying and selling handicrafts such as clay pots, vases, mud houses, wallets,  clay kitchen sets, figurines, and clay bricks.

loans.name: Santi

texts.en:
Santi is 43 years old and illiterate, but she is a hard working lady. Her husband is 50 years old and is involved in agriculture. They lead a very hard life. She works as a daily laborer and has a small income. She has one child who doesn’t go to school due to poverty. He is working. He usually sells betel nuts in the local market. Betel nuts are used as breath fresheners.

With the loan, she wants to purchase a cow to create her own business and to give financial support to her husband. She wants to sell the milk at the market to earn money and to give financial assistance to her family. In the future, she wants to buy two more cows and extend this business.  

Maybe Santi would have to fight her battle alone if BJS and Kiva did not come her way and hold her hand tightly. It was a fine morning when Santi met one of the field staff from BJS, came to know about BJS activities and decided to take a loan. BJS stands beside her to fight against poverty, so she is very much obliged that BJS and Kiva came into her life as a light of success.

loans.use: To purchase a cow.

loans.name: Ram

texts.en: Ram is 50 years old and works since his early years as an agricultural laborer. With the income he earns as a laborer, he hardly can take care of his family. He recently decided to do rice cultivation on his own and in his free time. His two brothers are supporting him in this new activity. Rice growing will enable him to pay for the education of his two children. He applied for a loan of SRD 10,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is a 39-year-old, divorced Iraqi woman. She has two children. Laila is a nurse and has worked in a government hospital for 12 years. Her daughter, Banin, is in third grade. Because of Laila's low salary and lack of assistance, here she is having difficulty providing the basics for Banin and paying for her school expenses. Every year Laila faces the problem of making ends meet at the beginning of the study year due to the additional expenses that are needed to cover study fees and books. With this loan, she can now accommodate all these expenses for her daughter Banin and still cover the other expenses from her income. 

She is requesting a loan to pay for her daughter's school fees and other study expenses. Banin aims to get high grades. The story of Laila and her daughter is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona's economic development clients that are able to get better educations.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's school fees.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

She operates a vegetable stall and she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. Her primary business challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a bigger business in the future. 

With the 20,000 KES she wants to buy a variety of vegetables, including tomatoes and onions, for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables, including tomatoes and onions, for sale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is married with five children and all of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for 10 years. She generates additional income from a pub. She works both from and at the market. She sells both on a retail and wholesale basis, seven days out of every week. She has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal and crates of beer. Her major business challenges include the transportation of bags of charcoal and seasonality.   She is aspiring to sell only on wholesale in order to make enough profits to build rental houses. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include feeding the family and paying for electricity.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique is 47 years old. She is married with three children ages 17 to 21. She sells clothes and has been in the business for the past 14 years. With this loan, she would like to buy more, different styles of clothes for sale. The profits from the business will be able to provide food for the family and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a single mother of two children and both her children go to school. She also takes care of an additional family member, a sister. She has a business selling chips, eggs and cold drinks. She works in a shop and sells on a retail basis seven days out of every week. She has applied for a loan of 1,300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of Irish potatoes, cooking oil, trays of eggs, crates of soda and boxes of mineral water.  Her major business challenge includes the seasonality and ever increasing prices of Irish potatoes and cooking oil.  She aspires to own a fully stocked restaurant and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of Irish potatoes, cooking oil, trays of eggs and crates of soda

loans.name: Agatta

texts.en:
Agatta is a married with one child who attends school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees.

For the past one year, she has operated a beauty salon business. Her potential customers being town dwellers and neighbors. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family's basic needs. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to buy shampoos, hair braids, and conditioners for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy shampoos, hair braids, and conditioners for her business.

loans.name: Serina

texts.en: Serina is a courageous woman who is 25 years old from Dhupguri, Jalpaiguri Dist. She has a husband and two children in her family. One of her children goes to school and the other one is too small to go to school. Serina dreams that her children will get a proper education and become responsible and good citizens. She has been involved in animal husbandry for many years, selling different animals in the market. Her husband works as a daily laborer with an inconsistent income. She heard about BJS and took a loan to purchase a cow for her business. She wants to build a large husbandry business with many animals.  In the future, she wishes to become a good entrepreneur and prosper in her life. She is very much thankful to BJS and Kiva because in her bad days, BJS came forward to help her and she has seen the light of prosperity.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for her animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Phidlora

texts.en:
Phidlora is a married woman and she has two children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a ballast selling business, selling from her home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other sellers in her business.
 
With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase a ballast trailer (for a truck lorry) for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a truck lorry with a ballast trailer for resale.

loans.name: Tharcille

texts.en: Tharcille is 25 years old. She is married to a business man. She has sold shoes and clothes for the past two years. She has requested a loan to buy more clothes and shoes for sale. The profits from her business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a single mother of one child and her child goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her sister). She has a beauty salon business and has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 1,300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids, weaves, and a hair dryer. She generates additional income through selling used clothes. She works from home seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges includes seasonality and on and off electricity. She is aspiring to own a fully stocked beauty salon and also to build her own house.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids, weaves, and a hair dryer

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has no electricity or piped water.

She has operated a poultry business for the past five years, selling chicks and eggs to earn a living. Her major challenges are diseases that attack her chicks. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase chicken feed for her chicks. She decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicken feed for her chicks.

loans.name: Emerance

texts.en: Emerance is 27 years old. She is married with two children, ages three and five. She owns a bar and has been in the business of selling beers and sodas for the past five years. The profit from this loan will be used to provide food for sale.

loans.use: to buy more beers and sodas for sale

loans.name: Maria Argelia

texts.es: Gracias al primer financiamiento brindado por la cooperativa COMIXMUL en alianza con los inversionistas en Kiva María Argelia se encuentra muy feliz ya que pudo comprar los insumos para sus cultivos de papa con la que obtuvo una excelente producción de 35 quintales los cuales vendió a muy buen precio y pudo salir con su compromiso de crédito. Las ganancias fueron muy buenas y re invirtió en sus cultivos una parte y la otra fue destinada para un semillero de papa certificado el cual pudo comprar con la posibilidad de poder cultivar. Su negocio tuvo un cambio porque mejoro su producción gracias al primer financiamiento como también su calidad de vida ya que los ingresos obtenidos eran los esperados hasta tal punto que sobrepasaron sus expectativas. Por lo que esta vez han decidido solicitar un segundo financiamiento con el cual puedan sembrar la semilla que actualmente tienen en una mayor cantidad y poder preparar la tierra nuevamente para el nuevo producto ya que es necesario por el mantenimiento y protección de la misma para poder sacar buenos resultados.
texts.en: Thanks to her first loan, which was granted by COMIXMUL in partnership with Kiva's lenders, María Argelia is very happy as she was able to buy supplies for her potato crop, which yielded an excellent 35 cwt that she sold at a very good price.  She was also able to fulfill her credit agreement.  Her earnings were very good and she reinvested part in her crops and another part in a certified potato seedlings that she bought to cultivate.  Her business changed because she improved her production thanks to her first loan and her quality of life changed accordingly, as the profits she made surpassed her expectations.  For these reasons, she has decided to ask for a second loan so she can plant the seed she currently has in greater quantity and so she can prepare the land once again for the new produce, as this is necessary in order to maintain and protect the land and get good crops.

loans.use: to plant and grow new potato seedlings

loans.name: Israel

texts.es: Israel aprendió a producir café desde que era un niño pues su padre y sus tios también se dedican a esta actividad. Cuando se casó a la edad de 22 años se independizó y comenzó a trabajar en un terreno que le heredó su padre.
