El café que Israel produce es orgánico y de excelente calidad, pues es socio de la "Unión Regional" y para poder pertenecer a esta organización necesitan que su producción sea de calidad de exportación. Durante la cosecha pasada Israel resembró gran parte de su finca para poder aumentar su producción. Para esta cosecha está solicitando un crédito que utilizará para comprar fertilizantes y limpiar sus fincas.
texts.en: Israel learned to grow coffee as a child as his father and his uncles also worked in this profession. When he married at the age of 22 years he became independent and he began working on the land he inherited from his father. The coffee that Israel grows is organic and of excellent quality. He is a member of the “Unión Regional” and to be able to belong to this organization the coffee has to be of export quality. During the last harvest Israel replanted a large part of his farm in order to increase his production. For this crop he is requesting a loan to be used to buy fertilizer and to clear the land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay to clear the land.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail business for the past five years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of theft in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase sacks of rice, wheat flour and sugar for resale. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice, wheat flour and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en: Immaculee is 23 years old. She is married. She owns a canteen and she has requested this loan to buy more items, such as bread and mineral water, for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more bread and mineral water for sale.

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en: Valentine is 33 years old. She is married with two children and they all go to school. She sells different items in the business, and has been for the past one year. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar and salt for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: To buy more sugar and salt for sale.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria vive en la ciudad de Nazca y para poder salir adelante y poder tener ingresos para su hogar trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de leche de vaca y crianza de ganado vacuno, Maria cada día se levanta en la madrugada para poder ordeñar a las vacas y poder ofrecer su producto.

Maria esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar alimento especial para sus vacas al por mayor, y de esta manera sus vacas podrán producir mejor leche y sus clientes estar contentos con el producto, así ella seguirá trabajando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Terminar de construir su casa de material noble”.
texts.en:
Maria lives in the city of Nazca and in order to get ahead and to pay for household expenses she works in her small business of selling milk and cattle raising. Maria gets up at dawn every morning in order to milk the cows to offer her product.

Maris is grateful to the Kiva loaners as it is thanks to the provided help she she is able to buy special food at wholesale for her cows so that her cows can produce better milk and her customers are happy with the product. So she continues working in order to reach her big dream: “to finish building her home with good materials.”

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: María Amparo

texts.es:
María de 36 años,  estudio hasta 9° grado, es divorciada, vive con su mamá y un hermano. Es madre un hijo de siete años que asiste a segundo grado de básica.  

Ella posee un negocio de tamales y pan,  es un negocio familiar desde hace muchos años, siempre se han dedicado a esta actividad, en el negocio se involucra su mamá.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar productos para la elaboración del pan y tamales, como: harina, leña azúcar, manteca etc. trabajo del cual de penden sus ingresos, para el sustento de su familia 

Su deseo es que su negocio sea aún más grande y vender sus productos en otras ciudades, que su hijo pueda estudiar y tener una buena educación y ser un profesional, las ganancias las utiliza para cubrir las necesidades del hogar y aumentar la producción de pan y tamales.
texts.en:
María is 36 years old, attended school through the ninth grade, is divorced, and lives with her mom and a brother.  She is the mother of a seven-year-old boy who is in the second grade.  

She has a tamale and bread business.  It has been a family business for many years now; they have always done this work and her mom is part of the business.

The loan she is asking for is to buy products to make bread and tamales, such as flour, firewood, sugar, lard, etc.  Her income and her family's upkeep depend on this business.  

Her dream is for her business to be even bigger and to sell her products in other cities and for her son to be able to go to school and get a good education and become a professional.  She uses her earnings to cover the household necessities and to increase her production of bread and tamales.

loans.use: to buy products to make bread and tamales, such as flour, firewood, sugar, lard, etc.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 35-year-old married father of two children who works as a blacksmith and has done so for the past eighteen years. In 2002, he started his own business to improve his living and increase his income just like any ambitious person who dreams of developing his living and responding to his family's needs.

Husein is acquiring a loan from Kiva field partner Al Majmoua, to buy requested iron pillars to expand and increase his work. This is Husein's second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, his previous loan helped him in buying the necessary iron pillars for a project he was working on and it came with an impressive income.

He is working hard to expand his business and earn a living.

loans.use: To buy requested iron pillars to expand and increase his work

loans.name: Santa Cruz De Cocachacra Group

texts.es: El grupo “SANTA CRUZ DE COCACHACRA”  es uno de los grupos ejemplares ya que cuenta con socias responsables y trabajadoras. Quienes se encuentran muy contentas por estar pasando el 23 ciclo. Violeta tiene 51 es casada con una  hija educando en la universidad. Hace varios años trabajaba en la bodega que había implementado en su vivienda. Hace 03 años cuenta con un restaurant en donde ofrece desayuno almuerzo y  bebidas como gaseosas, golosinas. Es de esta manera que puede apoyar a su esposo con las gastos de su familia. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de víveres: carne, pollo, verduras y tubérculos, gaseosas golosinas. el grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Violeta es la primera persona sentada del lado derecho.
texts.en: The SANTA CRUZ DE COCACHACRA Group is an exemplary group as it is made up of responsible and hardworking members.  They are very happy to be in their 23rd loan cycle.  Violeta is 51 years old and she is married with a daughter at university.  Several years ago she worked at the convenience store she had set up in her home.  For three years she has had a restaurant where she serves breakfast, lunch, and drinks, such as sodas, and candy.  In this way she is able to help her husband with the family's expenses.  She will invest the loan in supplies: meat, chicken, vegetables and tubers, sodas, and candy.  The group thanks KIVA's lenders for the loan they have been offered.  Violeta is the first person sitting on the right side.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, vegetables, tubers, sodas, and candy

loans.name: Tuydy

texts.en: Tuydy is married and has 5 children. Tuydy is a person who always tries to earn money and provide a better life to her children. She began her own business dealing in animal husbandry when her children were little. She has great experience in animal husbandry. She works hard but she has a small income. She requested a loan in the amount of 13,000 TJS to increase the number of animals she has for sale. She hopes for Kiva's cooperation in this loan since it will be used to improve her family's income.

loans.use: To buy cattle for increasing working capital

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is a 35-year-old married woman. She has three (3) children 16,12 and 10 years old, respectively, whom she supports. She was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet officer. She sells milk and she has been in this business for three years.

In her business Celestin earns a monthly income of KES 17,000. She is taking out her third loan of KES 60,000 which she intends to use in buying more milk. Her previous loan of KES 39,000 was paid back successfully. Celestin will use the anticipated profits to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her business and family in the future are to grow her business and to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more milk to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en: Constance is a mother of two children: both go to school. She has been selling soaps, sugar and rice for the past four months. With the loan, she would like to buy more soaps and rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to provide food and make savings.

loans.use: To buy more soaps and rice to sell.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Isabel de 42 años, no estudio, aunque sabe leer un poquito, es casada; su esposo reside en los estados unidos, sus 4  hijas de 13, 17, 19,  y 22 años todas son hembras, viven con ella y todos estudian, aparte de ellas viven dos sobrinos con ella.

Ella administra su tienda en la casa y solo a ese negocio se dedica, cuando no está ella, sus hijas o sobrinos le ayudan, nunca ha tenido otro negocio.

El crédito lo necesita, para aumentar el negocios (comprar productos, churros, granos básicos, bebidas etc.), y pagar parte de 2 créditos que tiene con fundación campo, para manejar una sola cuota.

Quiere que sus hijos sean profesionales. Con los préstamos obtiene ganancias, las cuales invierte en alimentación debido a que el esposo les apoya para el estudio de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Isabel is 42 years old and married. Her husband lives in the United States. Although she did not go to school, she does know how to read a little bit. Isabel has four daughters, ages 13, 17, 19 and 22, all of whom are in school. In addition to her daughters, two nephews live with her.

Isabel manages a store in her home, with the help of her daughters and nephews. She says that her store is her only work, and that it is the only business she has ever had. 

Isabel is requesting this loan to expand her business. She will use it to buy basic grains, churros, drinks and other items. She will also use it to pay off two loans that she has with the field partner, so that she will have only one payment to manage.

Isabel hopes that her children will grow up to be professionals. She says that the loans help her to make a profit, which she uses to buy food because her husband pays for their daughters’ schooling.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, churros, drinks and other items to expand her grocery business and to pay off two existing loans so that she will have only one payment to manage.

loans.name: Gean Marcos

texts.es:
Gean es un joven de 19 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con su pareja, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Gean no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Gean trabaja en su pequeño negocio de crianza y venta de cerdos, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Gean se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá comprar dos cerdas madres, las cuales le servirán para reproducir y aumentar su cantidad de cerdos, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Gean is a 19 year old young man. He lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Parcona with his partner. He is very hardworking, enthusiastic, and puts all his efforts into getting ahead. Unfortunately, because of lack of financial resources and the need to work, Gean could not study for a professional career.

On his own initiative, Gean works in his small business of raising and selling pigs. He works every day for about ten hours and believes he is doing well because of his hard work and effort.

Gean is grateful to the Kiva loaners as thanks to the provided help he can buy two breeding sows, which will serve to reproduce and increase the number of pigs, and so he will continue working and striving to achieve his big dream of having his own home.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Prudence

texts.en: Prudence is 41 years old. She is married with five children. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, salt and soaps to sell. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more rice, salt and soaps to sell

loans.name: Nours Group

texts.en:
Nours is a group consisting of six ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen.  Dalila is a 29-year-old married woman who has three children. She works hard and does her best to provide her family with food and clothing. She is a housewife and dreams of raising her children well. 

She lives with her family in bad conditions. She would like to complete her building, but she suffers from a lack of money. So she applied for a loan to buy construction supplies to use for building her house. In the future, she hopes to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to use for building her house.

loans.name: Roger Lee

texts.es:
Roger Es un joven muy trabajador, con mucho esfuerzo tiene su negocio debe venta de abarrotes, con lo cual puede obtener ingresos para poder solventar sus gastos de estudio, ya que él se encuentra en la universidad estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería; Roger cree que le va bien porque es responsable.

Roger está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una computadora, lo que le permitirá poder realizar sus trabajos y poder seguir estudiando y realizar su gran sueño:” Terminar su carrera profesional y poder tener casa propia”.
texts.en:
Roger is a hard-working young man. It is through a lot of effort that he runs his business selling groceries. From this he can earn the money he needs for his studies, as he is in university studying Engineering. Roger feels that things are gong well as he is responsible. 

Roger is thankful to the lenders at Kiva as with their assistance he can buy a computer. Which will allow him to fulfill his tasks and be able to continue to study. And he can realize his great dream which is to finish his studies and to own his own home.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Lialy Al-Thawra Group

texts.en:
This group is called Lialy Al-Thawra. It consists of five ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. The members of the group are very trustworthy, responsible, and hardworking. 

Najma is the group leader. She is a 47-year-old married woman. She has been operating a business of clothing sales, cosmetic materials, and perfumes. She works very hard to improve the future for her children. She is happy to work from home and is always looking for ways to provide new and better services to her customers. 

She requested a loan of from AMB to buy a supply of fabrics and perfumes in order to meet her customers' needs and to increase her turnover and income. With this loan, she can provide her customers with a wider selection and a better quality product. In the future, she hopes to continue working and have a good professional career.

loans.use: to buy a supply of fabrics and perfumes in order to meet her customers' needs and to increase her turnover and income.

loans.name: Alghzlan Group

texts.en:
The members of the Alghzlan group are women. They all live in traditional extended families in Sana`a, Yemen. They know each other through family, friendship, and neighborhood ties.  

Shwaya is a leader of the group and is 57 years old. She's been selling bread for many years. She says that she does very well with the business. She goes out into the town with a basket to sell bread and also sells it on order which she says she does well. 

She applied for a loan from AMB. She hopes that she'll do better and will use the loan to buy the ingredients she uses to make the bread, such as flour, oil, shortening, salt, etc. She is happy and hopes to get a lot out of the loan. She hopes the business will continue growing like it's done to date. She is grateful for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, oil, shortening, salt, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Tutu

texts.en:
This is thirty-four year-old Tutu.  She is married and has three children aged one, four, and eight. She has one additional dependent, who lived with her to help a sister with her education.

 In 2006, Tutu established her textiles business. She began her business to be self-reliant after dropping out of school. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are adults. Working seven days a week and thirteen hours a day, she earns about Le 1,413,375 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000.

Tutu has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy cotton, lace, linen, and poplin materials. She hopes that this loan will improve the stock and raise her profit. In the future, Tutu plans to to expand the business to a "market day" location out of town. She started the business selling on a stall, and now has a shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for textiles.

loans.name: Miniru

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Muniru.  He is married, and he has two children, ages four and six. He has one additional dependant, who lives with him to help with a younger brother's schooling.

 In 2007, Muniru established his business selling provisions, drinks, toiletries and gari. He started the business to be self-reliant after dropping out of school. His business is located in the outskirt town, and his main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about  SLL 2,531,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000.   Muniru has already received and successfully repaid five loans, and he now requires a new loan in order to buy more provisions. He hopes that these loans will help him to increase his stock and expand the business. 

In the future, Muniru hopes to improve the business and expand to a shop within the lorry park.  He started the business hawking gari around the lorry park area, and now he has a shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for provisions, like soft drinks, cigarettes, and mayonnaise

loans.name: Maria Pedrina

texts.es:
María Pedrina es una joven  muy  emprendedora de 33 años de edad, casada, y madre de  2 hijas menores de edad los cuales tiene 6 y 5 años y están en kínder.  Su grado educativo es  primaria completa la cual pudo terminar pero no pudo seguir estudiando por más esfuerzo que hicieron sus padres ya que ella desciende de una familia muy humilde y de escasos recurso económicos. María Pedrina también se dedica al comercio en la actividad de venta de golosinas y también a la agricultura en lo que es la siembra hortalizas como la papa y la siembra de granos básicos (maíz y frijoles) actividades que aprendió de sus padres. El terreno que en compañía de su esposo trabaja y cultiva es propio el cual lo adquirió como herencia de sus padres el cual está ubicado cerca de su casa de habitación. Una vez llegada la cosecha y recolectado el grano, este es vendido en las bodegas del municipio teniendo como clientes también los amigos, familiares e intermediarios que llegan a la zona.  
Por lo que ella necesita financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas con los que dará mantenimiento a una nueva plantación de frijol la cual está trabajando ya que por medio de ello, el bienestar de su familia y necesidades como también nuevas ideas de plantar otra variedad de productos.
Ella sueña en un futuro hacer crecer sus cultivos sembrando y cultivando una mayor cantidad de productos y de esta forma poder obtener mayores ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia y que le permita brindar una mejor educación a sus hijas ya que ella no pudo culminar sus estudios porque las circunstancias en su momento no se lo permitieron, además anhela fortalecer el patrimonio de ellas.
texts.en:
María Pedrina is a young entrepreneurial woman, 33 years of age. She is married and the mother of two children. They are 5 and 6 years old and attend kindergarten. She completed her primary schooling but could not continue to study as she is from a very modest and low income family. 

María Pedrina is a businesswoman who sells sweets. Also she is a farmer who grows vegetables like potatoes and basic grains (corn and beans). Activities that she learned from her parents. The land that she works together with her husband is hers, an inheritance from her parents. It is located close to their house. When the grain is collected at harvest time it is sold to the warehouses in the municipality. Their clients are also friends, acquaintances and middlemen who come to the area.

María Pedrina needs a loan to buy agricultural supplies to maintain a new plantation of beans. They are in the middle of working on new ideas and planting new varieties of products for the well-being and fulfilling the necessities of the family. 

María Pedrina dreams of a future planting and growing a greater quality of product and in this way generating more revenues to get the family ahead. This would allow them to offer a better education to her daughters as she couldn't finish her education due to the situation at that time. She also dreams of fortifying their inheritance.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to nurture a new bean planting.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is a 39-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all of the household expenses, so she started her business selling milk. She has been doing this business for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her area. With the support of BJS, she has gradually improved her business. She requested a loan from BJS to purchase a cow. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income so that she can fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase a cow.

loans.name: Kadiatu  Y

texts.en:
This is 32 year-old Kadaitu.  She is married, and she has three children, ages 14, 10, and 6 years. 

In 2003, Kadaitu established her clothing and household utensils business. She began her business because she dropped out of school because of the war.  Her uncle was unable to pay her school fees because of a lack of finances.  Her mother encourages her to do petty trading.  

They lost everything in the rebel war and providing for the family was very difficult.   She started doing petty trade with a small amount of money she gathered from friends to help her family.   Her business is located at city centre and her main customers are both men and women.  Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 486,000 every month from this business. 

Kadaitu would like a loan of SLL 3,000,000.  She requires a loan in order to purchase cartons of household utensils and clothing. She hopes that this loan will help her to increase the capital of her business. 

In the future, Kadaitu plans to expand her business and provide a better living for her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy dozens of spoons, pans, plates, baskets, etc.

loans.name: Fatmata B

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Fatmata.  She is married, andshe has one child, aged 14 years.   

In 2008, Fatmata  established her provision and soft drinks business.   She began her business because she was a worker with a ow salary.  She started her provision business to earn more income.  Her regular salary is not enough to develop her home, so she decided to trade that has help her a lot over the years.  

Her business is located in the outskirts, and her main customers are both men and women.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 620,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000.   Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase cartons of milk, sugar, mayonnaise, and crates of soft drinks. She hopes that this loan will supper her to improve her business.  The loan will help her buy more stock for her store. 

In the future, Fatmata plans to expand her business and provide a better living for her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more cartons of provisons and soft drinks

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.en: Marco dreams of becoming a commercial engineer but without a degree, he knows it may never be possible. Marco is currently attending Escuela Militar de Ingeniería, working towards his degree in commercial engineering. With this loan, Marco plans to pay for his tuition. With a degree in commercial engineering, he expects to earn $15 a day. With two older siblings already attending college, Marco is unsure how he will be able to afford his tuition fees on his own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan. Marco's father works as a vendor and his salary is the family's primary source of income.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Maria Celia

texts.es:
María Celia tiene 31 años de edad la cual es madre de un hijo el cual estudia en un instituto situado en la comunidad. Ella es casada, ama de casa y agricultora dedicándose a la caficultura desde hace más de 13 años lo cual aprendió gracias a sus padres. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria incompleta la cual pudo cursar hasta el 3 grado gracias al esfuerzo, apoyo moral y económico de sus padres. En du hogar no hay más entradas económicas por lo que dependen del rubro del café involucrándose ella y su esposo nada más dando la asistencia técnica posible mientras su hijo está en la escuela. La tierra que en compañía de su esposo trabaja fue obtenida gracias a una compra que le hicieron a su padre la cual está ubicada cerca de su casa de habitación trasladándose pie diariamente. 
Sus planes a futuro como madre de familia son seguir apoyando a su hijo en sus estudios, dándole la oportunidad de superarse y de aprender mediante el estudio cosas que ellos como padres no pueden enseñarle y que el conocimiento solo lo pueden obtener en las aulas de un centro de estudio. Para sus cultivos, lograr incrementarlos de manera que pueda ser la mejor productora de hortalizas de la zona ya que de esa manera ella podrá cubrir la demanda insatisfecha que actualmente tiene.
Por lo que ella ha solicitado financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas: 6 QQ de abono, 3 QQ de nitrato de amonio, 3 QQ de K-C-L, 4 sobres de curatane y un rollo de manguera con lo que podrá implementar un sistema de riego para sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
María Celia is 31 years old. She is the mother of a child who studies in a community school. She is married, takes care of the house, and is a farmer who has been dedicated to growing coffee for more than 13 years, which she learned from her parents. She has an incomplete primary education, but thanks to the effort, moral and financial support of her parents she was able to study to third grade. In her home there are no other financial earnings which is why they depend on the coffee business which she and her husband engage themselves in, doing all the technical chores possible while her son is at school. The land that she and her husband work was obtained thanks to a purchase from her father and is located near the home they live in, and they walk back and forth each day.

Her future plans are: as a mother of a family to continue supporting her child in his studies, giving him the opportunity to succeed and to learn through studying things that his parents can not teach him and knowledge that he can only learn in the classroom at school, and in regards to their crops, to achieve expansion so she can be the best farmer in the area so that she can cover the unmet demand that she currently has.

So she is requesting funding so that she can buy agricultural supplies:  6 quintals of fertilizer, 3 quintals of ammonium nitrate, 3 quintals of potassium chloride, 4 packets of curatane, and a roll of hose so she can install an irrigation system for her potato crops.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and provisions to assist them in the work of growing potatoes.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Becoming a tour guide has always been Delia's dream. Delia is currently attending the Universidad San Fransisco Xavier, working towards her degree in tourism. She plans to graduate in December 2013, but without a loan from Vittana she fears that she will need to defer her graduation. With a loan, Delia plans to pay her graduation fee. This fee is often more expensive than the semester's tuition and is a frequent impediment for graduating students in Chuquisaca. In addition to her responsibilities at school, Delia currently works 30 hours a week and earns $8 a day. With one other sibling, Delia is unsure how she will be able to finance her graduation on her own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Gabriela Rosario

texts.en:
Gabriela has always dreamt of becoming an international trade manager. She is currently attending the Instituto de Comercio Exterior y Aduanas, working towards her degree in international trade management. She plans on graduating in July 2014, but without a loan from Vittana, she fears that she will need to defer her graduation. 

Gabriela plans on using the loan to pay for her tuition. Gabriela currently works 40 hours a week as a secretary and earns $9 a day. One of her biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. With a degree in international trade management, she expects to earn $39 a day. 

As the youngest of five, with one older sibling attending college already, Gabriela is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan. Gabriela's father works as a teacher, and his salary is the family's primary source of income.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is 45 years old, married, and has 3 adult children, She lives in Oyan,Sibutad Zamboanga del Norte. Juvy has been involved in snack vending for two years and earned a monthly income of 4,000 PHP. Juvy requested a new loan because she is going to open a sari-sari store. 

She is a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC since 2010. Juvy hopes that her dream of having a successful sari-sari store will come true.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of rice and various grocery items to sell to customers

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is 38 years old, She is married and has 4 children who are all studying, Her husband is a fisherman. She Lives in Tamban Punta miray Baliangao Misamis Occidental. Fe has been engaged in the mango farming business. She has been in this business for 3 years and earns a monthly income of 6,000 PHP. She requested a new loan to purchase two sacks of fertilizers and pesticides for her mango farming business. Fe is a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC since 2006. She hopes that all of her children will become successful.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of fertilizer and pesticides for her mango farming business

location.town: Calamba-Tamban Punta Miray Baliangao Misamis Occid

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita 51 years old. She is married and has 2 adult children who are all working. Her husband is a farmer. She lives in Delapa Sibutad Zamboanga del Norte. Anita has been engaged in rice farming for more than 20 years and earns a monthly income of 8,000 PHP. She requested a new loan to finance her rice field and to purchase 5 sacks of fertilizer and 3 bottles of pesticides. 

Anita is a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC since 2006 and well satisfied with the services being offered to her. Her goal is of having more savings for future use.

loans.use: to purchase five sacks of fertilizer and three bottles of pesticides

loans.name: Mach

texts.en:
Mach is 41 years old and married. She has been living in the Baray district of Kompong Thom province. 

She has been a rice farmer since she was a young girl living with her parents. Mach has a common life partner in Chon, who is also a rice farmer and a fisherman. In average, this humble couple can earn a normal income of USD 15 each day for the support to their daily costs. They has been blessed with four children, three of them living under their roof while the other one is married and has independent living. 

During this raining season, it is the good time for Mach’s husband to go fishing along the Tonle Sap River.  Unluckily his existing fishing materials are ruined and unable to be used any more. Tto help them sustain their current business, Mach would like to acquire a loan of USD 1,500 to buy fishing materials for him.  She will also use the remaining balance to buy wallboard to renovate her house.

loans.use: to replace her husband's ruined fishing materials with new ones

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia dreams of becoming an accountant, but without a degree, knows it may never be possible. Silvia was accepted into the Universidad San Fransisco Xavier, and now with the chance to achieve her dream, is concerned about affording tuition fees. 

Silvia plans on spending the loan towards purchasing her textbooks. As an added expense, textbooks are often not bought to save money. With them, Silvia hopes to be able to better understand her subjects. 

In addition to her responsibilities at school, Silvia currently works 30 hours a week and earns $13 a day. With a degree in public accounting and finance, she expects to earn $20 a day. 

Silvia's parents were never able to complete their primary education. For her family of eight, finances have always been tight. As the youngest of five, with one older sibling attending college already, Silvia is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for books and school supplies.

loans.name: Alvaro Alejandro

texts.en:
Alvaro dreams of working in tourism, but without a degree, he knows it may never be possible. Alvaro was accepted into the Universidad San Fransisco Xavier, and now with the chance to achieve his dream, is concerned about affording tuition fees. 

Alvaro plans on using his loan to buy his school books. Up until now, he has been managing to get by without them, but it has become a challenge. With books and school supplies, he feels he will be able to get better grades. 

In addition to his responsibilities at school, Alvaro currently works 20 hours a week as a photographer. With a degree in tourism, he expects to earn $17 a day. With four older siblings, Alvaro is unsure how he will be able to afford his tuition fees on his own without the assistance of a Vittana loan. 

Alvaro is married with his own child. With a professional degree and a career in tourism, he hopes to be able to provide his family with a better life.

loans.use: to pay for books and school supplies.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan, who is 51 years old and a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married, and she has children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Susan operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5's worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She profits by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. 

She also has a food stall for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 800 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Susan dreams that her business will grow and hopes that her children will finish their studies.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their livees and business every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
This is Criselda, 39, resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Salvador and is a mother to their children. She together with her husband manages their household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Criselda maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. She also sells mineral water, pork, chicken and processed foods for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 9,000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments, and other products needed for her business. 

Criselda dreams to be successful in her business and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed for her business

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
This is Demetria, 50, resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Julio and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Demetria operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo,  5 PHPs worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. She also has a food stall for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 800 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a 8,000 PHP loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Demetria hopes to see her business flourishing and dreams that her children will have a good future.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
This is Meriam, 61, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Meriam operates a food processing business. She has a factory a few steps from her house where they manufacture meat products. She earns by selling her goods to her neighbors and to suppliers. She also sells ready-to-wear products for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 26,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional processed and frozen meat products to expand her product inventory.

Meriam hopes that their way of living will improve and dreams that her business will continue growing. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for different processed foods needed in her business.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe works hard to support her family. Fe is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Fe requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her general store.

Fe has been in this business for 9 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

In the future, Fe would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Norma Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doña Norma es una señora muy luchadora de 42 años de edad, casada y madre de 4 hijos los cuales se involucran en las diferentes actividades que a diario se realizan en el campo como la limpieza, riego de agua, aplicación de abono, foliares, fertilizantes, entre otros. Su nivel educativo primario completa la cual pudo cursar gracias al apoyo económico y moral por parte de sus padres. Doña Norma desde hace 6 años se dedica junto a su esposo a la agricultura al cultivo de hortalizas y frijol siendo el quien le enseñara a trabajar la tierra y contando con su propio terreno que se encuentra cerca de su casa de habitación por lo que día con día junto a su esposo y sus hijo trabajan arduamente y a la vez con mucho entusiasmo cuidan y limpian sus cultivos con la convicción que obtendrán una excelente cosecha. 
Por lo que hoy en día ella se ve en la necesidad de solicitar financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas y semilla de papa certificada la cual será cultivada y asistida con la compra de insumos ya que gracias a este apoyo ella podrá mejorar sus cultivos incrementando más su cosecha y mejorando el volumen al final de la temporada.
Ella sueña en un futuro hacer crecer sus cultivos sembrando y cultivando mayor cantidad de hortalizas y de esta forma obtener mayores ingresos que le permitan salir adelante con su familia y brindarle una mejor oportunidad de vida a sus hijos, educarlos de forma que ellos en un futuro sean personas preparadas y visionarios que cuiden el patrimonio que ella desea heredarles.
texts.en:
Norma is a fighting lady of 42 years of age. She is married and the mother of 4 children who are involved in various daily activities performed in the fields such as cleaning, water irrigation, compost applications, foliar fertilizing, among others. She was able to complete her primary school education thanks to the financial and moral support of her parents. Norma has been working with her husband for 6 years in agriculture growing vegetables and beans. He taught her to work the land and their own land is located near the house where they live. Day after day with her husband and son, working hard but at the same time with a lot of enthusiasm, they care for and clean their crops with the belief that they will have an excellent harvest.

So today she has seen the need to ask for financing in order to buy the agricultural supplies and certified potato seeds which will be grown and assisted by the purchase of supplies and thanks to the help she will be able to improve her crops, increasing her harvest and improving the volume at the end of the season.

She dreams of a future growing her crops, planting and cultivating more vegetables so that she can obtain higher earnings permitting her and her family to get ahead and offering a better opportunity of life to her children, educating them so that they are prepared for the future and are visionaries who care for the heritage she wants to bequeath them.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and certified potato seeds to grow.

loans.name: Sergio Franklin

texts.en:
Becoming an accountant is Sergio's dream. Sergio was accepted into INCOS, and now with the chance to achieve his dream, is concerned about affording tuition fees. He plans on graduating in December 2013, but without a loan from Vittana, he fears that he will need to defer his graduation. 

Sergio plans on using the loan to cover the cost of his graduation fees. Often, there are fees for earning your title in accounting before graduating. 

In addition to his responsibilities at school, Sergio currently works 30 hours a week and earns $17 a day. With a career in accounting, he expects to earn $25 a day. As the youngest, with one older sibling attending college already, Sergio is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana dreams of becoming an international trade manager, but without a degree, she knows it may never be possible. Ana was accepted into the Universidad Tecnologica Boliviana, and now with the chance to achieve her dream, she is concerned about affording tuition fees. 

With this loan, Ana plans to pay her graduation fee. This fee is often more expensive than the semester's tuition and is a frequent impediment for graduating students in La Paz. 

Ana currently works 30 hours a week, but making time to work and go to school has been one of her biggest challenges. With a career in international trade management, she expects to earn $20 a day, a substantial increase from before. 

Ana's parents were never able to complete their primary education. For her family of six, finances have always been tight. As the youngest of four, with one older sibling attending college already, Ana is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan. Ana's father's salary from his job as a carpenter is the family's primary source of income.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees.

loans.name: Sana

texts.en:
Sana is a 24-year-old married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family.

To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan, which she will use to buy rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital. 

Sana thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and flour

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raul, es casado y tiene dos hijos que son independientes,viven en casa propia ocupando solo una habitación, con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra en la población de Palomar en la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como agricultor por mas de diez horas al día ya que es el único ingreso que tiene para mantener a su familia,su esposa le ayuda pero ambos son de la tercera edad y con los ingresos que tienen deben cubrir los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo solicitan para la compra de semilla mejorada ya que les ahorra mucho trabajo por que no requiere de mucho riego y la producción es en menos tiempo y es mucho más sana y no perjudica al medio ambiente.
El sueño de Raul,es comprar mas terrenos para mejorar sus ingresos y posteriormente dedicarse al engorde de ganado.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y también con KIVA.
texts.en:
Raul is married and has two adult children. He lives in a one-room home with brick walls and a dirt floor. His home is located in Palomar, in the city of La Paz. 

He currently works as a farmer for more than 10 hours each day. His income supports his family. His wife helps him, but they are both elderly. Their income goes to paying for food and basic services.

Raul will use the loan to purchase better seeds that will save them a lot of work because they do not require much irrigation, they can be harvested in a shorter amount of time, and they do not harm the environment. 

Raul's dream is to purchase more land to increase his income and, later, make a living by raising cattle. This is his first loan with IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to purchase better seeds that will produce a higher quality product that can be harvested cleanly and will not harm the environment.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, es casado y tiene tres hijos los cuales todos son independientes, vive en casa propia ocupando tres habitaciones con pisos de tierra, la casa se encuentra en la población del Palomar en la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente se dedica a la agricultura y al engorde de ganado por mas de diez horas al día ya que es el único que cubre los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de semilla mejorada ya que le es de mucha ayuda por que la producción es en menos tiempo, con mejor calidad y no requiere de mucho riego lo cual ayuda para el no desperdicio de agua y mejora del medio ambiente natural. En el tiempo que le queda se dedica al ganado de crías de toros.
El sueño de Juan es aumentar su producción y también su ganado para mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida ya que desea ahorrar para su vejez y contar con mas ingresos posteriormente ya que es el único que aporta económicamente.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito en IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Juan is married and has 3 children; all of whom are independent. He lives in his own 3-bedroom house which has earthen floors, in the Palomar neighbourhood in La Paz. He currently works in agriculture and raising livestock, working more than 10 hours a day, since it is the only source of income he has to cover food and basic services for his family.

Juan needs a loan to buy better seed, since it will help to reduce the production time, and result in better quality produce. Also, it does not require much watering, which will help him save water and improve the natural environment. In the remaining time, Juan also raises calves.

Juan's dream is to increase his production and also his livestock so he can increase his income and his quality of life. He wants to save for his old age and he wants to increase his earnings for the future as it is his only source of income.

This is the second time Juan has taken a loan with IMPRO and the first with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy improved seeds

loans.name: Mena

texts.es:
Mena es casada y tiene dos hijos que están en etapa escolar,viven en casa propia ocupando dos habitaciones con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la población del Palomar de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente se dedica a la agricultura durante todo el día,ya que es la única que aporta para los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia,ya que su esposo se fue al interior del país y llega  cada dos o tres meses.
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de semilla mejorada ya que le sera de mucha ayuda por que le ahorrara mucho tiempo y la producción sera mas rápida con menos riego, ahorrando agua y así contribuye al mantenimiento de un medio ambiente natural.
El sueño de Mena,es mejorar sus ingresos y también dedicarse por mas tiempo al engorde de ganado y comprar mas terrenos para ser mas rentable ya que es la única fuente de ingresos que tiene.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y también con KIVA.
texts.en:
Mena is married and has 2 children who are in school. They live in their own 2-bedroom home with brick walls and earthen floor, in the Palomar neigbourhood in the city of La Paz. Mena currently works in agriculture all day as it is her only source of income to pay for food, education and basic services for her family. Her husband went into the middle of the country and comes back every 2 - 3 months.

Mena wants to invest the loan in buying improved seed, since it will help her to save time, and production will be faster with less irrigation. This will save water and so contribute to the maintenance of the natural environment.

Mena's dream is to increase her income and also spend more time raising livestock and buying more land so that the business is more profitable, as it is her only source of income.

This is the first loan Mena has taken with IMPRO and also with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy improved seeds.

loans.name: Milenka

texts.es:
Milenka,es soltera y no tiene hijos,vive en la casa de su padre ocupando solo una habitación con paredes de ladrillo,la casa se encuentra en la población de Palomar en la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente se dedica por completo a la agricultura,ya que termino la secundaria y aun no entro a estudiar a la universidad; a pesar de su corta edad sabe mucho de agricultura y engorde de ganado,ella debe apoyar a su padre en la parte económica ya que solo vive con el,debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos,es por eso que solicita el crédito ya que desea comprar semilla mejorada, para facilitar su producción ya que le ahorrará mucho tiempo por que no necesita de tanto riego, además de ser una producción más limpia y sin dañar el medio ambiente.
El sueño de Milenka es estudiar agronomia ya que sabe mucho del área rural.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y también con KIVA.
texts.en:
Milenka is single and has no children. She lives in her father's home, which has only one room and has brick walls. The home is located in the village of Palomar in the city of La Paz.
She currently works full time in agriculture. She finished high school and has not gone on to university yet. Despite her young age she knows a great deal about agriculture and livestock. She has to help her father with the finances because they live alone together. She has to cover their food costs and basic bills. For this reason, she is requesting this loan. She wants to buy improved seed in order to facilitate production. This will save her a lot of time because the crops will not need as much water. The production will be more clean and will not damage the environment.
This is the first time that she is requesting a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy improved seeds for facilitating prooduction.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Emilio,es soltero y tiene un hijo el cual ya es independiente,vive en la población Palomar de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene casa propia y ocupa solo una habitación con paredes de ladrillo.
Actualmente trabaja por mas de ocho horas al día dedicándose por completo a la agricultura,ya que es el único ingreso que tiene con el cual debe cubrir sus gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo necesita para la compra de semilla mejorada ya que le sera de mucha ayuda por que la producción es mas rápida y no requiere de mucho riego, además de tener mejor calidad ahorrando en agua que es un elemento escencial para cuidar el medio ambiente natural de la región.
El sueño de Emilio es comprarse mas terrenos para aumentar su producción y también dedicarse mas tiempo al engorde de ganado.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y también con KIVA.
texts.en:
Emilio is single and has a grown son. He lives in the Palomar neighborhood of La Paz, in his own home, in which he occupies a single room with brick walls. 

He currently works more than 8 hours a day, dedicating himself completely to his agricultural activities as this is the only source of income he has to cover his living expenses. 

The loan that he is asking for is to purchase improved seeds, which will allow him to grow his crops more quickly and without having to water them as much. This will allow him to save water, which is an essential natural resource for his region. He hopes that this way he will be able to protect the environment. 

Emilio's dream is to buy more land so he can increase his production and also dedicate himself to raising livestock. This is the first loan he is asking for from IMPRO and from KIVA.

loans.use: to buy seeds that have been modified to grow quickly and with less water, in order to help protect the environment

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
Valentina, es viuda y tiene dos hijos los cuales ya son independientes, vive sola en casa  propia ocupando dos habitaciones con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra,la casa se encuentra ubicada en la población de palomar en la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente se dedica a la agricultura por completo ya que es la única que cubre sus ingresos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos ya que ninguno de sus hijos le ayuda económicamente siendo ella de la tercera edad.
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de semilla mejorada ya que le sera de mucha ayuda  por que no necesita de mucho riego y su producción es en menos tiempo y además de mejor calidad respetando el medio ambiente.
El sueño de Valentina es comprar ganado para dedicarse al engorde y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y también la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Valentina is a widow with two grown children. She lives alone in her own house, occupying two rooms with brick walls and a dirt floor. Her house is located in the Palomar neighborhood in the City of La Paz. 

Valentina dedicates herself full-time to her agricultural activities, as this is the only source of income she has with which she can cover her living expenses. Neither of her children support her financially, even though she could use the help. 

The loan that she is asking for will be invested in purchasing modified seeds, which do not require as much water and require shorter growing time. With these seeds she will be able to grow her products more efficiently while also protecting the environment. 

Valentina's dream is to one day also raise livestock, so that she can improve her income and her quality of life. 

This is the first loan that she is asking for from IMPRO, and also her first time working with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy modified seeds to improve the quality of her harvest

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
Pascuala, tiene su pareja pero no esta casada, tiene dos hijos que están en etapa escolar, viven en casa de sus familiares ocupando cuatro habitaciones con pisos de tierra, la casa se encuentra en la población de Palomar en la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente ella junto a su pareja se dedican a la agricultura y engorde de ganado por mas de ocho horas al día soportando los cambios climáticos del tiempo ya que deben cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo necesita para la compra de semilla mejorada ya que les ayudara en su producción por que es en menos tiempo y no requiere de mucho riego, ahorrando agua que es muy importante para el medio ambiente de la región. Además, el producto es de mejor calidad.
El sueño de Pascuala, es aumentar su producción y su ganado para poder ahorrar o seguir invirtiendo para el futuro de sus hijos de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y también la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Pascuala is in a relationship but is not married. She has two school-aged children, and lives in a house with other family members that has four rooms with dirt floors. Their house is located in the Palomar neighborhood in the city of La Paz. 

Currently, Pascuala and her partner work in agriculture, planting crops and raising livestock for more than 8 hours every day. They must face the climate change which has affected their crops, and with their earnings must cover their food, education, and other basic expenses. 

The loan that Pascuala is asking for is for the purchase of genetically modified seeds, which will help her to increase her production in less time and will allow her to use less water - saving a very valuable local resource. Additionally, the seeds will produce a higher quality crop. 

Pascuala's dream is to increase her crop and livestock production to be able to earn enough money to save. She wants to continue to invest in her children's future, improving their quality of life. 

This is the first loan that she is asking for from IMPRO, and the first time she has worked with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy modified seeds to improve the quality and efficiency of her harvest

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
This is Brenda. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to buy vegetables. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for her to purchase more vegetables needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Brenda dreams to expand her business and hopes to give her children a good life.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables needed for her business

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is 41, and the mother of four children.  Her husband owns an electrical shop in which he sells electrical products, and also provides services for repairing electric water motors and pumps.  He binds the motors of washing machines, water pumps, and ceiling fans.  For this purpose he needs a lot of copper cable coils which are very expensive and out of his purchasing power.  Therefore, Nazia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, to empower her husband to buy copper coils to carry on his services. In addition he wants to buy some extra electrical switches, bulbs, bulb holders, sockets etc.

This is first loan of Nazia.

loans.use: to buy copper wire coils, switches, sockets, etc., for her husband's business

loans.name: Africana

texts.en:
Africana is a very hard working entrepreneur.  She is a married woman, 45, with two children, one of whom is still in school.

Africana has a direct selling personal collection products business in the Philippines. 

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more products of personal collection to sell.

Africana has been in this business for seven years, and she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more products of personal collections to sell

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald dreams of becoming a chef, but without a degree, knows it may never be possible. To achieve his goal, Ronald has enrolled in INFOCAL. He expects to graduate in December 2013, but without a loan, is unsure how he will be able to continue to afford his education. He shares that his alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until he could return. Ronald shares that it is important to him to graduate on time so he can earn a higher wage as soon as possible. 

Ronald plans on using the loan to cover the cost of his graduation fees. Often, there are fees for earning your title in the culinary arts before graduating. In addition to his responsibilities at school, Ronald currently works 30 hours a week and earns $6 a day as a kitchen assistant. With a career as a chef, he expects to earn $20 a day, a substantial increase from before. 

Ronald's parents were never able to complete their primary education. For his family, finances have always been tight. With three other siblings, Ronald is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana loan. Ronald's father's salary from his job as a merchant is the family's primary source of income. Ronald hopes to be able to contribute towards his family's income in the near future.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.en:
Carlos's dream is to work in industrial food engineering. To achieve his goal, Carlos has enrolled in the Universidad Indigena Boliviano Aynara Tupak Katari. He plans on graduating in December 2015, but without a loan from Vittana, he thinks that he may need to take time off to work and save until he can return to school. 

With this loan, Carlos plans on purchasing his much-needed textbooks and school supplies. With the proper books, Carlos feels he will be able to study more effectively and earn better grades. 

Carlos currently works 30 hours a week. With a career in food science, he expects to earn $39 a day, a substantial increase from before. With two older siblings attending college already, Carlos is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for books and school supplies.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.ru:
Родной город Осанны Сухуми(Грузия). В 1989 г. ей вместе с семьей пришлось покинуть этот город и переехать на Украину в г.Каменка-Днепровская. В Сухуми  началась война и поэтому Осанне пришлось оставить свой дом и родные места, чтобы сохранить своих детей и забыть ужасы войны. 

В Украине, в Каменке уже поселились несколько ее родственников и поэтому было не так страшно. Первые года приходилось трудно, так как нужно было начинать все с нуля. Занялись сельским хозяйством и жизнь стала налаживаться. Семья трудилась , строили теплицы, появились новые друзья. Очень помогали родственники. В этом вопросе они очень дружные, если случается беда, считают своим долгом явиться на помощь. 

Сейчас у Осанны отличное большое хозяйство, несколько теплиц. Однако клиентка не останавливается на достигнутом, продолжает улучшать и расширять бизнес и в этом году проводит отопление в теплицы. Большую помощь в развитии бизнеса оказывают ей кредиты "Надежды Украины". В этот раз Оксана купит отопительный котел и шланги за 40 тыс. грн., что поможет ей получить дополнительную прибыль и в следующем годурасширить свой бизнес еще - построить  большие теплицы.
texts.en:
Oksana had to leave her hometown of Sukhumi (Georgia). In 1989, together with her family they had to leave this city and move to Ukraine in the Kamenka, Dneiper region. In Sukhumi a war had begun and because of this Oksana had to leave her home and homeland to save her children and forget the horrors of war. 

Some relatives had already settled in Kamenka, Ukraine and because of this it was not so difficult. 

The first year was hard because they started with nothing. They started in agriculture and their life began to adjust. The family worked, built a greenhouse, and made new friends. Their relatives helped greatly. In this regard they are very friendly. If something bad happens, they consider it their duty to come to the rescue. 

Now Oksana has a great big farm, and a few greenhouses. However, this client does not stop there, she continues to improve and expand the business, and this year she will put heating in the greenhouses. A great deal of the help in business development loans came from "Hope Ukraine." This time Oksana is buying a boiler and pipes for 40 thousand Hryvnia, to help her become more profitable in the next year and expand her business - building a large greenhouse.

loans.use: to purchase heaters and install heating systems in green houses.

loans.name: Heum

texts.en: Bakan is a big district located in Pursat province. The most popular career is farming. One local farmer, Heum, owns and manages around two hectares of farmland for rice cultivation, from which she is able to generate a regular profit of KHR 30,000 per day to cover her daily household expenses. Furthermore, she still supports two school-age children who are living under her control. Currently, Heum would like to have a loan from HKL in the sum of KHR 1,000,000 to build a toilet to improve the sanitation of her family, as she doesn't have a safe toilet to use. Thanks to the water loan program offered by HKL and Kiva with a special interest rate, she is encouraged to focus on healthy living conditions, safeguarding the health of her family and protecting the environment.

loans.use: to build a toilet to improve the sanitation of her family.

loans.name: Chiep

texts.en:
Chiep, 50 years old, is a local farmer who has been living in Pursat province. She is married with seven children: one married and five single. Chiep is in the business of cultivating rice and has the support of her husband and children. From her hardships, she is able to make a suitable income of KHR 30,000 per day, which goes towards meals, commodities costs, and school allowances for her children. 

Currently, Chiep would like to borrow a loan from HKL in the sum of KHR 4,000,000 to build a toilet to improve the sanitation of her family, as she doesn't had a safe toilet to use in her household. Thanks to the water loan program offered by HKL and Kiva with a special interest rate, she is encouraged to focus on healthy living conditions, safeguarding the health of her family and protecting the environment.

loans.use: to build a toilet to improve the sanitation of her family.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
This is Remedios, 53, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Mario and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Remedios operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. She also has a food stall for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php800 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php8,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Remedios hopes that her business will be successful and dreams that her family will be happy and content.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Maria Ana

texts.en:
Maria Ana works hard to support her family. Maria Ana is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Maria Ana requested a 21,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Maria Ana has been in this business for 7 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her fish vending business.

In the future, Maria Ana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Agusta

texts.en:
Agusta is 49 years old and married with six children. With four children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Agusta runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like eggs, noodles, candies, vinegar, shampoo, etc. to sell in her general store.

Agusta has been in this business for 30 years, and sells a variety of items such as eggs, noodles, candies, vinegar, shampoo, etc. 

In the future, Agusta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like eggs, noodles, candies, vinegar, shampoo, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Caryn Joy

texts.en:
Caryn Joy is a 32-year-old married woman with one child who is in school. Caryn Joy has a direct selling personal collection products business in the Philippines;she is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Caryn Joy requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like lotion, body spray, bath soap, toothpaste, etc. to sell.

Caryn Joy has been in this business for three years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like lotion, body spray, bath soap, toothpaste, etc. to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vehicle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her vehicle for her vehicle transport business.

Emma has been in this business for 15 years. Emma earns additional income from running a general store.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her vehicle

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 41 years old, married, and has three children. With two children still in school, Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional products like milk, fabric softeners, shampoo, coffee, sugar, canned goods, etc., to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items such as milk, shampoo, coffee, sugar, canned goods, fabric softener, etc. 

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional products like milk, fabric softener, shampoo, coffee, sugar, canned goods, etc., to sell

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria works hard to support her family. Gregoria is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Gregoria requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

Gregoria has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Gregoria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 49 years old, married, and has three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Helen has a food vending business in the Philippines. Helen requested a 29,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like frozen foods, juice, etc., for her food vending business.

Helen has been in this business for 6 years. Helen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like frozen foods, juice, etc., for her food vending business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 38 years old, married, and has four children. With two children currently in school, Helen works very hard to provide for them.

Helen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Helen has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, sanitary napkins, snack foods, noodles, soy sauce, vinegar, etc. 

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to further their education.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy additional products for her variety store. Her loan also helped in the education of her children. Her income from her business assisted in their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.
